loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena se dedica al negocio de una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 20 años, primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a su hijo. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, enlatados, papel higiénico, detergentes y sopas. La señora posee el sueño de seguir creciendo con su negocio hasta convertirlo en una distribuidora.
texts.en: Doña Maria Elena runs a grocery store out of her home.  She started this business 20 years ago, initially selling sweets to children and then little by little reinvesting in her business so that she could sell bulk grains, which is what people buy most.  She says that her goal in establishing this business was to find an alternative means of supporting her son.  She is currently requesting this loan to buy bulk grains, sweets, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent and soup.  She dreams of continuing to expand her business until she has converted to selling bulk goods.

loans.use:
to buy bulk grains, sweets, canned goods, toilet paper, detergent and
soup.

loans.name: La Ilucion Group

texts.es: Banco D. emprendimiento  La Ilución entrando a su tercer ciclo conformado por 9 integrantes que viven en la localidad del Torno, en la zona Miraflores, todos cuentan con una actividad o servicio.   La presidenta es Sra. María vive en la zona hace unos 16 años en el Zona Miraflores Su actividad es la venta D. Cds y Dvds en el mercado central el torno y también trabaja como empleada domestica en un  condominio D. la zona hace 3 años,   su estado civil esta casada con el sr.  Víctor el cual es chofer y tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprar DVD por mayor en películas para niños, son una familia muy unida ambos aportan para los gastos del hogar, se sacrifican para sacar a sus hijos adelante, el deseo D. la Sra. es el D. poder ver a sus hijos profesionales, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
La Ilución Communal Bank, entering its third loan cycle, is maD. up of nine members who live in the town of El Torno, in the Miraflores area. All of them have a business or proviD. services. The president is Sra. Maria who has been living in the Miraflores area for some 16 years. Her business is selling CDs and DVDs in El Torno’s central market and she has also been employed as a domestic worker in a condominium in the area for the past 3 years. She is married to Sr. Victor, who is a chauffeur, and they have 3 school-aged children. With the money from this loan, she plans to buy DVDs of children’s films wholesale.  

She and her husband are a very united family: both contribute to household expenses and make sacrifices so their children can get ahead. Sra. Maria’s wish is to see her children become professionals. She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To buy DVDs of children's films

loans.name: Marata Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Mme Marata Elisabeth est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 50ans et le moins âgé a 26ans.01 va à l’école et elle a 13 personnes en charge.

Elle revend du dolo depuis 35ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de kouritenga.Ses clients sont ses voisins, ses amis, et toute personne qui fréquente son cabaret.

Mme veut s’acheter 05 canaris de dolo.

Elle aide à entretenir ses petits fils avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne se doter d’une parcelle pour préparer elle-même son dolo.
texts.en: Ms. Marata Elisabeth is a widow and the mother of four children. The eldest is 50 years old, and the youngest is 26. One of them goes to school. Marata has thirteen persons to support. She has been a retailer of dolo (a type of beer made from millet or sorghum) for 35 years. She gets her supplies at the Kouritenga market. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and anyone who comes to the cabaret.   Marata wants to buy five dolo jars. With her profits, she helps take care of her grandchildren. Her ambition is to gain a plot of land for making the dolo herself.

loans.use: to buy five 'dolo' jars

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a peddler of clothes, footwear and ladies wear in Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She wishes to increase the quantity of clothes she sells and needs a loan to purchase additional clothes to bring variety into her sales to meet the demands of her customers. Any increase that is realized from the sale of the clothes will be used to purchase a shop to display the clothes for sale. Ama is married to a driver and they have two children. Her business is five years old. Ama uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Rose has been selling corn dough (in the pan in front of her). She also prepares banku to sell. The dough is made from maize or corn. Demand for the corn dough is increasing. A loan from Kiva will be used to buy bags of maize to process into corn dough to sell. She hopes to reinvest the additional capital. 

She is married and has four children. She has received a senior high education. Her husband is a carpenter. As part of her responsibilities as a housewife, she assists her spouse in providing the basic needs of the home.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make corn dough

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married and has three children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. She has received a senior high level of education. She helps her partner to take care of the home.

Sophia trades in corn dough, cassava dough and charcoal at Takoradi. Her right hand is placed on the cassava dough she sells. She has been in this business for four years. She hopes to increase her sales and requests a loan to buy more cassava dough and bags of corn to make into dough for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cassava dough and bags of corn

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: In the picture above, Georgina is standing in her shop where a variety of sewing accessories (zippers, all types of buttons, lining materials, measuring tape and others) are displayed for resale. She needs a loan of 425 GHS to buy other kinds of sewing accessories for resale. Her increase will be reinvested back into the business for further growth. She is married and has one child.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of sewing accessories to sell

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: El señor Eugenio casado con la Sra. Dominga tiene 1 hijo que esta a su cargo, el tiene su tierra de 6 hectáreas en la banda del rio donde siembra yuca, papa, sandia pero también trabaja  con su camión sacando árido del rio como decir: piedra, ripio, arena para las construcciones, todo lo que el siembra lo saca personalmente para vender en los mercados directamente al consumidor para poder sacar ganancias de su capital, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que implica la siembra de yuca, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Eugenio and his wife, Sra. Dominga, have 1 child living at home.  He owns a 6-hectare farm on the river where he grows yucca, potatoes and watermelons.  He also uses his truck to haul dry materials from the river--stones, gravel and sand, for example--for sale to the construction industry.  He personally sells everything that he grows at local markets, directly to consumers, so that he can get the most for his hard work.  He will use this loan to buy the supplies he needs for his next yucca crop.  He is a friendly, hard-working man and he's grateful for the support the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha sells fried plantain and beans (red-red) at Takoradi in the western Region of Ghana. She has received a senior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is into fitting (repairing spoiled cars). Martha has been selling plantain and beans for eight. She helps her companion to pay utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more plantain and beans to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shade for the business.

loans.use: to buy more plantain and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells wax prints and other materials at Takoradi, Ghana. Mercy has been through senior high school. She is divorced and has two children.  She has been in this trade for 10 years. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to purchase additional wax prints to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional lengths of wax print to sell.

loans.name: Vincentia

texts.en:
Vincentia is married and has four children. Her husband is a tomato farmer. She has received senior high education. She helps her husband to pay utility bills with the income she makes from her sales.

She lives in Takoradi. In her vicinity, she supplies bags of charcoal to her customers, which she has done for 10 years. The loan she hopes to receive will be used to purchase more bags of charcoal. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario nació en Chuquisaca casado con la Sra. Eusevia tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, hace 19 años llegaron a la localidad del Torno Santa cruz y se quedaron pero tuvieron la suerte de conseguirse una parcela mediante el sindicato de la misma comunidad de Santo Corazón en la cual viven y trabajan agricultura siembra maíz, yuca, maní, el viene trabajando con Emprender desde hace 3 años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que implica la siembra de maiz, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario was born in Chuquisaca and he is married to Eusevia.  The couple have four school-age children.  19 years ago, they arrived in the town of Torno, Santa Cruz and stayed there.  They were lucky enough to acquire a plot of land through the union in the community of Santo Corazón in which they live.  They grow corn, cassava and peanuts on this land.

Mario has been working with Emprender for three years.  He will use his loan money to buy what he needs to sow his corn.  He is a very kind and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn and peanuts

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is 33 years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have two children aged seven years old and two years old. He runs a shoe sales business in Kakamega town. He has been in this business for three years. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 30,000 to increase his stock of shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a wholesale business and in the future, diversify into real estates business. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells food items like tomatoes, onions, spices, macaroni, salt and others at Takoradi in the western region of Ghana. Grace wants to increase her sales and so will be adding the loan to her initial capital to buy food items like onions, spices and macaroni to sell. Any form of increase will be invested in her children's education. 

She is married and has two children. Her husband is a vegetable seller. She responsibly assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

loans.use: to buy food items like onions, spices and macaroni to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: The picture above depicts Rose showing some corn dough she makes for sale at Takoradi. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a chef. Rose has been selling corn dough for 10 years. She helps her spouse to pay utility bills and other household expenditures. Her loan will be used to procure additional bags of maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to procure additional bags of maize.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has a child. Her husband is a security man. She has junior high educational background. Rose sells rice, sugar, Super Glue and soft drinks at Takoradi in the western region of Ghana, which she has done for 15 years. She uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses. 

Rose will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks and other items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks and other items for resale.

loans.name: Edward Lihanda

texts.en:
Edward is forty-nine years old and married to a housewife. They have four children aged between fifteen years old and five years old. He runs a general store at Kivagara in Kakamega. He has been in this business for six years. He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

Edward is using his loan of Kes 30,000 to increase his stock of maize and sugar to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a big supermarket. He also hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He describes himself as humble, social and persistent.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a single parent taking care of one child. She has been through junior high school. Victoria displays toffees, biscuits, Milo (cocoa powder) and other types of provisions on a table for sale. Victoria will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells Pampers by moving from one locality to another in Takoradi (Ghana). Her educational background is up to the junior high level. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a security man. 

Comfort has been in this business for four years. She helps to pay the school fees of her children as part of her responsibilities. Her loan will serve as an additional income to buy Pampers to sell. She hopes to build a shop from the increased income.

loans.use: to buy Pampers to sell.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is forty-six years old and married. Her husband is a teacher and they have nine children aged between twenty-four and ten years old. She runs a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, salt, bread, flour, cooking oil and others to the local people in Kakamega. She has been in this business for three years. She says that the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. 

Loida is using her loan of Kes. 40,000 to increase her stock of sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil, flour, etc. to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to the wholesale level. She also hopes to give a good education to her children. She describes herself as humble, bright and focused.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort operates a provisions shop were she sells varieties of items like bags of rice, Cerelac (baby cereal), powdered milk and others. She wants to increase the quantity of items she sells and so needs a loan to purchase more bags of rice, Cerelac and other provisions to meet the demand of her customers. The profit that will be realized as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into the business.  

She is married and has two children. Her husband is a photographer. Comfort has been selling provisions for eight years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, Cerelac, and other provisions.

loans.name: Antony Kamau

texts.en:
Antony is forty-two years old, married to a business-lady and they have five children aged between eighteen years old and five years old whom they wish to give a good education to the university level.

Antony runs a butcher shop which is located at a busy market known as Malinya in Kakamega. He has been running this business for the last four years and has managed to give employment to one person.

He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy bulls to sell as meat.

He hopes to grow his business and open other butcheries in Kakamega town. He hopes that in future he will purchase a plot of land on which he will put up rental houses. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy bulls to sell as beef.

loans.name: G.s. El Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: La señora Yanilda Del Carmen tiene 31 años. Ella se dedica al comercio de prendas de oro y plata. Algo que la ha afectado es la situación económica que atraviesa nuestro país debido a la falta de empleo. Aduce que su condición de vida en la familia ha mejorado ya que ha podido incrementar un poco los ingresos del hogar ya que ahora no solo su esposa trabaja. Yessica tiene 28 años. Su actividad es la venta de ropa usada y nueva. Ella desea establecer su propio negocio en su casa con vitrinas y más estabilidad, por lo que ese es su sueño. Candida Rosa tiene 27 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Su negocio que es la venta de verduras y frutas  y además de ello posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Josefina tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, leche, sopas. Sus éxitos recientes es que ha podido levantar su negocio con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Yanilda Del Carmen, 31, sells gold and silver items.  Something that has affected her is the economic situation the country is going through due to the lack of employment.  She feels that her family situation has improved a bit because she’s been able to increase household income somewhat since now it’s not just her husband who works.

Yessica is 28 years old.  She sells used and new clothes.  She wants to set up her own home-based business with display cases and more stability; this is her dream.

Cándida Rosa es 27 years old.  She has four minor children.  Her business is fruit and vegetable sales and she also has a small home-based grocery store.

Josefina is 27 years old, married and has no children yet.  The loan is to buy snacks, basic grains, milk, and soups.  Her recent successes are due to her being able to launch the business thanks to the loans.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Godfrey Omondi

texts.en:
Godfrey is forty-one years old, married, and they have four children aged between eighteen years old and four years old whom they wish to give a good education to the university level. He makes and sells tea and doughnuts by the roadside in a residential area in Nairobi. He has been running this business for the last four years.

He says that the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy flour to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a big restaurant in future. He describes himself as respectful and God-fearing.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Mónica Beatriz

texts.es:
Mónica es una joven madre soltera que tiene 26 años, su pequeño hijo apenas nació hace dos meses. Vive y trabaja junto a su madre María de 46 años. Viven en la parroquia de "Pacto" en el cantón de "San Miguel de Los Bancos". Esta parroquia se encuentra lejana a la cabecera cantonal, y es de difícil acceso. Nos cuenta que la población más cercana es a una hora del lugar donde residen. La vida es muy dura en esta parte de la provincia. Esta población rural carece de muchos servicios básicos, no tienen un hospital propio por lo que el nacimiento de los bebés es muy común que sean en sus casas atendidos por parteras.

Desde hace años los padres de Mónica fabricaban panela y hoy, siguiendo la tradición familiar ella también hace esta actividad. El padre de su hija le ayuda en algunas ocasiones, él es carpintero. La jornada de trabajo es muy dura, a veces se extiende hasta 18 horas consecutivas. Lo más difícil es cocinar el jugo de caña, esto requiere que en grandes calderos se mueva el jugo constantemente; es cocinado con fuego el cual es alimentado con el mismo desecho que se obtuvo al sacar el jugo de la caña, las altas temperaturas de esta actividad lo hacen un trabajo extenuante.

Mónica quiere renovar la rústica maquinaria que usan, de esta manera poder realizar las actividades con menor esfuerzo físico y así poder dedicar tiempo a su hijo quien pasa mucho tiempo solo por el trabajo de su madre.

Ella sueña con algún día tener una fábrica moderna, y que su hijo haya podido culminar sus estudios superiores, meta que ella no ha podido lograr por la enorme distancia que existe desde su casa hasta una universidad.
texts.en:
Mónica is a young single mother.  She’s 26 years old and her young son was born only 12 months ago.  She lives and works alongside her 46 year old mother, María.  They live in the “San Miguel de los Bancos” settlement of the “Pacto” parish.  This parish is located at the head of the settlement and access is difficult.  She says that the nearest population center is an hour from the place where they live.  Life here is very difficult and the people here are missing many basic services.  They don’t have their own hospital and childbirth at home with a midwife is very common.

For many years, Mónica’s parents made brown sugar and now, she follows this family tradition and also makes it.  Her daughter’s father is a carpenter and sometimes he helps her.  The work is very difficult, and sometimes she works for 18 hours straight.  The most difficult part is concentrating the sugar cane juice.  This required that it be stirred constantly in large cauldrons.  It’s heated by fire which is fed by the cane, once the juice is extracted.  The high temperatures make the work strenuous.

Mónica wants to replace the old machines that they use, so that they can do their work with less physical effort and be able to spend more time with her son.  He spends much time alone because of his mother’s work.

She dreams of having a modern factory someday, and for her son to complete his higher education.  She has not been able to achieve this goal because of the great distance between her home and the university.

loans.use: to buy new machinery.

loans.name: Las Dificiles Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Dificiles" y se ubica en el estado D. México. Esta comunidad se distingue porque cuenta con varias actividades economicas que fomentan el autoempleo. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la  10 vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Lourdes es integrante D. este grupo. Ella es originaria D. la comunidad y se dedica a la venta D. conejos; actividad que inició hace mas D. 8 años. Sus ventas las realiza en los alrededores D. su comunidad. La señora Louerdes comenta que su negocio le permitio salir adelante y atender los gastos y necesidades D. su familia, ella es casada tiene un hijo, busca dia a dia darle los valores a su hijo y fortaleza para seguir con sus estudios. Ella tiene 47 años, estudio la secundaria. Con el prestamo va a comprar conejos y alimento para su crianza, desea que con el prestamo su negocio se siga fortaleciendo. Actualmente  tiene la fe D. que saldra adelante y tener mas ventas que las que ahora tienen. Y así seguir logrando sus sueños y que su hijo llegue a tener una carrera que les permita tener una buena vida cuando construyan su propia familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Difíciles” and it is located in the State of Mexico. This community is distinguished by its variety of businesses that generate self-employment. The group is maD. up of ten members and this is the tenth time that they are requesting a loan. 

Señora Lourdes is a member of this group. She is originally from the community and she makes her living selling rabbits. She started the business more than eight years ago. She makes her sales around the community. Señora Lourdes mentioned that her business allows her to get ahead and take care of the expenses and needs of her family. She is married and has one child. Every day she tries to teach her child values and give him support to continue with his studies. She is 47 years old and completed secondary school.  

She will buy rabbits and feed to raise them with this loan. She hopes that with this loan her business will continue to be strengthened. She now has faith that she will get ahead and have more sales than she does now. This way she will be able to realize her dreams and her son will be able to have a career that lets him have a good life when he start his own family.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and feed to raise them.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells sugarcane, plantains and plastics at Takoradi in the western region of Ghana, which she has done for 7 years. Ekua anticipates expanding her business, and a loan will serve as additional income which will be added to her initial capital to  purchase more sugarcane to sell. Her business plan for the next few years to come is to build a shop where she can display varieties of fruits to sell.  

She is married and has four children. She has been through junior high school. Ekua’s husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

loans.use: to  purchase more sugarcane to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba has received a junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works at a factory. He helps her feed, dress, and educate their children.

Aba sells food stuffs such as plantains (ripe and unripe) and cassava at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy plantains, cassava, and other types of food stuffs requested by her customers. She hopes to use the additional profits from her business to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items (such as plantains and cassava) requested by her customers

loans.name: Chicas Alegres De Moyo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Chicas Alegres D. Moyo" se ubica en el estado D. Puebla en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Norma es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. zapatos que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar zapatos D. diferentes modelos y colores que le solicitan sus clientes que ya tiene comprometidos, tiene 40 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, ella es madre soltera y tiene en total 3 hijos. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada. Quiere tener mas clientes y brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This group is called "Chicas Alegres D. Moyo" and is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico. The group is maD. up of 9 members. Mrs. Norma is the group president. She sells shoes, a business that she started three years ago. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of shoes of different models and colours. Her customers requested these shoes and she has already promised to supply them. She is 40, studied up to high school, and is a single mother of three. At the time of requesting this loan she feels enthusiastic. She wants to have more customers and proviD. a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes of different models and colours.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina has received a senior high education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a tailor.

The picture above shows Philomina selling oranges, fante kenkey, and loaves of bread at Takoradi. Her business is approximately 5 years old. Because the price of maize keeps increasing, her loan will be used to buy sacks of maize so that she can make more kenkey. She hopes to use the additional profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To make more kenkey by purchasing additional sacks of maize.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has a senior high educational background. Cecilia assists her husband in the general upkeep of their home.

To earn money, she sells smoked fish at Takoradi, in the western region of Ghana, which she has done for 10 years. Her desire is to increase the quantity of her smoked fish. The requested loan would aid her desire to increase her fish business's sales by enabling her to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the additional profits from an expanded business, Cecilia plans to provide a meaningful education for children.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do repairs and renovation.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single parent taking care of five dependants. She makes tea and serves it with fried eggs and bread at Effiakuma, which is near Takoradi. She has operated her business for 5 years. She explains that her typical customers are those who were unable to eat their breakfast at home in the morning.

Grace will use the requested loan proceeds to purchase beverages for her business. Grace plans to reinvest any additional profits from an expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional beverages for her business.

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es: Jean Carlos, tiene la edad 24 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su señora esposa e hijo. El con el crédito va a comprar una motocicleta. El trabaja como técnico en redes por lo cual necesita una moto para facilitar su trasporte a diferentes lugares y así poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y dar el resultado esperado a su jefe. El también utilizara esta moto para el trasporte de su casa al trabajo y así poder cumplir y estar a tiempo a la hora de entrada. El espera con la compra de la moto desempeñarse mejor como trabajador y así poderle dar a su familia una vida estable y segura en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos, aged 24, lives in a civil union with his wife and son.  With the loan, he is going to buy a motorcycle. He works as a network technician, which means he needs a bike for easy transportation to different locations so that he can better serve his customers and deliver the expected results to his boss. He will also use this bike for transportation from home to work, and so be able to be on time to start work. He expects that with the purchase of the bike, he will be able to perform better as a worker, and so can give his family a safe and stable life in the future.  

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans previously through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better facilities and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Saadatu

texts.en:
Saadatu is a widow with six children. She sells waakye (a rice and beans delicacy) at Takoradi. This dish is normally served with other ingredients, including boiled eggs, macaroni, salad, hot black pepper sauce, and tomato sauce. She explains that her business is 3 years old.

She would like to use the requested loan proceeds to buy rice and beans, which will be used to make additional waakye for her customers. She plans to reinvest any additional profits back into the business.

loans.use: To make waakye for her customers by purchasing rice and beans.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is divorced and has one child. She sells wax prints at Takoradi, which she has done for 15 years. She gets support form her ex-husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses. Amina will use the loan to purchase more wax prints to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Amina plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more lengths of wax print to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is married and has four children. She has received senior high education. Emelia sells items like soft drinks, canned fish, canned tomatoes, different types of soaps and others at Takoradi in the western region of Ghana, which she has done for 15 years. She will use the loan to purchase canned fish, soaps and other items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to plough back the profit.

loans.use: to purchase canned fish, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Brenda Isabel

texts.es:
Brenda madre soltera, trabajadora, sus hijos estudian,  mujer trabajadora, emprendedora tiene su propio negocio, venta de fritangas, tortillas, queso, cuajada s entre otros productos. Su negocio lo inicio con fondos de microcréditos,  sus planes son acondicionar la casa e invertir en su negocio contratando personas que le trabaje ofrecerle a sus clientes otros productos.
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como; cemento, arena, piedrines,  baldosa cerámica,  yeso, cemento de anclaje, crema marfil entre otros productos para repellar y embaldosar la casa.  Agradece a la financiera por contribuir al cambio de nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Brenda is a hard working single mother.  Her children are in school.  A hard working, enterprising woman, she has her own business selling fried fast food, tortillas, cheese and cottage cheese, among other items.  She started her business with funds from micro loans.  Her plans are to do some home improvements and invest in her business hiring people to work and to offer her customers other products.

She will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand, gravel, ceramic tile, grout, plaster, binding cement, marble tile, among other products to plaster the walls and install tile flooring throughout the house.  She is grateful to the financial institution for contributing to her change in standard of living.

loans.use: to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Hajia

texts.en: Hajia is married and has four children. Her husband is a tailor. She operates a provisions shop at Effiakuama near Takoradi, the Western Region of Ghana. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She helps her partner to educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy additional provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional provisions for sale.

loans.name: Las Libertadoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las libertadoras", esta ubicado en el estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora Antonia es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 21 años, un hijo de 2 años de edad y estudio asta la secundaria, ella se dedica a la reposteria que inicio hace 2 años junto con su marido. Solicita el prestamo para comprar materia como leche, azucar, frutas, huevos etc. para elaborar sus postres. Ella se encarga de vender pasteles y postres ya que en su comunidad no hay una pasteleria cercana. La señora elabora sus pasteles y demas productos de forma tradicional y rodumentaria en su casa con utencilios basicos. Con las ganancias quiere poder terminar la construccion de su casa y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. La señora se encuentra muy entusiasmada por la oportunidad que le ofrecen.
texts.en: This group is called "Las Libertadoras". It is located in the state of Mexico. The group is made up of 9 members, and this is the second time that they are requesting a loan. Mrs. Antonia is the group president. She is 21 and has one 2-year-old child. She studied up to high school. She is a baker, a business which she started two years ago with her husband. She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as milk, sugar, fruit, eggs, etc. to make her desserts. She sells pastries and desserts because there is no nearby bakery in her community. She makes her cakes and other products the traditional way, rudimentarily, in her home with basic utensils. With her earnings, she wants to be able to finish the construction of her house and support her children in their studies. She is very delighted by the opportunity that you are offering her.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Zanabu

texts.en: Zanabu is married and has two children. She has been through junior high school. She is a seamstress at Takoradi, a trade she has practiced for 10 years. Her husband also works. The loan will be used to buy wax prints, thread, zips, buttons, needles and other sewing materials to sew clothing for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zanabu plans to reinvest the profit.

loans.use: to buy wax prints, thread, zips, buttons, needles and other sewing materials to sew clothing for sale.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 36 years old and is married, with seven children between twenty and two years old. She and her husband hope to give them a good education to the university level. She sells fruits and vegetables by the roadside at a residential area in Nairobi. Caren has been running this business for thirteen years now. She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of kes 20,000 to build a shelter where she will run her business.  Currently, she displays the vegetables in the open air.
In the future, she hopes to expand her business to wholesale. She describes herself as a very ambitious lady.

loans.use: to build a shelter where she will run her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells charcoal in both large and small quantities at Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Comfort has been selling charcoal for just two years. She wants to increase her sales; a loan will enable her to purchase more charcoal to be able to make more sales. Her future plan concerning her business is to be able to supply to other customers in larger quantities.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to be able to make more sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells crates of eggs, soft drinks, Pampers, biscuits, Milo (breakfast drink powder), and powdered milk at Effiakuma near Takoradi. She is married and has three children. Her husband works at a factory. As part of her marital duties she pays the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy creates of eggs, soft drinks and Milo for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs, soft drinks and Milo for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, tiene la edad 52 de  años, está casada y vive con sus 2 nietos solamente.  Ella pretende con el crédito comprar los materiales para la mejora de su hogar en la parte de la cocina. Ella cuenta con la casa propia y quiere darle una mejora a su cocina pues se encuentra en mal estado. Ella lo que quiere es darle  una mejor presentación y mayor seguridad a sus electrodomésticos que se encuentran en ella, pues son muy importantes para la realización de las tareas de cocinar para su bienestar y la de sus nietas. Ella tiene como meta tener su hogar seguro y con el mejor mantenimiento posible y así mantenerla en el mejor estado de la vivienda. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miriam, 52, is married and lives just with her two grandchildren.  She intends to use the loan to buy materials to do some home improvements in the kitchen area.  She has her own house and she wants to improve the kitchen which is in bad condition.  What she wants to do is make it more attractive and provide security for her home appliances that are located in it because they are very important for the food preparation tasks for herself and her granddaughters.

Her goal is to have a safe home and with the best possible maintenance so that she can keep it in the best possible state.  This is her first loan from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: In the wooden structure seen above, Cynthia has some bananas displayed. She sells different kinds of fruit at Takoradi. Cynthia has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other kinds of fruit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Julliet

texts.en: Julliet is married and has four children. She sells men's wear, sacks of water, "gari" (which is made from cassava), and roasted groundnuts at Takoradi, which she has done for 7 years. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Julliet uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenditures. She will invest the loan in the bulk purchasing of men’s wear. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase men’s wear in bulk.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est commerçante, né au Rwanda.et elle est mariée, elle a  45 ans, elle a 5 enfants entre 8 ans et 26 ans et un enfant va à l’école, elle a deux ans des études primaire. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des poissons pour les revendre aux marches locales. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est  améliore la qualité de service qu’elle donnée et minimise les couts  pour attire la clientèle. Pour ses ambitions elle voudrait devenir une grande commerçante dans la région de grands lacs, construire des  maisons pour sa famille ,payer le minerval de ses enfants et  les faire soigner. Elle fait aussi l’agriculture.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a merchant who was born in Rwanda. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children, aged 8 to 26. One of the children attends school. Madeleine has a second grade education. This loan cycle is her first one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy some fish for resale at the local markets. 

Her strategy for business growth is to improve the quality of service she provides and to minimize costs in order to attract customers. As for her ambitions, she would like to become a major merchant in the Grands Lacs region, to build a house for her family, to pay the school fees for her children, and to take care of them. Madeleine is also a farmer.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale at the local markets

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina sells fruit, clothes and aluminum pans by peddling in the vicinity of Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She has received junior high education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is into wood products. 

Ernestina has been in this business for four years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more clothes and pans for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and pans for resale.

loans.name: Lluvia Dorada De Ixtlahuaca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Lluvia Dorada" y se ubica en el estado de México. La comunidad se distingue porque una de las actividades productivas que predominan en el lugar es el de la Agricultura, ganadería y comercio de telas, ropa. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicita un prestamo. La señora Irene es integrante de este grupo. Ella es originaria de la comunidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes; sus clietes la prefieren por su buen servicio y amabilidad que tiene con la gente. Quiere este prestamo para comprar enlatados, refrescos y productos de limpieza. Ella comenta que su negocio le permite salir adelante y buscar una mejor estabilidad economica con el esfuerzo de sobresalir hacer mas grande su negocio y meter mas variedad en sus productos. Esto le permite continuar inviertiendo para ir creciendo poco a poco, ya que con su esposo luchan para salir en su economia familiar. Observaciones la señora que salio volteada se llama Norma y la señora Victoria.
texts.en:
This group is called "Lluvia Dorada" (Golden Rain) and it is located in the State of Mexico.  The local community is noted for its main business activities which are farming, livestock raising and selling fabrics and clothes.

This group has 11 members and this is the second time they have requested a loan.  Irene is a member of the group.  She is originally from this community and her business is selling groceries.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because of the good customer service she provides and the kindness that she shows people.  She would like this loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and cleaning products.  She says that her business allows her to get ahead in life and seek better financial stability.  She makes efforts to do well, increase the size of her business and stock it with a greater variety of products.  This enables her to continue investing so that her business grows gradually.  Irene and her husband work hard to improve their family's financial situation.

n.b. The lady who is turned around in the picture is called Norma.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and cleaning products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and has three children. She sells charcoal at Takoradi, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a mason. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Mary will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is divorced and has two children. She is a hairdresser at Takoradi. Esther uses her income to supplemnet that of her ex-husband in feeding, educating and clothing the children. Esther will use the loan to purchase hair extensions, creams and other products to use on her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, creams and other items to use on her customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old and single. She operates a small retail business selling an assortment of goods which includes snacks, spices, clothes, etc. She has been running this business for five years now. She says that the business is profitable, and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of kes 80,000 to add to the stock of snacks, clothing and spices in order to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into wholesale and put up her own premises, where she will not be paying rent. She also hopes to build a residential house for herself. She describes herself as jovial and welcoming.

loans.use: to buy clothes, snacks, spices etc

loans.name: Tatiana Karina

texts.es:
Tatiana es una mujer soltera de 33 años, vive sola con su pequeño hijo de 5 años en el cantón de San miguel de los Bancos. Siempre tuvo una vida tranquila, la que comúnmente se tiene en las poblaciones rurales. Desde la llegada de su hijo se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar y así poder sustentar sus necesidades.

Hace tres años ella puso su criadero de cerdos, los mismos que son faenados para vender su carne. Este trabajo lo realizaba el padre de su hijo y ella aprendió para luego hacer el negocio sola. Ella cría a los cerdos ó los compra listos para faenarlos, y los días en los que acude al camal lo debe hacer a la madrugada, de esta manera la carne que es comprada por los intermediarios puede ser vendida en las ferias temprano en la mañana. El lugar donde tiene a los cerdos es precario y alcanzan pocos. No tiene reja y por ello debe amarrarlos. Por esta razón ella necesita un crédito y así poder arreglar su criadero.

Como toda madre, todos los esfuerzos los hace por dar una mejor vida a su hijo. Tatiana únicamente ha cursado la primaria y desea ver algún día profesional a su hijo.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a 33 year old single mother and lives alone with her 5 year old son in the “San Miguel de los Bancos” settlement.  She’s always had a simple life, as is common in rural areas, but once her son came, she saw the need to begin working to be able to provide for him.

Three years ago she began raising pigs.  Her son’s father used to do this work, but she later learned how to do it on her own.  She either raises the pigs or buys them to butcher them.  When she does this, it must be done by early morning so that the meat can be sold to wholesalers so that they can resell it early in the morning.  Her pigpen is small and only holds a few pigs.  It doesn’t have a gate and she must keep them tied up.  She needs this loan in order to fix up her pigpen.

Like any mother, all of her efforts are so that she can give a better life to her son.  Tatiana only completed elementary school and wants her son to someday have a professional career.

loans.use: to repair her pigpen.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a provisions shop at Elmina. She is a widow taking care of eight children. Efua has been selling provisions for 18 years. The income she makes from her sales is used to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells charcoal, fish and groundnut paste at Dabir near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. In the picture, Nana has some items bagged (in the tray on the plastic container and in the container in her hand). She is divorced and has seven children. She has been in this business for 16 years; she wants to increase the quantity of groundnut paste produced and so needs a loan to buy bags of groundnuts to make groundnut paste. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts to make groundnut paste.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad 57 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su señora esposa. El va a comprar con su crédito los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de sus siembras de tomate y chile. El cuenta con la siembra de tomate y chile ya establecida en un área de excelentes condiciones por lo cual quiere asistirla y poder obtener mejores resultados de ella. El tiene como meta obtener una buena cosecha de estos cultivos y fortalecer su proyecto cada día más y si es posible ir creciendo con su proyectico. También el quiere generar las ganancias para así salir adelante con los pagos del crédito y seguir dándole una buena calidad de vida  a su señora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 57 years old, and lives in a civil union with his wife.  He is going to use the loan to buy the supplies needed to care for his tomato and chili pepper crops.  He relies on these tomato and chili pepper crops.  He has already established them in an area with excellent conditions, to which he wants to attend and improve his results.   His goal is to have a good harvest from these crops and to strengthen his project every day, and if possible to grow with his project.  He also wants to generate profits in order to get ahead with the loan repayments and to continue to provide a good quality of life for his wife. 

This is his first loan received through FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans previously through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his tomato and chili pepper crops.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells cooked rice, salt and fried fish at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Nana has been in this business for 10 years. She helps her spouse to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to acquire rice to cook and fish to fry for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to acquire rice to cook and fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Monicah Wanjiku

texts.en:
Monica is a single lady and has one child who is three years old. Monica owns a small retail shop selling breads, sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, drinking water, and sweets. She has been running this business for 4 years. She says that the business is good and the major challenge she has is financial constraints.  

She is using her loan of kes 20,000 to add such items as sugar, flour, cooking fat, detergents, beverages, etc., in order to offer more products to her customers.  She hopes to grow her business to wholesale and, in the future, build rental houses. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking fat, detergents, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama prepares "banku" (fermented corn dough) locally called “etew”. She also sells palm oil. She wishes to increase her sales as demand for the "banku" has increased. A loan will help her acquire more bags of maize to make corn dough for the "banku". The revenue from her sales will be used to build a restaurant. She is divorced and has six children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to make corn dough for "banku".

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 52 years old, married and has two children. She owns a clothing sales business at Thika. She has been running this business for four years now and has two employees. Rahab intends to use her loan to purchase more clothes to grow her business while meeting the demands of her customers. She hopes to open another clothing sales business within Thika town. She describes herself as focused and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy personal grooming items for resale

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui a ouvert à domicile une boutique de commercialisation de denrées de consommation courante pour soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux mais aussi pour satisfaire ses propres besoins.Elle pratique en même temps l'embouche ovine afin d'augmenter ses revenus. Pour préparer les fêtes religieuses des mois à venir durant lesquels la demande est très forte sur le marché du bétail,elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000F pour acheter 05 moutons "peul peul" qu'elle va engraisser et revendre .Elle ambitionne de construire une grande alimentation devant son domicile.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman who has opened a shop in her home for selling typical consumer goods in order to support her husband to meet family needs. But she also does it to support herself. At the same time, she raises sheep to increase her income. In preparation for the religious holidays in the months to come, during which the demand is very high at the livestock market, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy five head of "peul peul" sheep, which she is going to fatten and resell. Her ambition is to build a large store in front of her home.

loans.use: to buy five sheep

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: In the photo, Aba has displayed some used clothing on the ground and on her lap for resale. She is divorced and has 5 children. Aba uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. She will use the loan to purchase additional used clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a young single man and does not have any children yet. He operates a shoe sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been running this business for the last four years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to increase his stock of shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future and move to a bigger premise in the Nairobi Central Business District. He describes himself as honest and focused.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: The picture above shows Yaa selling fried fish at Elmina. She acquires the fish from the market, cleans them and fries them in oil for resale. She is divorced. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry and sell. Her future plan towards her business is to reinvest her profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa sells charcoal and palm nut oil at Elmina. She washes the palm fruit and boils them until they become soft and tender. She scoops the cooked fruit into a big mortar and gently pounds with a pestle to avoid damaging the nut. Water is then added to the pounded fruit. The mixture of water and the pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and the chaff removed. The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires. The juice is boiled again and as it boils, the fresh oil will float to the surface of the pot. The oil is scooped into yet another pot and left to cool. 

Fresh oil from palm fruits is traditionally used in eating roasted yams or plantains in Africa – especially on the farms after a hard day's work. Palm oil is the preferred type of cooking oil, because Ghanaians like its consistency and flavor. It is used in most traditional dishes. 

Abenawa is divorced and has 7 children. She has been in this trade for 10 years. She is solely responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to purchase more palm fruits to process to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits to process to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has three children. Efua sells "wakye" and doughnuts at Elmina, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a farmer. "Wakye" is a traditional rice dish in Ghana. To prepare wakye, Efua gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish colour. Then, she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender enough to eat. Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari (cassava couscous), salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish, or meat.

Efua assists her husband with her income by providing daily food for the family. Efua will use the loan to purchase beans, rice, flour and other items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, flour, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells various items such as palm oil, "gari" (cassava couscous) and maize at Dabir near Elmina. In the photograph she is touching one of the bags of maize. She is married and lives together with her six children. Her husband is a farmer. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize so she can meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: These jerrycan containers are being used by Ekua to store palm oil. Ekua is a palm oil extractor. She also sells beans and "gari" (cassava couscous), which she has done for 12 years. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruits to process for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has five children. She makes "banku" (fermented corn dough) at Elmina for sale. She moves from one place to another to make her sales. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua will use the loan to purchase maize for the "banku". She anticipates reinvesting her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase maize for her "banku".

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a "chop bar" (a place for eating different types of food) at Elmina. Efua has five children. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy cassava, plantains, palm fruits and other food items to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better eating place.

loans.use: to buy cassava, plantains, palm fruits and other food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua buys rice, oil, and soap in large quantities and sells them to customers who live in the vicinity at Elmina. She is married and assists her husband with feeding, clothing, and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy rice and soap for sale. Her future plan regarding her business is to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase rice and soap for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua produces palm oil in Elmina. She is divorced and has three children.  Her business is eight years old. She wants to increase the magnitude of oil production with her loan, which she will use to buy more palm fruits to process into oil for sale.

With the help of her ex-husband, Ekua pays the utility bills of the home. Any additional income will be reinvested into the business.

loans.use: to purchase  palm fruits to process into oil for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a seamstress who is married to a farmer as well as a teacher at Elmina. Ama has a child. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy materials, zippers, buttons and others to make clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials, zippers, buttons and others to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married to a teacher and they live together with their four children. She sells beans and ripped plantain (red-red) at Elmina, which she has done for 12 years. Her husband is a teacher. Adjoa uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell.  Adjoa plans to plow back the new profits into her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to cook to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba makes Fante kenkey, fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves, to sell. She is divorced and has five children. She sees to the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy maize to make kenkey. She hopes to use the profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize to make kenkey for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy auto spare parts

loans.name: Mery

texts.en:
Mery makes palm kernel oil for sale in Elmina. She is divorced and has two children. She gets assistance from her husband in taking care of the children.

Her loan will be used to buy palm nuts to make oil for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land. The photograph above shows the pot filled with palm nuts being processed into oil.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts to make oil for resale.

loans.name: Verónica Lucía

texts.es:
En San Miguel de los Bancos vive Verónica, una joven mujer de 24 años quien reside con sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad. Es soltera y trabaja sola para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y cerdos, con lo cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y cumplir con sus necesidades. Esta actividad la aprendió de su hermana quien tuvo la iniciativa de realizarla, a atravezado muchas dificultades, en una ocación una peste mató a los polllitos bebés obligandola a empeazr casi de cero. A pesar de las adversidades Verónica realiza su trabajo con mucho optimismo, enseña a sus hijos lo hermoso de la naturaleza. 

Su trabajo es criar pollos y cerdos para luego faenarlos y vender su carne, es un trabajo muy sacrificado. El poco tiempo que libre que tiene se dedica a las tareas del hogar y compartir con sus pequeños hijos. También le gusta practicar deportes y en si actividades al aire libre.

Verónica desea invertir, quiere comprar más pollitos y cerdos para incrementar sus ingresos. Por ello Verónica necesita un crédito, de esta manera estar un poquito más cerca de su sueño que es tener una casa propia con un espacio grande para sus animales.
texts.en:
Verónica lives in “San Miguel de los Bancos.”  She’s 24 years old and lives with her two young children, ages two and seven.  She’s single and works on her own to support her household.

She’s been raising pigs and chickens for the past four years and through this has been getting her children ahead and meeting their needs. She learned this activity from her sister who had the initiative.  She’s faced many difficulties.  On one occasion a plague killed all the chicks, forcing her to start almost from zero.  Despite these adversities, Verónica does her work with great optimism and teaches her children the beauty of nature.

Her work raising chickens and pigs and selling their meat requires lots of sacrifice.  She uses what little spare time she has to work on the household chores and spend time with her young children.  She also likes to play outdoor sports.

Verónica wants to buy more chickens and pigs in order to increase her income.  She needs a loan in order to be a little closer to her dream, which is to have her own home with a large space for her animals.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells second-hand bags as a peddler in Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is divorced and has seven children. Her ex-husband assists her in taking care of the children. Her loan will be used to buy second-hand bags to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bags to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "NUEVA ESPERANZA" se encuentra en su noveno ciclo , el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias la tesorera es la señora Julia, quien convive con su pareja hace ya bastante tiempo,  con tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su actividad económica es la venta D. productos para el hogar en su tienda D. barrio, donD. le va muy bien es una persona muy responsable por este motivo fue seleccionada por sus compañeras para ser la tesorera del grupo, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería para surtir su tienda como ser abarrotes, refrescos galletas, etc. La Sra. julia esta agradecida con al institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank is in its ninth cycle.  Its members are responsible, hardworking people.  This communal bank is represented the following people.  Its Treasurer is Julia.  She’s been living with her spouse for quite some time and with their three children who are school age.  Her economic activity is selling articles for the home in her neighborhood store.  She does very well there because she’s a very responsible person and this is why her fellow members selected her to be group treasurer.  She will use the loan money to buy merchandise, like groceries, soft-drinks, cookies, etc., to stock the store.  Julia is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Las Elegidas Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento "LAS ELEGIDAS" se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco de Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias la Presidenta la señora Janeth quien convive con su pareja ya bastante tiempo, la Sra. Janeth se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada su pareja es albañil contratista, tienen 2 hijos pequeños, que necesitan cuidados, la Sra. se dedica a vender y también a cuidar a sus hijitas, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por mayor ropa de temporada y así  incrementar su capital, vive en  alquiler zona Valle Hermoso, es una persona muy trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The venture bank "LAS ELEGIDAS" ("THE CHOSEN WOMEN") is in its second lending cycle.  It is made up of responsible and hard-working women.   This venture bank is represented by the following member: the President, Señora Janeth, who has been living with her ​​partner for quite some time.   Señora Janeth works selling seasonal clothing, and her partner is a construction contractor.  They have two small children who need to be looked after.  The Señora makes her sales, and also cares for her small daughters.  With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise of additional seasonal clothing and thereby increase her capital.

She lives in a rental in the Valle Hermoso (Beautiful Valley) area.  She is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support being offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of additional seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Maria de profesion costurera con mas de diecisiete años, laborando en la costura, ha logrado el apoyo economico para su familia, siendo su esposo albañil.
Trabajo de cocinera, en años atrás, pero este negocio actual le permite cuidar de su casa tambien. Pues tiene muchos clientes que le piden encargos, ya que hace mucha ropa para niña y niños, es por eso, que recurio al financiamiento en Afodenic para poder cubrir su demanda de ropa, ya que su capital, no era lo suficiente. 
Hoy en dia, esta produciendo mas ropa, ente ellos los pedidos, y con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de secenta yardas de sincatez azul, dacron blanco, cuarenta yardas de tela soccer, ziper, hilos, botones, foros de cuellos, y foro de botones.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a seamstress by profession with over seventeen years working in sewing.  She has managed to provide financial support for her family, her husband being in construction.

She worked as a cook some years earlier, but this business allows her to also take care of her home.   She has many customers who place orders, and she makes a lot of clothes for girls and children.  This is why she is requesting financing through Afodenic, in order to meet the demand for clothing, as her capital was no longer sufficient.

Today, she is producing more clothing, including the orders she has received.  This new loan will be for the purchase of sixty yards of blue fabric, white Dacron,  forty yards of soccer fabric, zippers, thread, buttons, collars, and collar buttons.

loans.use: to buy fabric to continue offering her sewing, and to get better revenue results.

loans.name: Teresiah Moraa

texts.en: Teresiah is a married lady. She runs a banana sales business. She has been in this business and says that the business is profitable and the major challenges she has is financial constraints since transportation of bananas in large quantities is cumbersome. She is using her loan of KES 15,000 to buy bananas to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She describes herself as very hardworking lady.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Marisela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marisela es comerciante en venta de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos, inicio hace cuatro años, con dinero de su liquidacion de su trabajo anterior, es madre soltera de un niño de dos años, lo que al tener su negocio, le ayudado a cuidar mas tiempo a su hijo, el cual cuenta con el apoyo de su mama que es donde vive.
Sus ventas las hace al credito y al contado, tiene mucha demanda con lo encargos, de sus clientes, lo que con este nuevo prestamo invertira en ropa de dama y caballero variada como ropa interior, cosmeticos, logrando aumentar las ventas, al comprar variedad para sus clientes.  A si como cubrir sus gastos personales, como sus compromisos de pagos.
texts.en:
Marisela is a clothing, shoes and cosmetics merchant.  She started four years ago with money from her severance pay at her previous job.  She’s a single mother of a two-year-old son.  Having her own business has allowed her to care for her son for a longer time.  She gets help from her mother and lives with her.

She sells both for cash and on credit.  She has a high demand for pending orders from customers so will use this new loan to buy assorted women’s and men’s clothing, like underwear and cosmetics to increase sales by having a variety of goods available for customers as well as covering her personal expenses, like payment obligations.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Patrick Ngotho

texts.en: Patrick is 47 years old and married with three children between eight years old and three months old. He hopes to give the children a quality education to the university level. He runs a butcher shop in Gatundu and is served by the Thika Branch. He has been running this business for the last 15 years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy three bulls for meat to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to open other butcher shops in the future. He describes himself as very patient.

loans.use: to purchase theee bulls for beef

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 28 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have one child aged eleven months old.  She runs a mobile money transfer services business, normally known as M-pesa here in Kenya. Besides this business, she does photocopying and sells cereals. She has been in business for the last three years and hires two employees. She says that the business is profitable and her major challenge is financial constraints. 

Nancy is using her loan of KES 50,000 as float for her business. She hopes to grow her business. She also hopes to give her child a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and God-fearing.

loans.use: to have enough float for her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La señora Reina oriunda del torno D. Santa Cruz, vive con el sr. Pablo tienen tres hijos, viven en su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en el barrio los amigos localidad D. puerto rico,  su actividad económica es venta D. comidas, hace cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad donD. le va muy bien, el destino del crédito es para la compra D. un frízer para mantener sus insumos en buen estado, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, ya que la Sra. Reina es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas D. superación, siempre pensando en el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en: Reina lives in Santa Cruz with her husband Pablo and their three children, where they have their own home in a neighborhood called Puerto Rico.  Reina sells food for a living and has done so for the past 4 years, successfully building up a client base.  She seeks this credit to buy a freezer, to help her keep the food she prepares fresh.  Reina is very pleased to participate with the communal lender and is a hardworking woman always seeking the betterment of her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Samuel Warui

texts.en:
Samuel is 41 years old, married, and they have three children aged between fifteen years old and five years old whom they would like to give quality education to the university level.

Samuel runs a shop in which he sells second-hand auto spare parts. He has been running this business for the last ten years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has are financial constraints.

He is using his loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy auto spare parts to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in future own many auto spare parts shops. He describes himself as very patient and persistent.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks in large quantities to take advantage of a bulk discount

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Doña Maura, tiene su propio negocio, venta de ropa usada y alquiler de casa. Lo que vino aumentando su inversion en todos estos diez años de venta, con dinero propio y prestamos en Afodenic.
Sus ventas la realiza al norte del pais, quien cuenta con su hermana ha ubicar la mercancia, y en su casa de habitacion. Teniendo mucha clientela. Hoy con este nuevo prestamo comprara: paca de sabana de primera,paca de ropa mixta premium, paca de ropa para niños.
Lo cual espera vender en corto tiempo, y seguir invirtiendo, logrando estabilidad y equilibrio en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maura has her own business selling used clothes and renting the house.  With her own money and with loans from Afodenic her investment has grown in the past ten years that she has been selling.

She makes her sales to the north of the country.  Her sister locates the merchandise and keeps it in her home.  She has a lot of customers.  

Now with the new loan she will buy a bundle of first-class sheets, a bundle of premium mixed clothes, and a bundle of children’s clothes.  She plans on selling these items in a short amount of time.  She plans to keep investing and achieving stability and balance in her sales.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of sheets, and a bundle of mixed clothes in order to sell more and to have more to sell.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
