Elsa es comerciante, tiene una pulperia en su casa, en donde ha venido trabajando con mas capital, al obtener prestamo en Afodenic. Lo que comenzo con pocos productos e iniciativa propia.
Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo, quien se dedica al comercio de venta de chatarra. Doña Elsa como objetivo es invertir en mas, productos de aseo personal, granos basicos y seguir logrando mejores ganancias, y asi pagar sus compromiso de pago, como gastos basicos y personales.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: quintal de arroz, frijoles, azucar, maiz,vidon de aceite, productos lacteos, productos de coca cola, golosinas, productos medicinales en panadol, dolofin, higado sanil, zepol vipaporruc, cofal fuerte entre otros que son productos que tienen mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Elsa is a businesswoman, and she has a store in her house.  Upon receiving the loan from Afodenic she has been working in her store with more capital.  She has support from her children and her husband.  He sells scrap metal.

Elsa’s objective is to invest more in personal hygiene products and basic grains and to continue to get better earnings.  That way she will meet her payment obligations like basic and personal expenses.

With this new loan she will buy a “quintal” (about 100 pounds) of sugar, a quintal of corn, a drum of oil, dairy products, coca cola products, sweets, medicinal products like acetaminophen, ibuprofen, digestive aids, unguents for colds, and creams to heal and relieve muscular problems, among other products that are in much demand.

loans.use: to buy basic products and other products that sell the most to continue selling to her customers.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Don Efrain de profesion primer oficial labora al estado como funcionario publico, tiene mas de veintitres años laborando para el bien de las comunidades, en donde a traves de estudios, ha venido logrando mejores condiciones. 

Es casado su esposa trabaja en una tienda de pollo tiptop, sus dos pequeños hijos cursan la primaria.

Como objetivo don Efrain ha sido la construccion de su casa, en donde lo ha logrado con financiamiento en Afodenic con doce ciclos de prestamo, con el credito anterior logro hacer un bajarte en la parte de atrás, ya que es donde se lava la ropa y asi tener mejore condiciones.

Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para cambiar techo del lado de los cuartos en donde ira por parte, por que los materiales estan muy caros, y tiene  que medir su capacidad de pagos.
texts.en:
Efrain by profession works with the State in public services.  For over 23 years he has been working for the good of the communities.  During that time, through studies, he has been managing to improve conditions.

He is married, and his wife works at a TipTop chicken store.  His two young children are in elementary school.

Efrain’s objective has been the construction of his house.  He has achieved this with twelve loan cycles with Afodenic.  With the previous loan he managed to build a porch on the back part of the house.  That is where the clothes are washed, and this way it can be done under better conditions.

Now with this new loan he will change the roof on the side where the rooms are.  He will do part of the roof because the materials are very expensive, and he needs to consider his ability to make payments.

loans.use: to buy zinc metal sheeting in order to change the roof of the rooms to improve the condition of his house.

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es:
Gavino soltero, trabajador. El cliente tiene planificado en hacerle mejoras a la vivienda sobre todo en el piso.  Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos e utensilios de cocina desde hace un tiempo. El alza de los precio ha sido una dificulta en las venta de sus productos ya que los clientes no pagan su valor. Inicio su negocio con fondo propio. Con el esfuerzo y voluntad para alcanzar el objetivo de mejorar su economía. 
Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: perfumes, cremas, sombras, lápiz labiales, de cejas, pestañas entre otros productos de uso femenino. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gavino is single.  He is planning to do some home improvements, especially the floors throughout.  He’s been selling cosmetics and kitchen utensils for quite some time.  Rising prices have affected the sales of these products because customers do not pay what they are worth.  He started the business with funds of his own with effort and will to reach the goal of improving his economy.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise like: perfume, cream, eye shadow, lipstick, eyebrow pencils, and mascara, among other products for women.  He is grateful to the financial institution for the support given to his business’ development.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, meat, rice, beans, bananas, cheese, fried plantain, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Domingo tiene 39 años de edad, de profesion Gerente Financiero casado, con dos hermosos hijos, una universitario.
Su esposa es ama de casa, y junto han logrado las mejoras a su vivienda, anteriormente habia hecho prestamo en Afodenic, para la mejora de su casa, luego se retira, por un lapzo de tiempo, lo que a hora desea ampliar parte frontal de la casa, asi como hacer un porton, lo que le resulta el financiamiento por ser de plazos accesibles, logrando equilibrio en sus gastos basicos, como gastos de familia.
Comprara materiales de construccion como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, soldadura, tablas de madera, entre otros que necesite para realizar la obra. Esta contento por dar mejores condiciones de vivienda a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo is 39 years old, by profession a financial manager, married, with two beautiful children, one of them a university student. 

His wife is a housewife, and together they have been making improvements to their living quarters. Previously he had taken out a loan with Afodenic to make improvements to his home, and then withdrew for a period of time. Now what he wishes is to expand the front part of the house, as well as putting in a front door. Thus the loan, with its convenient installments, achieving balance in his basic expenses such as family expenses. 

He will purchase construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, solder, and wooden boards among other items which he needs to carry out the project. He is happy to be giving better housing conditions to his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for expanding the front part of his living quarters, achieving better conditions for his family.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Maria es comerciante de venta de cosmeticos, con mas de once años en las ventas, es el medio de apoyar  a su esposo y ah sus dos hijos, los dos estudiantes. Su esposo trabaja como primer oficial en la milicia.
Como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su vivienda, en donde ha logrado las mejoras a su casa, teniendo treces ciclos de prestamos, casi el 95 por ciento para infraestructura.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, pondra piso a su porche y para pintar su casa, dando un acabo bonito. Siendo el medio para lograr estas mejoras, por ser aplazos flexibles. Materiales a comprar: piso rojo, arena, cemento, pintura, cener, brocha, esponjas  asi como la mano de obra, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a merchant who has been selling cosmetics for more than 11 years as a way of helping her husband and their two children who are students. Her husband is a high-ranking official in the military.

One of her goals focuses on the construction of her home on which she has made many improvements. Maria has participated in thirteen loan cycles, with nearly 95% of the funds dedicated toward infrastructure. Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can lay down the floor on her porch and paint the house to give it a beautiful finish. In order to make these improvements, Maria has had to be flexible in her timetable and accommodate delays.

She plans to buy materials such as red tile, sand, cement, paint, paint thinner, brushes, sponges, as well as pay for labor so that the work can begin.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor for laying down a floor on her porch and painting her house.

loans.name: Socorro De Los Santos

texts.es: Socorro De Los Santos tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, las ganas de salir adelante y el entusiasmo de obtener un medio de vida han hecho que Socorro se mantenga con el negocio activo además siempre le está proporcionando a sus clientes los productos que le solicitan pues ellos saben que Socorro siempre hace todo lo posible por complacerlos. El financiamiento es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado y otros.
texts.en:
Socorro De Los Santos has a business selling general merchandise.  She has been doing this for over 15 years.  Her desire to get ahead in life and her enthusiasm to earn a livelihood have made Socorro keep going with this active business.  She is also always providing her customers with products that they ask for, because they know Socorro always does everything possible to please them.  

The funding is for the purchase of towels, sheets, clothes in general, cosmetics, shoes and other things.

loans.use: to buy towels, sheets, clothes in general, cosmetics, shoes and other things.

loans.name: Ernesto Jose

texts.es:
Ernesto casado, su esposa amad e casa, sus hijos estudiantes, sus planes apoyar a sus hijos en que se preparen y tenga una profesión. Trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo. Requiere del mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda también el sistema eléctrico siendo de gran peligro para su familia.
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, bloques, piedras canteras, hierro, tablones de maderas, piedrines entre otros materiales para la construir la pared lateral de la casa. Obteniendo seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Ernesto is married, his wife is the home-maker, his children are students.  His plan is to support their children to be prepared and have a profession.  He has worked for a private company for some time.  Their house requires the improvement of it's infrastructure and also the electrical system is a great danger to his family.

With this loan he will buy construction materials: cement, blocks, stone quarries, iron, wood planks, gravel and other building materials for the side wall of the house. He is obtaining safety and comfort.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 38 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León. Es madre de dos hijos, esta casada , su nivel de estudios es básico solo llego hasta tercer grado de primaria. Ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, también vende ropa. A la edad de 19 años inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras de manera ambulante lo hizo con capital propio, 6 años después comenzó a vender ropa de manera ambulante así poco a poco y fruto de su esfuerzo y lucha diaria ha subsistido ella y su familia.  
Solicito el préstamo para comprar frutas, verduras y ropa para vender. Con esta inversión espera abastecer su inventario de frutas y ropa, tener variedad de producto que ofrecer y mejorar sus ventas. En sus planes futuros quiere poner una tienda de ropa y calzado, comprar una moto para movilizarse. Su próxima meta es comprar un carretón metálico para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 38, lives in the city of Leon.  She is married and is the mother of 2 children.  She has only a 3rd grade education.  She is a trader who sells fruits and vegetables, and also clothing.  She started selling fruits and vegetables on the street when she was 19, and she started that business with her own capital.  Six years later she started selling clothing as well, and gradually, as a result of her efforts and her daily struggle, she and her family have had enough to live on.

She requests a loan to buy fruits, vegetables and clothing to sell. With this investment she hopes to build up her inventory of fruit and clothing, and have a variety of products to sell so that she can increase her sales.  In the future, she plans to have a clothing and shoe store and a motorcycle to get around.  Her next goal is to buy a metal cart for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and clothing to sell

loans.name: Mycel

texts.en:
Mycel is a determined individual who aims to become a successful entrepreneur in the future. She is now 34 years old and has no children since she is separated from her husband due to family conflicts. She lives with her parents and she helps them to earn a living. Rice farming is the main source of her income. Therefore, Mycel is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders to pay for land preparation and to purchase seedlings to grow on her farm. She has been in this business for almost 12 years, earning PHP 30,000 per cropping. 

In the future, Mycel hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income to have more savings to start another source of income. She is thankful that ASKI and Kiva lenders offer financial assistance to improve their business and gain more profits.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and to purchase seedlings

location.town: Brgy. Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 56 year-old Hawa. She is married to a small trader, and has six children aged 7, 9, 12, 22, 26 and 32 years old. In 1981, Hawa established her clothing business. She began her business to help her husband support their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  

Hawa has already received and successfully repaid two loans. She now requires a new loan in order to buy lace, wax cotton, local cotton and Bamakor cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  

Hawa travels to Freetown by public transport to purchase her supplies every week in the dry season and twice per month in the rainy season. Sales are sometimes slow in the rainy season. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for supplies for her apparel-making business.

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en:
Despite hardships in life, Esmeraldo strives hard and sacrifices a lot to earn his living. He is 55 years old and has four adult-age children. He has worked as a farmer and a hog-raiser for almost 15 years earning a net profit of about P8,000 (~$200) per month.

He is asking for a loan of P8,000 to be used in buying feeds and vitamins for the pigs to sustain their growth and development. He hopes that through patience and hard work, he can raise and sell more pigs and increase his income to support his family needs and save for their future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Мирали проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Мирали зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает телят, откармливает, а потом продает более выгодной цене. Этим видом деятельности Мирали занимается более десяти лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Mirali lives in Bohtar. He is 39 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. Mirali makes a living by breeding cattle. He buys calves, fattens them, and then sells them for a better price. He has been doing this work for more than ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Cette cliente travaille comme agent de santé communautaire dans le village, elle est salariée et fidèle cliente de la caisse. Généralement elle bénéficie de cridit pour des besoins sociaux. Ce crédit lui permettra de prendre en charge les frais de hospitalisation de sa soeur malade.
texts.en: This client works as a community health agent in the village. She has a salary and is a faithful client of the branch office. Generally, she takes advantage of a loan for social reasons. This loan will allow her to pay for the hospitalization costs of her sister who is ill.

loans.use: to pay for one of her sister's hospitalization.

loans.name: Mamajon

texts.ru: Мамачон жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в России. У нее трое детей. Сама Мамачон занимается торговлей. Она радом с домом открыла ларек, где занимается продажей продуктов питания и овощей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Mamachon lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is 39 years old. She is married. Her husband works in Russia. She has three children. Mamachon works in trade. Near her home she opened a stall, where she sells groceries and vegetables. She has been doing this work for five years. She is taking out a loan to buy food. She wants to increase the variety of foods she sells.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Yasin

texts.ru:
Yasin 32 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Djafar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, seychas projivayet v Bala Bahmanli posolok Fuzuli region vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy.
On uje qod kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca. Ranshe on bil masnikom, no on reshil pomenat svoy bizness i zanalsya skotovodstvom.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Yasina on udachno oplatil pervuyu ssudu i blagodaren Kive i lenderam za ssudu.
texts.en:
Djafar is 32 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Djafar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the occupied part of the Fuzuli region who now lives in Bala Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region with his loving family. 

He has been a shepherd for a year.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep and expand his business.  He started this business with his father.  Before, he was a butcher, but he decided to change jobs and began shepherding.  

This is Djafar's second loan.  He successfully paid off the first loan and is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for the loan. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/164218

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Agil

texts.ru:
Agil jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Agil 40 let.
 On uje 7 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsy v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini chotibi pochinit yeyo. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata kotoriy toje rabotayet taxistom.
texts.en:
Agil is married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  Agil is 40 years old.

He has been a taxi driver for seven years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts for his taxi and repair it.  He started this business with his older brother who also drives a taxi.

loans.use: to buy parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.ru:
Vugar yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Vugar jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On rodilsya v 1970 qodu. 
Uje 9 let kak Vugar zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i rozvodit ovec. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. On ochen trudolubiviy i lubit userdnuyu rabotu.
texts.en:
Vugar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.   Vugar is married and has two children.  He was born in 1970. 

Vugar has been a shepherd breeding sheep for nine years now.  He needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep to expand his flock so he will have more to sell.  He is very hard working and diligent.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Vusal

texts.ru:
Vusal rodilsya v 1987 qodu. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim bratom. Vusal ne jenat i ne imeyet detey.
Uje 2 qoda kak Vusal otkril etot magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN dlya uvelicheniya pomesheniya chtobi razmeshat bolshe tovarov.
texts.en:
Vusal  was born in 1987. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his brother.    Vusal is single and has no children.

Two years ago, Vusal opened this shop to sell groceries.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to expand his shop so he will have room for more goods.

loans.use: to expand his shop

loans.name: Zeyneb

texts.ru:
Zeyneb zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Zeyneb 30 let. 
Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kurici dlya pereprodaji. Ona uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom . Etomu biznessu ona nuchilas u svoyey mami.
texts.en:
Zeyneb is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and children.  Zeyneb  is 30 years old.
 
She now needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens for resale.  She has been poultry farming for five years.  She started this business with her mother.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Takku Liguey Liberté 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Takku Liguey est issu d'une classe d'alphabétisation dont les enseignements comportaient un module en création et gestion de micro- entreprise. Pour mettre en pratique les connaissances théoriques acquises et améliorer en même temps leurs revenus, cinq femmes de la classe se sont organisées en groupement et ont démarré des activités génératrices de revenus. La majorité d'entre elles faisaient de la restauration devant leurs domiciles respectifs ou elles proposaient à des clients le petit déjeuner et le diner, à base de céréales locales transformées. Cette activités leur permettait de satisfaire leurs besoins particuliers mais aussi de soutenir leurs maris dans la prise en charge de la famille. Beaucoup plus jeune que les autres,le chef du groupe (qui a la main levée)est âgée de 30 ans; Elle tient une table ou elle fait la restauration devant son domicile et reçoit des clients venus s'installer dans son quartier pour des besoins de travail. Elle a démarré son activité il y'a six mois seulement mais elle arrive déjà a générer des bénéfices qui lui permettent non seulement d'appuyer son mari en améliorant considérablement la qualité de l'alimentation de la famille mais aussi et surtout de satisfaire  ses propres besoins.  Deux mois après avoir ouvert un compte à l'IMCEC, le groupe sollicite en ce moment un prêt de 300 000F pour acheter du mil, des haricots, de l'oignon, des pommes de terre, du poisson et d'autres produits destinés à l'activité de restauration. Les cinq femmes ambitionnent d'implanter des restaurants construits en dur à la place des tables qu'elles ont installé à l'air libre et qui posent un problème d’hygiène.
texts.en:
The Takku Liguey group came into being during a literacy class in which a unit on creating and running a micro-enterprise was taught. In order to put the acquired theoretical knowledge into practice and at the same time increase their income, five women from the class organized themselves into a group and got started earning income. 

The majority of them sold cooked food in front of their respective houses where they offered breakfast or lunch to their customers, with dishes using locally processed cereals. These activities allowed them to satisfy their individual needs and also to help their husbands support their families. 

Much younger than the other group members, the group leader (who is raising her hand in the photo) is 30 years old. She has a table in front of her house where she sells food, and receives clients who come to her neighborhood seeking work. She started her activity 3 months ago but is already making profits that allow her not only to support her husband in order to considerably improve the quality of food her family eats, but also and especially to meet her own needs.

They opened an account at IMCEC and after having saved for two months, they are asking for a loan of 300,000 F to buy millet, beans, onions, potatoes, and other various products. Their ambition is to put up real buildings  to serve as little restaurants instead of the open-air tables they presently use which pose a problem of hygiene.

loans.use: to buy millet, beans, onions, potatoes and various other produce.

loans.name: Kwizera Group

texts.fr:
Angele est une commerçante âgée de 38ans qui habite le quartier Gatumba de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle vend des articles divers pour téléphone mobiles et produits alimentaires comme les bananes depuis 2ans. Elle a fait se études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est veuve avec 5 enfants qui étudient. 

 Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’articles divers pour téléphones mobiles et produits alimentaires a revendre afin d’agrandir son business et réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« KWIZERA».
texts.en:
Angele, 38, lives in the Gatumba neighborhood of the Mairie district of Bujumbura. She has been selling various cellphone accessories and foodstuffs such as bananas for two years. She managed to stay in school up to fifth grade. She is a widow with five children who are enrolled in school. 

The Kiva loan of 250,000 Burundi francs that she is receiving will permit her to add to her working capital to buy lots of cellphone accessories and foodstuffs to sell so as to expand her business and make more profit. 

She is a member of the community group « KWIZERA».

loans.use: to add to her working capital in order to buy lots of cellphone accessories and also foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Bity

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui pratique l'élevage d'ovins et de caprins .Elle vend aussi du lait caillé à domicile.Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants qu'elle entretien avec les revenus de ses deux activités.Elle est sociétaire de IMCEC qui l'appui en lui octroyant les crédits nécessaires à l'achat et à l'engraissement de ses animaux.Elle sollicite un prêt de 500000F pour acheter deux vaches et des 10 sacs d'aliments.Ces vaches seront revendues bout de huit mois d'élevage.Elle envisage de construire un grand étable et d'augmenter le nombre d'animaux à élever.
texts.en:
This borrower is a woman who raises sheep and goats. She also sells curdled milk out of her home. She is married and the mother of three children. She takes care of them with the revenues from her two businesses. 

She is an associate of the micro-finance institution IMCEC, which supports her by granting the loans necessary for buying and fattening her animals. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy two cows and 10 sacks of feed. These cows will be sold after eight months of being raised. She envisions building a large stable and to increase the number of animals she raises.

loans.use: to buy two cows and 10 sacks of feed

loans.name: Ramona Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Ramona, de 59 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Leon,es casada,tiene tres hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad,ella es comerciante y aprendio el oficio de costurera tambien, ello logro bachillerarse de la escuela secundaria.Hace 35 años ella se desempeño como costurera  pero hace 6 años dejo de dedicarse a la costura y decidio poner su negocio de pulperia el cual lo tiene en su casa ,lo puso con capital propio que tenia ahorrado y el apoyo de su esposo asi fue que logro tener su venta.
Requiere el prestamo para comprar inventario de productos tales como arroz,frijoles,carne,aceite,azucar,maiz.
Con esta inversion quiere abastecer su pulperia de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ,ofrecer nuevos productos  que no vendia antes para atraer mas clientes.Ella desea ampliar su negocio,poner una tienda de mercaderia en general,comprar dos vitrinas, comprar un freezer para vender carne. Su proxima meta es cambiar el techo de toda su casa y hacerles mejoras de infraestructura para ser mas atractivo su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Ramona is 59 years old and lives in the city of Leon.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are adults.  She is a merchant, but also learned the seamstress trade and she graduated from high school.  She worked for 35 years as a seamstress, but 6 years ago she decided to retire from this trade and open her own store which is located in her house. She started it with her own capital that she had saved and the support of her husband.  

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, meat, oil, sugar, and corn.   She wants to stock her store with products to satisfy her customer's demands and offer new products that she hasn't sold in the past to attract new clients.  She wants to expand her business, carry general merchandise, buy two showcases, and buy a freezer for meat.   Her next goal will be to replace the roof on her house and make other infrastructure improvements so that her business is more attractive to customers.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as rice, beans, meat,oil, sugar, and corn.

loans.name: Francisca Haydde

texts.es:
Haydde,de 66 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos ,ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de refrescos ,tiene 46 años dedicándose a este negocio, aunque ella no fue a la escuela aprendió a leer y escribir , trabaja desde muy pequeña, gracias a sus esfuerzo y arduo trabajo crio a sus hijos y sobrevivido de este negocio. Comenzó a vender refrescos de manera ambulante a los 20 años, después se estableció en el market de la estacion central que es donde vende sus refrescos. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas, cacao, arroz y otras especias para hacer sus refrescos. Con la inversión espera tener suficiente materia prima con que trabajar y vender sus refrescos. 
En lo futuro quiere poner piso en su local comprar mesas y sillas plásticas para acondicionar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Haydde is 66 years old and lives in the city of León.  She is a single mother with 5 children.  She is a merchant who sells soft drinks.  She has been doing this for 46 years and although she never went to school, she learned to read and write.  She has worked since she was very small and thanks to her effort and hard work she raised her children and survived this business. 

She started selling soft drinks in the street at age 20; then the market was established in the central station which is where she sells her drinks now. 

She is requesting a loan to by fruits, cocoa, rice, and other spices to make the soft drinks.  With this investment she hopes to have enough staple materials to work with and sell her soft drinks. 

In the future she wants to put flooring in her place and buy plastic tables and chairs to better equip her business.

loans.use: To buy fruit, cocoa, rice, and other spices to make their soft drinks

loans.name: Braulia Teresa

texts.es: La señora Braulia Teresa se dedica a la venta de comestibles conjuntamente con su esposo lo cual ambos se ayudan en los ingresos y gastos familiares ya que tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, la solicitante vive en un Asentamiento Humano en casa de esteras con su familia por el cual está solicitando el crédito para ampliar su negocio para la comprando de mercadería de ropa temporada  primavera otoño de esta forma le va permitir a la solicitante tener mayor ingreso económico y tener mejor calidad de vida para su familia.Se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que cuenta con buenas referencias personales y tiene aptitud para asumir una nueva responsabilidad crediticia.
texts.en:
Sra. Braulia Teresa sells food products with her husband. They help one other with generating income and paying the family expenses. They have three children who are of school age. Braulia Teresa lives in the settlement of Casa de Esteras with her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can expand her business. Braulia Teresa plans to buy seasonal clothing for the spring and autumn seasons so that she can generate more income and provide a better quality of life for her family. Upon applying for this loan, she presented good personal references and indicated her ability to assume this new credit responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase clothing so that she can expand the range of products that she sells.

loans.name: Amante

texts.en:
Amante is an industrious father. He is married and blessed with four children. Everyday, he goes in the field to make sure that his business is in good hands. He has been engaged in this kind of business for almost 20 years now. He usually earns a revenue of PHP 25,000 at every harvest. 

He saves some of his profit as initial capital for the next planting season and most of it is used for his family expenditures and his children's studies. He is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds to sow and fertilizers to maintain the crop growth to acquire more yield to sell at the next harvest. He is so patient and industrious in his farming because he wants to sustain the needs of his family and for his family to experience an average level of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a hardworking father of three school-aged children. He is 49 years old and married to Joy who is engaged in a retail business. She is helping him to improve their way of living. Benjamin has been farming for 30 years.  

He earns a net income of PHP 50,000 every cropping, usually during April and November for rice. However, due to so many expenses for his family, especially in providing for the education of their children, his farming capital was affected. To purchase rice seed and fertilizers and for labor costs in farming, he is requesting PHP 20,000. 

In addition to rice farming, he raises pigs to add to their profits in order to improve their way of living. He aims to lift his family from the hardship of the life they've been through in the past years and give all the needs of his children in their studies for them to finish completely and assure a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 46 years of age and a farmer in Cagayan province. He does farming to provide a good life for his beloved family. His wife also helps him supply their everyday needs by raising hogs. Together, they help each other to grant the requirements of their children in school. Leonardo and his wife want their children to complete their studies someday. He works hard to keep them in school. 

He goes in the field everyday to maintain his crop to grow well so he can get a better yield. However, typhoons and drought are not controlled so he only gets a small harvest during the occurrences of these calamities. He is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticide to maintain his crop growth. This produces a higher net income for the coming harvesting season. He aims to expand his venture so he works harder to achieve his set goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a responsible father who is doing his best to give his family a comfortable life. He raises hogs to earn extra income. He is 52 years old, married, and has six adult children. He has worked as a farmer for almost 38 years, earning an average net profit of 9,000 PHP per month. 

He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, and materials to repair his piggery. He hopes to grow his businesses well to eventually proviD. a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and materials to repair his piggery.

loans.name: Mark Aljhon

texts.en:
Mark Aljhon is a very young farmer at the age of 18, yet he is a very industrious person who helps to support his family. He has spent two years in this business. He is a kind and lovable son. He has followed in his father's footsteps and continued farming because this is the only source of income for the family. His father is prone to sickness, which is why Mark Aljhon chose to stop his studies and begin farming to support his family. 

Based on information learned from other farmers in their bario (village), Mark Aljhon is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farming necessities such as fertilizers and insecticides. With this loan, he hopes to generate more income to support his family and to save in order to continue his education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farming necessities such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Redento

texts.en:
Redento is a responsible father to his children and a loving husband to his wife. He has been a farmer for almost nine years. He earns 40,000 PHP each season that he harvests rice, usually during April and November. He works hard to improve his family's standard of living. 

He has two children, one of whom is currently in school. He dreams to be able to help his child finish school. Therefore, he works hard to earn great profits at each harvest in order to support his family's needs and provide his child with an education. 

He is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his crop in the field. He always sees to it that his crop is growing well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his crop in the field

loans.name: Jivralyn

texts.en:
Jivralyn is 33 years old and married to a tricycle driver. They have been blessed with four children. They live in the province of Cagayan. To add to her family's income, Jivralyn raises hogs for fattening and breeding. She has had this business for almost ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP for each hog disposal.
 
Currently, all of her pigs are gone, which is why she is asking for a loan to purchase new piglets to raise. She also needs to buy feed for the piglets. Her previous income went to her family's expenses and other obligations. In order to continue doing business, she is requesting a loan. She hopes this loan will help her expand her hog-raising venture. 
 
In the future, Jivralyn would like to strengthen her business in order to provide a successful living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new piglets and feed

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 26 years-old.  She is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children. With her husband, she works hard to continue to provide for the education of their children. While her husband does farming, she also makes an income from selling vegetables, fruits and food snacks around their village. She has been doing this for five years now and earns P200 each day.  

Marites would like to increase their income in order to save for future expenses so is asking for a loan to purchase a greater variety of fruits and vegetables, including cabbages and tomatoes, and dried fish to sell.  Marites hopes this loan will help increase amount of sales she get daily and enable them to financially support the education of her children until college.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of fruits and vegetables and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years-old and married to Ely. Together, they raise their only child. To make a living, Thelma's spouse works full time providing motorcycle transport service in their village. This occupies his daily routine and earns approximately P6,000 each monthy. Income generated from this business goes to their family's daily food consumption. According to Thelma, their minimal income makes it hard to manage due to the expensive cost of merchandise.

Thelma is requesting a loan of P6,000 in order to pay for franchise renewal of their motorcycle used in the transportation service and to buy accessories such as side mirrors for the motor vehicle in order for it  to continue with its smooth daily operation. 

In the future, Thelma would like to open up a sari-sari store (a common name for a variety store) business and help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal of their motorcycle and buy accessories such as side mirrors for it.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordelisa has been a farmer for 21 years. She earns a net income of PHP 25,000 at each harvest. She stated that this is a very minimal income, especially when she has two children in college. In fact, she has three children but because of the difficulty of finding money, she decided not to send one child to school. This is to prevent a shortage in finances. But for Flordelisa, it hurts her as a mother to make this decision.  

The only source of income is farming. This is the main reason why she needs to help his husband operate their business by borrowing money from a lending organization. And she was very grateful to find ASKI. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase necessities needed to maintain their crops on the farm like acquiring manure as fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes that this money will be circulating accordingly, in order to generate a higher income to improve their current living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Haja Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Haja Ramatu. She is married with six children aged 6, 9, 11, 14, 16 and 20 years old. In 1982, Haja Ramatu established her cosmetics/jewelry business.
Haja Ramatu was introduced to this type of business by her Aunty. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 
Haja Ramatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock (jewels and body cream).  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately Le 300,000. 
In the future, Haja Ramatu plans to buy land, educate her children and open a big cosmetics shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and body cream for her business.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is a loving mother and housewife. Aside from her electrician husband who provides their needs, she makes sure to provide all the requirements of her three school-aged children from her rice-arming business. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of the rice crop she grows in their field. She is so patient in doing the business because farming has been the major source of income that her family relies on. 

She hopes to improve her income from farming to save the payments for her loan and future emergencies. Nelie is doing her best so that her income can be used to acquire some appliances in their house in addition to the savings she wants to keep if there is a chance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Jan Mechel

texts.en:
Jan Mechel has been an industrious farmer for five years. He was blessed with a healthy baby and that’s why he is very inspired to work harder to grow his income. He goes into the field almost daily to make sure that his plants are growing well for the next harvest. 

Jan needs additional capital to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to sustain the nutrients needed for his crop to grow as per his plan. He is asking for a loan of P20,000. He will also use this to purchase hog feed for his pigs. Jan is engaged in two difficult businesses but he said that "there is no difficult if you are willing to do it by your heart for a family that relies in you". 

He manages his time cautiously to take good care of his agriculture businesses. He hopes to continue working to succeed at his endeavors in order to have a better life someday.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en: Anastacio is very industrious and a loving father. He has four children, two of whom are in school. His wife is a fruit and vegetable vendor. They help each other especially in financial matters. Anastacio has been a farmer for five years and earns PHP 2,000 each cropping. However, his income is insufficient to provide a better life for his family. This is why his wife found a way to help him. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables. Anastacio goes into the field everyday and has almost no time for himself. He works hard to earn enough income. He doesn’t want to let his family suffer. Despite his dedication, there are times that he encounters trouble and needs help. He is suffering from financial problems and needs additional capital to operate his business. That’s why Anastacio is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from ASKI. He will use this to purchase seeds and insecticide. He is very thankful that ASKI exists. He stated that ASKI is very willing to help needy people like him. He assures us that his business will improve and progress. He hopes that there are a lot more people that ASKI can help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is a very young father at the age of 19. He has one child which will surely turn into two children soon. He is worried about how he will provide for the demands of his family. He never dreamed of feeling what his parents experienced just providing for the family's needs and whims. But, because of early marriage, he needs to work in order to support his family. 

Ricky is now a hardworking father who goes into the field and manages his business every day. He cares so much, because this is their main source of income. That's why he is requesting a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to pay for the cultivation of the land and to purchase fertilizers. This is to embellish and enhance his field into better production. He hopes that ASKI will be of assistance in operating his business, so that he can acquire a higher income to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for the cultivation of the land.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 58 years old, married to a farmer and has three children. Right now, she is engaged in a retail store where she sells groceries such as canned goods from which she earns PHP 3,000. She uses it to purchase their daily needs, but unfortunately this is deficient to buy all their vital needs. So Angelita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional grocery items in order to generate a higher income. She failed to send her children to school because of financial problems. Now that she borrowed from ASKI, she hopes that she will improve their status in life and send her children to school to finish their education soon. She also hopes that ASKI will have many more people to help.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is 58 years old and widowed with six children who are all married now. She maintains a pig-raising business to make a living and support her family. She failed to send all her six children to school because of an inadequate source of income to support their schooling in high school and college. They just ended at the elementary level. Her husband was deceased early and then she was the only provider to survive life's challenges. 

She used to sell "malagkit' (native food snack made from glutinous rice) as a source of daily income for her family's immediate needs. She raises pigs to have extra income after four months of raising the livestock. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair her pigpen and to maintain the feed supply for the pigs she raises.

loans.use: to repair her pig pen and to buy feed

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a very industrious mother and wife. She is a 48-year-old mother blessed with five children. Four of her children are already married and living separately away from them. Leonor is currently engaged in a business buying and selling fruit such as coconut and banana. She also raises pigs to meet her family needs completely. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase an additional head of piglets and feed for her hog raising business. Her youngest son is her helper in maintaining her businesses. He helps her every Saturday and Sunday since he attends school during the weekdays. Leonor hopes that she can provide all the needs of her youngest in school so that he will able to finish his education through college someday.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Merope

texts.en:
Merope is married and is 48 years old with four school-aged children. With her husband engaged in rice farming in the Philippines for almost 19 years now, they earn an average net profit of P25,000 per harvest. Her plan is to continue sending their children to school so they can finish their studies in college someday.

Merope is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for their rice production. She needs to strive harder to make her dreams come into reality. She believes that, "If there is patience, there is progress."

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for their rice production.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is married and blessed with one child. He is 46 years of age and already 26 years operating his farming business.  He also manages hog raising as an additional source of income. Each crop season he usually earns P50,000 and saves it for the next planting season. Part of the income also utilized in supplying for their basic necessities. 

Luis is asking a loan amount of P25,000 to pay for the labor of the people who work with him in the farm. Apart from that, he will also buy fertilizers and insecticides for the sustenance of his farming. He is working hard to provide the demands of his child in school and lift his family from poverty.

loans.use: To pay for the labor of the people who work with him in the farm.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is married and her husband works in a factory. His income is very low and that’s why Najma supports him by selling buffalo milk. For this purpose she has a buffalo at her home. 

She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has a painting business while other 2 children stay at home. Her eldest daughter is 12 years old and studying in class 5. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her milk selling business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo that will allow her to sell a larger quantity of milk and increase her profit. 

She has a good deal of experience in her work and has been operating it for the past 10 years and hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer has been working for 15 years as a farmer in the Philippines. He is 39 years of age and is married, blessed with three school-aged children. He is a hardworking father and a loving husband. He doesn’t want his family to experience the hardships of life. 

Every day, he goes to the field to visit his farm in order to ensure a good harvest in the coming crop season this November. He hopes that he will also get a better yield this time to make up for previous farming losses. Elmer is requesting a loan amount of P20,000 to purchase fertilizer as maintenance for his farm. He knows this will help a lot in providing nutrients to his crop and so that it will bear more fruits to harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer as maintenance for his farm.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is married and has a three-year-old son who is not of school-going age yet. Her husband runs a small Punjabi food restaurant and offers different qualities of food to his customers at cheap prices. He is very good in his customer dealings and has a good number of clients who regularly come to his restaurant and eat. 

Rukhsana supports him by sewing clothes. She is an expert in her work and receives regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine for her business. This will allow her to complete her work in a shorter period of time and increase her profit. 

She has been operating her business for the past five years and is very confident that her business will improve further with the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is married and her husband is a scrap dealer. He deals in plastic and iron scrap. He has good number of business contacts and he makes good sales every month. In order to fulfill the demand of his clients, he needs to buy scrap and for that he needs an investment. That’s why Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah.  This will help him purchasing scrap in bulk quantity and increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Shahnaz is confident that after the loan investment he will be able to increase his income. 

She is the mother of five children. Three of them are studying. Shahnaz hopes that she will be able to send her remaining children to school as a result of the improved business of her husband. She is a new loan user of Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's business.

loans.name: Rashidaan's Group

texts.en:
Rashidaan is married and her husband is a driver by profession, providing transport services to his passengers.  She is the mother of 6 children. Her youngest one is studying in class 6 while the others do different kinds of work to financially support the family. 

Rashidaan is a very supportive lady by nature. She sells clothes to assist her husband in managing the household expenses. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity that will allow her to offer her customers more variety and increase her sales and profits. 

She has a good experience in her business and has been operating it for the past 20 years. She hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business by increasing her sales and income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashidaan

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is married and her husband is involved in selling plastic toys. He puts toys on his cart and visits different streets of the city to sell them. Children like his toys very much and he makes good profits every month. 

Perveen also supports her family by selling costume jewelry and Pranday (an ornament used to tie back the hair). She has given birth to a son who is studying in class one. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her costume jewelry and Pranday selling business. With the loan, she will buy jewelry sets and Pranday in bulk quantities which will allow her to make more sales and earn larger profits. 

She has been operating her business for the past 12 years and she is very confident about the growth of her business as a result of an investment.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry sets & Pranday (an ornament used to tie back the hair) for resale.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, a father of four grown children, is 51 years old and has been a farmer for 28 years, earning an average net income of P25,000 every cropping season, usually in the months of April and November in the Philippines. His aim is to have a stable source of income to satisfy his family's basic needs and improve their house to live more comfortably.

Alfredo is requesting a loan of P10,000 to finance his agricultural business. He will buy fertilizers for his crop, fingerlings to raise in his fishpond as an extra source of income, and feed for the fish. He believes that through patience and hard work, he can strengthen his business and improve his family's standard of living someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crop, fingerlings to raise in his fishpond as an extra source of income, and feed for the fish

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 41 years old, married and has six children. Her eldest son is a mechanic and works at a bus station and the second one works in a factory. The next three are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband also a mechanic at a bus station and she helps him support the family financially by selling sheep and goats. She purchases them from the animal market and sells to butchers and people for the EID (important Muslim occasion) after raising them.

EID season is near and Rukhsana wants to buy some goats to sell. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. 

She has been operating her business for the past 10 years and hopes that an investment will bring good profits to her and she will be able to send her youngest son to school for education. 

She is a new loan applicant and very confident about her business growth.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
As a responsible father of two school-age children, 38-year-old Johnny aims to have a plentiful harvest to provide for his family's basic daily needs. As a rice farmer in the Philippines, he earns an average net profit of P25,000 every harvest season.

Johnny is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pay labor fees for rice planting. He believes that the loan will result in improved rice production. Patient despite the challenges of low yields when his crop is affected by typhoons, Johnny hopes for future success that will help ensure a bright future for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor fees for rice planting.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
As a father of two children, Armando, 32, manages his hog-raising business well to earn income to support his family. A farmer in the Philippines for almost eight years now, he earns an average income of P30,000 in each sale cycle.

Armando is requesting a loan of P18,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes that the loan will help him raise more pigs to earn a higher income in order to finance his children's education. He also aspires to establish a business in the retail sector and will do his best to achieve his goals for the sake of his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hog-raising enterprise.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 40 years old, married and has six children. Her last two children are studying while the others do different kinds of work to support the family financially.  

Her husband is a driver by trade and Safia helps him support their family by selling ready-made garments. She makes these garments by purchasing cloth pieces from clothes shops and sells to her clients at a good profit.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy cloth pieces in bulk quantity that will allow her to make clothes according to her customers’ demand and earn better profits.  She hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and increase her income.   

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy cloth pieces for making ready-made garments.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Nyamsuren, 42, is an accountant. She lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant at a private food company since 2002. Her husband, Mr. Erdenechuluun, works as a watchman at another company. He wants to change his job and start a taxi business. It is more efficient for their family's lifestyle and will provide adequate monthly earnings. But there is a financial problem about the car payment. It is 2400 USD. Therefore Nyamsuren is taking a loan to aggregate the car payment in order to afford to start a taxi business.

loans.use: To aggregate the car payment in order to afford to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 56-year-old retired man. He lives in Al Karak with his wife and 14-year-old daughter.

Recently, Mohammad has opened an accessories store in Al Karak but did not include a lot of items in the beginning until he studied what is suitable and affordable for those in his area. Now Mohammad has applied for a loan to expand his business and add more items such as make-up and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy more items such as make-up and perfumes.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 50-year-old lady who has been living with her mother to take care of her. In order to be able to do that, Zainab wanted a job to have a stable income that would help them in their daily life. But she couldn’t leave her mother alone. so she decided to open a small food market using a room in their house.

It has been three years since she opened the store. Mostly she has been selling snacks such as biscuits and chips. Now Zainab has applied for this loan to add a new variety of food products such as dried beans, spaghetti, and canned goods in preparation for the Holy Month of Ramadan.

loans.use: to add new products such as dried beans, spaghetti, and canned goods to her store

loans.name: Howaida

texts.en: Howaida is 26 years old. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is a driver. Howaida and her husband opened a small store to sell different types of items such as home products, tools, and even food products. The business has been running successfully for two years. Now Howaida want to develop the store by reorganizing it and adding more food items to their store.

loans.use: To reorganize her store and add more food items

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 51 years old and a hardworking mother. She and her husband opened a small cleaning products store three years ago. During these years, they were able to buy a distribution bus. Now Fatima has applied for a loan to improve the store and include food products to what they sell.

loans.use: to add more food products to her store

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 38-year-old hardworking mother of four children. She is an ambitious lady who always keeps a smile on her face, and with this smile, she serves all the guests at wedding parties, as she is an employee at one of the wedding halls. In her free time during the day, Amal started a small home business selling blankets two years ago. Doing both jobs has helped her husband support the family. Now Amal wants to expand her business in retail blankets and buy more at a lower price to make more profit out of it. That's why she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets at a lower price

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 26-year-old wife and mother of two children. Her husband Mujahid has a store selling cleaning products in Al Baqaa. It has been three years since he opened the store. Wafaa has always wanted to help and support her husband, so she applied for this loan to fill the store with a variety of cleaning products to be able to serve more customers in their area. Since Wafaa is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Mujahid appear in the picture instead.

loans.use: to add more cleaning products to his store

loans.name: 19 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vân operates a food stall selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle for sale.

Vân is 49 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a nine-member group, the 19 Điện Biên solidarity group. 
Vân lives with three dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

The extra snapshot is Ms Sen. She came late, so we took a separate photo and collaged it with other people.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to process for sale.

loans.name: 6.2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Miễn has a service business laying bricks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build and repair houses.

Miễn is 52 years old and married with three children. Miễn is the group leader of the 6.2 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2008, Miễn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Miễn has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for two years.

The main hardship that Miễn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Miễn hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build and repair houses.

loans.name: 5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngọc operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables for resale.

Ngọc is 52 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 8.5 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2008, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngọc has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Ngọc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngọc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: 4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Ms Luận works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and resell.

Luận is 61 years old and single with four children. She is the group leader of the 4 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2008, Luận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Luận has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Luận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Luận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and resell.

loans.name: 6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh operates a restaurant selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the soup.

Linh is 43 years old and married with four children. She is the group leader of the 6 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2008, Linh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Linh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Linh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Linh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make soup to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase calves to raise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Gunjilmaa

texts.en: Gunjilmaa is 32 years old and lives with her parents in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her parents usually live in the countryside and visit their daughter once a month. She manages a clothing trading business at a rented stall at Hantalst trading center. She started her business in 2008 and gained much experience. Since then, she has been able to rent one more stall where she sells a variety of hats for all ages. Now she is planning to expand her business and to rent one more stall again. At her new stall, she is going to sell collections of bags and purses. Her parents are very supportive of her business. She is a polite and kind woman who says, "I want to purchase more inventories in order to sell them this coming fall. The reason is that students will come to Ulaanbaatar city to enroll to their studies." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase bags, hats, pants and socks etc.

loans.use: To purchase bags, hats, pants and socks etc

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en: Otgontsetseg is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Gobisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a fireman. She manages a souvenir trading business at her store. She started her business four years ago and is planning to continue her business in the future. She purchases her products once every two weeks either from China or Ulaanbaatar city. She would like to receive loans with low interest rate. She is a responsible businesswoman who says, "My store locates near secondary school and because of it I had been able to build strong customer base." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventories in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Prenadora

texts.en:
Prenadora works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.

Prenadora has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Prenadora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for resale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario has been a farmer for almost 23 years, planting rice and vegetables. He is also engaged in raising fish for sale to earn additional income for his children's college education. He earns a monthly income of PHP 28,000 to use for their food consumption and the daily allowances for their children.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and fingerlings to raise in his fishpond. He believes that being a patient and hard working farmer would lead him to improve their status of living and attainment of his children's college degrees.

loans.use: to buy feed and fingerlings to raise in his fishpond

loans.name: Otgontuul

texts.en: Otgontuul is 40 years old and lives with her three children in an apartment in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her grown-up older daughter lives independently while the younger three attend college and secondary school separately. She manages a used clothing trading business with the help of her second daughter. She started her business in 2005. During winter times, she sells all kinds of coats and jackets and during summer time, she sells shirts, pants, socks and hats etc. She imports her products from Ereen, a border city in China. For the last few years, her business has flourished immensely and she is planning to rent one more stall. Now she earns 150,000 MNT daily and her working capital exceeds 10 million MNT. She is a hardworking and responsible woman who says, "I use my received loans profitably and is planning to receive loans in the future. Now I want to buy one more stall for my son." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new stall for her son.

loans.use: To purchase a new stall

loans.name: Milo

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Milo is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow to fully support the studies of his children to become professionals someday. 

He is 49 years old, married and has three school-age children. He has been a farmer for almost 20 years, earning a net profit of PHP 36,000 for the sold fattened pigs. Milo is doing his best to keep his business growing.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband is a driver who owns a taxi service business. Her older two sons are students and the younger one attends secondary school. Her older son also helps with his father's taxi service business. She manages a tailoring business that she started in 2006. She started her business after her graduation from college as a designer. Her working place is located near the student dormitory. For that reason, her business is quite successful. Now she has many regular customers and is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a responsible woman who says, "Our business is operating quite successful and I like to collaborate with Xacbank because of convenient and fast services." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new stove and to do some construction work in her house.

loans.use: To buy a new stove and construction supplies

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His older daughter is a student and his younger two attend secondary school. He manages a Mongolian traditional clothing and shoe making business with the help of his wife. He was born in Zavhan province in 1972. Since childhood, he learned to make clothes and shoes, as it was his family's business. Now he is one of the experienced and skillful tailors in his town. He started his own business in 2000 after his movement to Murun sum. He produces a variety of clothes and shoes for all ages. Moreover, he has been honored as the best shoemaker of 2010. His customers respect him well. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to increase my working capital and make my products as brand product in my province."  He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make clothes and shoes

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en: Jemma works hard to support her family. Jemma is married and has a trisikad (pedicab) transport business in the Philippines. Jemma requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment. Jemma has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jemma would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 29 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

Carina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Carina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ulziitogtoh

texts.en: Ulziitogtoh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His two children are one and three years old and stay at home with their mother. He manages a shoe repair business in his town. He started his business in 2000 with the help of his parents. However, he was able to open his own shoe repair business in 2005. With his earnings, he managed to build a house for his family. With six years of business operation, he has built a strong customer base and gained much experience. He is a diligent man who is planning to expand his business. He says, "I want to build a garage in near future also I want to have a car too." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair shoes

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items for resale.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (restaurant) and house rental.

Imelda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and 45 years old with five children (three are in school).

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets and feed. She has been raising pigs for 10 years, and has taken nine loans from NWTF to build her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josefina is 44 years old with two children who are in school.

Josefina has a fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Josefina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. She lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two young sons. 

Sopheap wants to continue her weaving business, so she is requesting another loan to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-selling business in the Philippines.

Anita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers
