loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Narangerel is 47 years old and lives with her two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her older son works in a private company and her younger one is a student. She manages a meat trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2001 and is planning to continue her business in the future. She bought 10 sheep to sell this coming fall. She is an honest woman who says, "I want my older son to have valid education." She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more sheep to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (fibrous plant) making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 via Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy materials for her abaca business.

Luisa has been in this business for five years. Luisa earns additional income from clothing sales.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save sufficient money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca business.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 53 years-old and married with seven children.

Edelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional items such as snack foods, soft-drinks etc. to sell in her store.

Edelina has borrowed and paid for four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Edelina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as snack foods, soft-drinks etc. to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en: Ariunaa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her younger two sons attend secondary school and the older one works as a guard. She manages a brick manufacturing business with the help of her family. She started her business in 2009 and gained much experience. She is planning to buy a brick-producing machine in order to expand her business operation. Her products are well known among her customers. People use the bricks to build houses and storage etc. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I am planning to buy construction materials with my earning in order to build a house next year." She is requesting a 3,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more bricks and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bricks and materials

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from house rentals. Ruth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling school supplies business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more school supplies to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for three years. Rosita earns more income from a carinderia (local eatery).

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more school supplies to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anhbat

texts.en: Anhbat is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His older son who is six years old goes to a secondary school and the younger one who hasn't reached school age stays home. He manages a meat trading business in his town. He started his business in 2010 with the help of his mother. He bought many livestock in order to sell them in December when meat sales are high. He is planning to expand his business and join with his wife in order to increase his business earnings. He is a polite man who says, "I want to improve my business in order to better my living condition." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat from herders.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 58 years-old and married with one child.

Luciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional items to sell.

Luciana has borrowed and paid for 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 37 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Luciana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita sells second-hand clothing to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for seven years now. Anecita is married and works hard to help support her family. 

Anecita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to offer for sale.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia, age 60, is a widow who has had five children, the youngest of whom is still of schooling age and enrolled in school. Pacencia works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a sari-sari (general store) business, and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Pacencia has been in this business for 38 years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, oil, bread, shampoo, and canned goods. 

In the future, Pacencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soy sauce, oil, bread, shampoo, and canned goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
To earn a living, Josefina manages a general store in their village to help her husband generate income for her family. She is 38 years old and has four school-age children. Her husband is a farmer raising livestock and a rice crop. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy soft drinks, vegetables, beverages, breads, canned goods and kitchenware such as Tupperware to sell in her store. She will do her best to increase her income for her family's satisfaction, especially to complete her children's education someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, beverages, breads, canned goods and kitchenware to sell in her store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-production business in the Philippines.

Josephine has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en: Munhzul is 34 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband is an assistant driver at NIC Co. Ltd, one of the biggest oil and gasoline distributors in Mongolia. She manages a mobile meal trading business, which she started in 2005. She makes and prepares her food in a small van and sells to her customers. She is one of the trusted loan recipients of XacBank. She is a kind woman who is planning to make and sell meals during the local Naadam holiday held on 11th of July every year. She is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase ingredients and grocery items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and grocery items

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonora is 34 years old and has four children who are in school.

Leonora has a fish stall in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Leonora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines.

Lilia has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, rice, shampoo, canned goods, etc..

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Lilia would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, rice, shampoo, canned goods, etc..

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Virgilia has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Virgilia would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.
She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, egg and other groceries. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 27 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Flordeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Flordeliza runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits and snack food. 

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gina is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food business in the Philippines. Gina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Gina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maicel

texts.en:
Maicel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing business in the Philippines.

Maicel has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers. She has been in this business for two years.

Maicel would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Vilmer

texts.en:
As a responsible father, Vilmer aims to improve their status of living through his farming activity. He is 31 years old and has two school-age children. He has been a farmer for almost five years, earning an average net profit of PHP 35,000 every harvest season from this activity.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost spent in planting rice in the field. He hopes that he will harvest a better yield next crop season to increase his income to help him support his family needs sufficiently. He believes that his strong faith and determination will lead him to reach his goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides and pay for the labor costs

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Everyday, Mrs.Em always think all the ways how to earn more money in her family. She and her husband reside in Siem Reap Province. Now, she is a fish seller in one market near her community. On her husband part is a craftsman. Both of them could be earned enough Profit around $3 per day for sponsoring family. Both of them have only one child in responsibility. According to improvement of her husband business, Mrs.Em wishes to borrow some fund from Kiva loan in amount of $1,000 in the purpose to repair their old house

loans.use: to repair their old house

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh was born in 1957. She lives in Thai Binh village, Mai Lam commune. She has three children. Her husband has died. 

Khanh grows rice and also raises chickens. She has about 300 chickens. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She has participated in SEDA since 2010. She has borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. She now would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She is the leader of a five-member loan group.
 
About the borrowers in her group:
 Vui is 39 years old. She has two children and wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to invest in her livestock.
 Yen is 51 years old. She has two children and wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy food for her chickens.
 Duyen is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy food for her pigs.
 Diem is 22 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Virginia has a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Virginia requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snacks, and other miscellaneous items to sell in her store.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and other miscellaneous items to sell in her store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old, married, and has five children. Wilma works very hard to provide for them. 

Wilma runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Wilma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Renelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Renelita works hard to support her family. 

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Renelita is borrowing 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving business. 

Renelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for abaca weaving

loans.name: Ashraf Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Ashraf bibi is 46 years old, married and has six children: four sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has completed his education till eighth standard and started working as a welder. The next oldest is in fifth standard, her third son is in kindergarten, while the youngest one is three years old. Both her daughters are in fifth standard. 

Ashraf is an uneducated lady involved in the livestock business. She sells animals and their milk as well. She does this work to support her family financially. She has been in this profession for the past 12 years. Her husband is a welder by profession. 

Ashraf has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan, she will buy a buffalo to be able to increase milk production and also increase the sales. She is very hopeful that this investment will prove a profitable one for her business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for selling milk

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old, married, and has seven children. 

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as noodles, oil, groceries, etc.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs. 

Rosita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Theu's Group

texts.en:
Theu was born in 1980. She is married with two children who are still small. Her husband is a hairdresser. Mrs. Theu sells beverages. She has had this job for three years. 

She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy more goods to sell. 

About another borrowers in her group:

Mong is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her store. 

Quyen is 36 years old. She wants to borrow 3,706,000 VND to repair her shop.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Hop

texts.en: Hop was born in 1978. She lives in Phan Xa village, Uy No commune. She is married and lives with her husband and her two children. Her children are still small. Her husband is a driver. She sells clothes in the market. She has this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She always needs a loan to expand her shop. Since 2004, she has participated in SEDA. For her last loan, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell. Her profits will be used to purchase items for the home and to raise her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Just only ages 29 years old, Mrs.Hong have until four children in burden. So it is a big response of her and her husband for supporting the family lives in comfortable as other family in village.everyday, Mrs.Hong works as a catching fish around pound, lake and river also. On her husband part, he is a buyer all of cements in stock in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Both of them could be gain about $7 per day. According to co-operate with each other, it make this family would like to borrow from Kiva loan in amount of $1,200 in the aim to Purchase cements in stock.

loans.use: To purchase cements in stock.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a blacksmith working in one shop. Their income is $7 per day. She has one child who is two months old. Her family lives with her mother. Every month she has to spend $35 on food, $10 on transportation, $5 on electricity and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. In the future, she wants to get a small shop for husband to be a blacksmith by himself.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn is a garment factory worker. She is single and stays with her parents and a few siblings. Her family makes $6 per day for income. Every month, she has to spend $35 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on rent, $15 on transportation, and $35 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $900 to study at beauty school and buy the materials needed for her studies. This loan will help her to get a skill that can help her in the future. She plans to get a small shop for a beauty salon because she wants to quit working in the factory.

loans.use: To study at beauty school

loans.name: Yorm

texts.en: Yorm is a grocery seller. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $7 per day. She has four children. Three of her children are studying. Every month she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy grocery goods to sell. She has been doing this business for about 10 years. She started with only a few goods to sell. The income she gets from selling, she keeps to buy more goods to sell. Now her business is getting successful, so she wants to expand her career when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Peoun

texts.en: Peoun, 37 years old, is a broom seller. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $6 per day. She has two children, 17 and 13 years old. One of her children is studying and one is a garment factory worker. Every month she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $10 other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a plot of land for doing farming in the rainy season. In the future, she wants to extend her business selling brooms when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Kunthea is a cake seller. Her husband sells vegetables. Their income is $7 per day. She has four children. Two of the children are studying and one more is a seller. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a cow to plow her field. Besides selling cake, her family also does farming after they rest from their daily tasks. In the future, she wants to extend her husband's career by buying more kinds of vegetables to sell so that they can make additional income for the family and be able to help their children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing her field

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang is a grocery seller. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $7 per day. She has two children who are 17 and 16 years old. Both of them are studying. Every month she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy grocery goods to sell. Before her family was doing farming, but they changed to business because they can make more income than doing farming. For her children, she will help them study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary is a weaver. Her husband is a musician. Their income is $8 per day. She has two children, 10 and 3 years old. One of her children is studying. Every month she has to spend $25 on food, $6 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $18 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy silk to make skirts to sell. In the future, she wants to buy pigs to feed at home so that she can have two careers at the same time. For her children, she will try to help them study at least until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy silk to make skirts to sell

loans.name: Salom

texts.en:
Salom is an active and hardworking man. He is married and the father of three children. His wife is a housewife. Salom is engaged in a farming business and he has been in this business for 10 years. His land is located two km from his house and he easily visits his land every day. He stays there from early morning until evening. Salom would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS for purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants for his fruit garden and to pay his worker.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants and to pay his worker

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en: Chuc was born in 1960. She lives in Phan Xa village. She has two children. One of her children is a worker and one is a student. Her husband is a guard. He has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Not only does she breed pigs, but Ms Chuc also sells clothes in the market. She has had this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. Since 2004, she has participated in SEDA and always repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy clothes to resell. Her profits will be used to purchase items for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Phalley

texts.en: Phalley is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $7 per day. She has two children who are eight and four years old. Both of them are studying. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy wood to repair her house. She has skills as a tailor and she wants to open a tailoring shop when she has enough money to start. For her children, she will help them to study until they finish the university.

loans.use: To buy wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom is a garment factory worker with an income of $3.5 per day. She is a single mother with three children. Two of her children are studying. Every month she has to spend $100 on food, $10 on rent, and $20 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy rice and other materials for her sister to make food to sell.  She wants to help her sister's career run well to get some income to help with other expenses in the famiL.. For her children, she will help them to study at least until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy rice and other materials to make food to sell

loans.name: Raihon

texts.en:
Raihon is a hardworking woman and the loving mother of seven children. Her husband works in Russia and only she is a breadwinner for her family. Raihon is engaged in a farming business and she has been in this business for a year. She cultivates wheat and corn and she always hopes that her crops will give a good harvest. For this reason, Raihon would like a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants in order to get a good harvest and profit.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en: Chinda is a food seller. Her husband is a soldier. Their income is $5 per day. She has four children. Three of her children are working in a factory with an income of $3 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, $15 on rent, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy pigs to feed and sell. When she can make more income, she wants to feed chickens and pigs together.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed and sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 42 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Julieta has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a housewife who spends most of her time staying at home doing her household responsibilities. Her husband is a government servant. Azra is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Two of her children are studying and the others have left their education due to poor financial situation. Her eldest son operates a cosmetics-selling business and the second son has a business polishing furniture. 

Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son’s furniture-polishing business. With the loan, he will buy a furniture polisher and brushes in bulk, which will allow him to offer better quality furniture polishing services to his customers and increase his profits. Her son started doing this work when he was only 12 years old. Now he is an expert in his work. Azra hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and improve his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Azra.

loans.use: To buy a furniture polisher & brushes

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is a single parent who has two children. He is 30 years old and he is engaged in hog raising. This has been his business since his wife left. He is still hoping that someday his wife will come back for the sake of their children. 

Now, he is working so hard to meet the financial needs of his two daughters in school. Levi performs his responsibility as both mother and father to his children.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs he raises. In doing this, he will be able to maintain the good health of his pigs. He wants to earn a higher income because he is saving for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Venilda

texts.en:
Venilda is 47 years old and is married to a policeman. The couple has been blessed with six children. Two of her children have finished college already. Unfortunately, they are not employed yet. One of them is currently studying for a board exam. Though her husband is a government employee, they still experience financial problems due to her children being students.

Venilda is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy new tires for her transport motorcycle. She is grateful because the profit she generates from her business is useful for their daily needs. Venilda hopes to save money for the education of her children. She is hoping that her children can finish their schooling someday.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her transport motorcycle

loans.name: Solijon

texts.en:
Solijon lives and works in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the last six years, he has been running a business processing dried fruits. He processes apricots and then sells them in the local market of Isfara city for a reasonable price. With the profit Solijon made from this business, he repaired his house and improved his living conditions. Currently his business is going well and he wants to expand his business. Solijon would like to get a loan of US $2100 to purchase apricots to process and make a good profit.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots

loans.name: Ho

texts.en: Ho was born in 1967. She lives in Phan xa village, Uy No commune, Dong Anh district. She has two children (one of them is married). Her main job is farming. She has had this job for many years. Not only does she grow rice but also she raises pigs. She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and repaid punctually. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 44 years old and married with three children.

Juditha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Juditha has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for seven years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Juditha aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Carlota has been in this business for 27 years. Carlota earns more income from farming rice.

Carlota has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and married with 2 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  She has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising ducks.

Rebecca is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is a 65-year-old widow with nine children.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emerenciana has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 30 years.  Emerenciana has requested a loan amount of PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell in her stall.

Emerenciana would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase more dried fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 5 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending.    

Susan is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional videoke units for her videoke rental business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase videoke units to rent

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh was born in 1952. She lives in Phan Xa village in the Uy No community. She has two sons -- one has married and one is a taxi driver. Her husband has  died and her life is very hard.  

Minh has a store at home selling beverages. She has had this job for many years and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.  Minh has participated in SEDA since 2004.  In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid it punctually.  For this cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 8 years.  She also earns an income from a cafeteria.  

Grace has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like toothpaste, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Grace aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is  a 44-year-old widow with four grown-up children.  She is a fish monger and  has been in this business for the last sixteen  years.

This her third loan with KADET, which she will use to purchase more fish to resell. She plans to use the anticipated profit to service this KADET loan given that her previous loans had been successfully repaid. 

She hopes to see her family prosper through KADET loans.

loans.use: purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 3 years.  She also earns more income from selling frozen foods.  

Margie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to upgrade tools and equipment and buy stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: upgrade equipment and buy frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Lorna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business so she can secure the future for her family.

loans.use: purchase materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 50 years old.  She is engaged in an aluminum and glass supplies business, earning PHP 10,000 monthly. She offers sliding windows and sliding doors. Through this business, she is giving employment to her relatives by giving them work in the business.  

In her first year of operation, she encountered difficulties maintaining the business due to the high cost of schooling for her youngest child.

Zenaida is requesting a loan amount of PHP 25,000 to buy supplies such as glass and other metals used in making sliding windows and doors. She hopes that she can expand her venture in manufacturing. This thing might be a bit difficult for her, but with strong determination in life, Zenaida believes that she can do it with the help of God.

loans.use: buy supplies to make windows and doors

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy has three children -- one is studying and the other two are working in a factory, earning $3 per day for their income.  Channy makes baskets to sell.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Their income is $5 per day.  

Every month, Channy has to spend $80 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy construction materials to repair her house. She plans to sell fertilizer to villagers in the village who do farming when she can save enough money to start this new business, which may bring her more profit.

loans.use: buy construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Baya

texts.en:
Baya is a 40-year-old married man. They have four children. He runs a tailoring business and also sells clothing. His business has been in operation for the last nine years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more fabric for his tailoring business and more shirts and leso (wraparound) skirts for his clothing business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for his tailoring business, and also more shirts and leso (wraparound) skirts for his clothing business.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. In the future, Florentina would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has 3 children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.  Joelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol and his wife, Chanthy, have been married since 1996. They live in a village along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thol and his wife are vegetable farmers. He hopes to continue his business because farming is the main source of income to support his family. Hence he is applying for another loan of $500 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm. 
 
Photo: Thol and his wife are pictured at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en:
Sreypao (pictured here) is 32 years old and her husband, Kea is 33 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have four children - three sons and one daughter.  

Sreypao is a garment worker, while her husband is a lathe operator. In addition, the couple also grows rice when the rice farming season comes. 

Sreypao is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase another cow to plow her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase another cow to plow her rice farm.

loans.name: Sokouen

texts.en: Sokouen is a sugar palm and fish paste seller. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and their income is $6 per day. She has 3 children, one of whom is working in the factory. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $50 on school fees, $40 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy more sugar palm and fish paste to sell. She has been in this career quite long and she has got a lot of customers, so she wants to extend her business more when she has more money. For her children, she wants to send them to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy sugar palm and fish paste to sell.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Many kinds of works and also many kinds of living life style. For living in comfortable as other family, Mrs. Phat always decides so much how to create suitable profit per day. Now she is seller of coconut fruits and soft drink near a temple of Cambodia. As for her husband is a small tree planter. Both of them could be gained perhaps $7 per day. They have given birth of four kids in duty nowadays. To glorify one family in prosperity and happiness all the time, Mrs.Phat wishes to borrow from Kiva loan in amount of $600.she will use this fund to purchase more soft drinks and coconut fruits.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and coconut fruits.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Policarpio aimed to increase his rice production to provide his family needs. He is 51 years old, married and has three school-age children. His plan is to continue sending their children to school until they finish college so they will be employed someday. He needs to strive harder in order to earn more income to finance the school fees of his children.

He is asking for a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost incurred in planting rice. He will try his best to become more patient and hardworking towards the increase of production in his rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay labor cost incurred in planting rice.

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Houen

texts.en:
Houen is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker with $3 per day for his income. She has three children, and all of them are working in the factory with an income of $3 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy construction material for re-building her house. This loan will help her to get a better house to live in with her family. In the future, she plans to buy more equipment for her husband's construction work so that he can make more income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy construction material for re-building her house.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim and her husband are farmers. In addition, they also raise cows at home. The couple has seven children - four sons and three daughters. Two are married, three are garment workers and the other two are in school. They are living in a village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sim is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

Photo: Sim and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 54 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Jovita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom raises chickens for sale.  Her husband is a goldsmith and their income is $6 per day.  She has four children, one is studying in school and other three are working and earning $2.50 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on school fee, and $30 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy equipment for decorating gold.  Right now, her husband also teaches others to be goldsmiths so her husband needs more equipment to do it.  In the future, she wants to send the rest of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy equipment for decorating gold

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) is 36 years old and her husband, Chamreun is 37 years old.  They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have two sons and two daughters.  Two are married and live outside the family home.  The other two work in a restaurant.   

Srey is a gardener, while her husband is a construction worker.  She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting and she will use part of the loan to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Expectacion

texts.en:
Expectacion is 50 years old and married with 6 children.

Expectacion works hard to provide for her family.  She buys and sells Avon products in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of avon products to sell.

Expectacion has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running this Avon products business for 5 years and also earns an income from rice mill operations and electronic re-loading.

Expectacion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1977.  She lives in Phan Xa village, Uy No commune, D. Anh district with her husband and two children who are going to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.  She is a farmer.  Not only do they grow rice and breed pigs, but they also she sells beverages. 

She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 VietnamD. (VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2009.  The last cycle, she borrowed 5.014.000 VND and repaid punctually.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Norol

texts.en:
Norol is 47 years old and has 8 children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Norol is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Norol has been farming vegetables for 7 years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a responsible father who says that, "hard work is the only key to overcoming poverty". He is 54 years old and has four adult-aged children. He works as a farmer raising livestock and in crop production for 30 years now, earning an average net profit of P40,000 per crop season, usually during April and November each year.

To improve his rice production, he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor fees for his hired people who work with him in the farm. He hopes to harvest a better yield to increase his income that will be used in acquiring  a vehicle for service.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor fees for his hired laborers.

loans.name: Na

texts.en:
Na (in the photo) is a weaver and produces palm sugar. She also started a new business selling vegetables and meat. Her husband, Tre, is a construction worker and he climbs palm trees to collect palm juice.

Na is asking for another loan in the amount of $300 to purchase more vegetables and meat for sale. She will also use a part of the loan to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and meat for sale and repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is raising pigs and cattle for selling. Her husband is a soldier and a fortune teller, and their income is $15 per day. She has two children; one is studying and the other one is working in a factory. Every month, she has to spend $170 on food, $15 on electricity, $15 on rent, and $20 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pig feed for feeding pigs to sell. If she can save enough money, she will extend her business by buy more pig or cattle to feed for selling because this career can make good income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for feeding pigs to sell.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is a 33 years old and single; he runs a retail shop and a  motorbike taxi service business. His retail shop has been in operation for the last three years.

This is his first loan from KADET to finance his business. He plans to add more stock of sugar, flour, milk and crates of soft drinks to his inventory. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his businesses. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: add more stock of sugar, flour, milk and crates of soft drinks to his inventory.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a 66-year-old widow and a food vendor. She has been in this business for the last sixteen years. 

She is a  KADET LTD client and this is her first loan to finance her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing rice, beans, cooking oil and wheat flour into her business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to be able to provide for her grandchildren.

loans.use: purchasing rice, beans, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Sokhun is a cake seller with $7 per day in income. She is a single mother with two children; one is a student and the other is a car repairman; his income is $3 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $10 electricity, $30 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work in Phnom Penh. In the future, she plans to sell grocery goods in front of her house to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work.

loans.name: Yoin

texts.en:
Yoin (pictured above) is a silk weaver. In addition, she also buys some finished silk fabric from her fellow villagers and transports it to sell in other provinces far away from her house. 

Yoin already asked for a Kiva loan to buy additional silk products for resale. She hopes to continue her business, so she is asking for another loan of $500 to purchase silk products for sale.

loans.use: To purchase silk products for sale.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf is an active and hard-working man. He is married and the father of three children. Maruf always tries to improve his living conditions and that’s why he engages in  drying fruit. He has been in this business for 14 years and he has a good business experience. With the profit which he made from this business he bought the house and currently he lives with his family there. 

Maruf would like to a loan of 1200 USD for purchasing dried fruits in order to expand his business and improve his living conditions. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried fruits.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a 38-year-old married father of four children. He is a livestock farmer.  His business has been in operation for the last three years. This is his first loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. 

With this loan amount, he plans to add more goats to his business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add more goats to his business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 70 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

Emma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Sreytoch is 26 years old and she and her husband, Kimhong, live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four daughters--two are in school and other two are still young. 

Sreytoch is a tailor who specializes in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. Her husband sells car seat covers. She is asking for a loan of $700 to help with her husband’s business by purchasing additional car seat covers for sale.

Photo: Sreytoch and her husband.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s business by purchasing additional car seat covers for sale.

loans.name: Huynh's Group

texts.en:
Huynh was born in 1983. He lives in Phan Xa village, Dong Anh district. He is married with one child who is still small. His wife is a farmer. 

Mr Huynh has a workshop. He repairs bicycles and motorbikes. He has this job for five years. He has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). He wants to invest in his business. This is the first time he has participated in SEDA. He would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND  to buy bicycle parts.
 
About the other member in his group:

 Van is 49 years old. She has one child. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Yvonne works very hard to provide for them.

Yvonne runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

Yvonne has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Yvonne would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a basket-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase bamboo and other materials for her basket-making business.

Teresita has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and other materials for her basket making.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is 35 years old and has two children. Percy is married and both her children are in school.

Percy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Percy requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Percy has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Percy would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Joy requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fabric for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a computer for her husband’s business installing cell phone applications and Mp3 and Mp4 players and also buy cell phones for sale.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is 51 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, Apolinaria works very hard to provide for her family.

Apolinaria runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Apolinaria has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, snack foods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Apolinaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 47 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Maria Fe works very hard to provide for her family.

Maria Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Maria Fe has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap and groceries. 

In the future Maria Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nom

texts.en:
Nom is a pig seller with her husband at home; their income is $10 per day. She has three children; two are studying and the other is working in a factory at $3.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $7 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy pigs to feed for sale. She has been in this business for a long time; she lost some time because of wrong  feeding techniques. But she can make good income from this career to support her family. In the future, she wants to buy more pigs to feed at home so that she can sell more. As for her children, she wants to support them through studies in the university.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Sam Onn

texts.en:
Sam onn (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Vannak is now a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2003, and have two young children, a son and a daughter. 

Sam onn is requesting a loan of 200 USD to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita lives in Philippines and as a married parent of 9 children, works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall where she sells vegetables and bananas.   She also earns additional income from hog raising. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables for sale at her food stall.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities with the assistance of 2 loans from NWTF in the past.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, 28 year old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband is an air-conditioner repairer, their income is $10 per day. She has one child, he is 2 year old. She lives with her old parents, so there are five members in her family. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $9 on electricity, $20 on rent house fee, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a small car for transport fruit to sell. She wants to have another career besides working in the factory so that she can earn more income and if her career gets successful, she will stop working in the factory but stay home to feed pigs to sell.

loans.use: To buy a small car for transporting fruit.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong was born in 1985, is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a driver.  She has been selling clothes in the market for 3 years. She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 Vietnamong (VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2007.  In the last cycle, she borrowed 7.194.000 VND and repaid punctually and this time she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Hilda Rose

texts.en:
Hilda Rose is married and works hard to support her family.  She has an abaca making business in the Philippines.

Hilda Rose requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.  She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Hilda Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca business

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena works in the factory with the husband. Their income is $7 per day. She has one child. He is 2 years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 transportation and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. 

She wants to raise animals at home to make another income when she can save enough money to buy them.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 40-year-old single mother of four children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for 13 years. She got the original capital from farming. 

Her hardships are seasonal business and theft, and her vision is to own a boutique and to educate her children.

Janet needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Kirizo

texts.en:
Kirizo is a 38-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him, and his desire is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity.

He has been hiring tents and decorating for seven years. His hardship is insufficient capital to run the business and his vision is to become the leading decorator in the region.

Kirizo needs the loan to buy tents for hire.

loans.use: To buy tents for hire.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells soft drinks in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

Elma has been in this business for 20 years. Elma earns additional income from meat vending.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Kimlean

texts.en:
Kimlean, 52 years old, is a pig seller who makes $3 per day. She is a single mother with three children. Two are working in the factory. Their income is $8 per day. 

Every month she has to spend $20 on food, $8 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy pig food and pigs to raise. With the rest of the money, she wants to make the pigpen bigger than before. 

With the income from selling pigs, she wants to repair her house, because it is not in good condition now.

loans.use: To buy pig food and pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 49 years old and her husband, Pech, is 44 years old. They live about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children. One son and two daughters. Two are in school and the other one stays at home. 

Sarin makes thatch for sale, while her husband is a construction worker. 

She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is 55 years old and married. She has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Santas has an upholstery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 31 years.

She requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her upholstery business.

Santas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Jannelyn

texts.en:
Jannelyn is 31 years old and married. She has four children, and two are in school, Jannelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jannelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Jannelyn has been in this business for a year and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

In the future, Jannelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nhar

texts.en:
Nhar, 50 years old, raises pigs and chicken to sell. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $8 per day. 

She has four children. One is studying and the other three are working at a company making a total of $10 for all of them. 

Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. 

Her daughter wants to quit her work and open a hairdressing shop, and she needs some money to support her from the family. Nhar would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter to start her new career.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter to start a new career.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc was born in 1960. She has two children. They have income. She and her husband are farmers. They have a shoe repair store.They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 Vietnamdong. Ms Ngoc has participated in SEDA since 2005. The last cycL., she borrowed 6.758.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 8.938.000 VND to repair her store.

loans.use: to repair her store.

loans.name: Laut

texts.en:
Laut (in the photo), 41, is a garment worker. Her husband, Sophal, is a security guard. They live in a village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Laut’s husband wants to supplement their income with a new business driving a motor taxi.  Hence Laut is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to launch the business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to launch a new business driving a motor taxi.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year. Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family.

Ma. Teresa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a forty six year old married man with six children.  He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He takes care of the family with the help of his wife who is also a farmer. Their dream is to see their children graduate since  they did not get a chance to further their education.

Joseph has been in the farming business for thirty years and this has allowed him to provide for the basic needs of the family. His challenge is seasonal variations. His vision for the future is  to do commercial farming and to set up a modern food store.

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and plow land.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and plow land

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with 10 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Aida is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aida has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food production business in the Philippines.

Marieta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Marieta has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from a variety store.

In the future, Marieta would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Erdenetsooj

texts.en:
Erdenetsooj, age 45, lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in the outer ger districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker at a local company while her son works at a cashmere manufacturing company. Her 4-year-old daughter attends kindergarten.
 
Erdenetsooj has been operating a cooperative felt-manufacturing business since 2006 with 24 partners. They produce pure felt out of raw felt by themselves; hence the products are completely handmade and qualified. They make various products such as baby boots, slippers, hats, blouses etc., and sell them to the local souvenir shops in Ulaanbaatar. 

Erdenetsooj is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy raw materials with the intention to increase production before the end of this summer since large numbers of tourists interested in Mongolian felt and cashmere products. 

She is working hard to achieve her goal which is to expand her business by opening several branches around the city.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to increase sales

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is married with 4 children living in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. For 2 years, he has been dealing in crop farming. He started with 1 acre, but now he farms on 4 acres of land and his dream is to farm on at least 50 acres of land.
