His major challenge is high operational costs and his vision is to shift to mechanized farming after he acquires enough land. Joseph intends to use the loan facility to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase land for extensive farming

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children between four and 18 years old. She lives with her family in her own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. For 15 years, she has been involved in a number of businesses, including running a bar and selling fresh food, and she is also a nursery school teacher. Sarah’s main business challenge is customers failing to pay their debts.

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy cabbages to sell. In the future, her dream is to own a big food stall and sell fresh foods.

loans.use: to buy cabbages to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and the single mother of a 17-year-old child. She lives in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda. For the past seven years, Evelyn has been operating a salon. She started with 30,000 UGX, but currently has working capital worth 2,000,000 UGX. Her major business challenge is customers not paying their debts on time.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Buhembe Traders Association Group

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 45-year-widowed father of five children in the Ibanda district in western part of Uganda. He derives his livelihood through the sale of milk and ghee. The western part of Uganda is known for producing large quantities of milk and bananas, and Geoffrey is someone who has taken advantage of the opportunities offered by his location. He has cows of his own from which he gets milk to sell. However, because the milk his cows produce is not enough, Geoffrey travels and buys more milk to resell at the Buheme Diary Centre. He is described as a hardworking man and he has steadily handled his business for four years. Geoffrey earns 100,000 UGX in weekly profit and makes additional income from rentals and sometimes from selling his cattle.

Geoffrey is requesting a loan to buy more milk to resell to get more profits. He thinks positively about the future and plans to buy his own milk cooling system as well as educate children to university levels.

loans.use: to buy milk to resell

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a 43-year-old single woman who lives with her sister. They both take care of life's expenses. Ibtesam owns a grocery store selling food products, and this is the only source of income she has. She wants to buy more food products for her store but she doesn't have enough cash to pay for it. Therefore she wants to take a loan of $1,400.
When Ibtesam receives the loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, she will be able to purchase more goods such as more varieties of coffee, frozen food and beverages to add to her store's variety. FATEN loans are repaid on a monthly basis – this satisfies Ibtesam's needs and will increase her income so that she and her sister can have better living conditions. Ibtesam is photographed in her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase goods and expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is a 25-year-old man who is married and has two daughters. He owns a grocery store selling food items. He also has a coffee shop, which is considered as the second source of income for the family. Farid wants to buy more products to sell in his store but he doesn't have enough cash to pay for it therefore he wants to take a loan of $3,000.
When Farid receives the loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, he will be able to purchase goods to add to his store. The loan will be granted fast and is repaid on a monthly basis, so will not exhaust Farid financially. He hopes to sell more products and increase his family's income. Farid is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: to expand his grocery store by purchasing additional goods and products.

loans.name: Isaya

texts.en:
Isaya is 39 years old and married with eight children between the ages of one and 17. He lives his own permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. For the past five years, Isaiah has been dealing in the poultry business. He started his business with 50 birds but now has 300 birds. Isaya’s main business challenge is the expense of feeding his livestock. However, his business is promising and he wants to have at least 1,000 birds by end of the year.

Isaya is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 23-year-old single man who works in construction. He wants to repair his house internally, but his income is not sufficient to cover the repair costs. Therefore, he wants to take a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner, FATEN, which can easily be repaid on a monthly basis.
By getting this loan, Tamer will be able to pay for necessary internal repairs, such as painting the walls, and enjoy better living conditions. Tamer is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: make modifications to his house.

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en:
Gerardine is 24 years old and single. She sells various goods such as cooking oil, rice, beans, biscuits, sugar, avocado etc. She has two years' experience. Her business is well organized and she works from 7am to 8pm every day.
Gerardine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her store by purchasing more and various goods such as cooking oil, rice, beans, biscuits, sugar, avocado etc. for resale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to expand her store by purchasing more goods such as sugar, biscuits, avocado etc. for resale.

loans.name: Nhang

texts.en: Having life, it means that time for solving with struggles and problems. To living in good living standard as others, so lots of couples co-operate and try to effort to find which job that suitable to improve economy in family. In the many choices of works, Mr.Nhang chooses one career as a construction worker. According to friendship and good relationship with each other, it makes him to earn around $5 per day. On his wife part, she is a farmer. Both of them have two children in duty .due to the improvement on his business from one day to one day, Mr.Nhang wishes to loan in amount about $500 in the purpose to purchase house materials.

loans.use: to purchase house materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items to increase the variety of goods sold in his store.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 30-year-old man who is married and has two sons and one daughter. He lives in Sa'eer village near Hebron, Palestine. Issa lives with his family in a house with a cement floor. Issa doesn't have enough cash as he is a Palestinian National Authority employee and earns a small salary, therefore he needs a loan of $1,200 to cover the expense of installing tiles in his house.
When Issa gets his FATEN loan, he can pay in cash to purchase tiles for his house. FATEN loans are repaid on a monthly basis, which will be much easier on him. By getting this loan, Issa and his family will improve their housing situation and have better living conditions. Issa is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to install tiles in his house.

loans.name: Yawavi Nicole

texts.fr: Femme d’un frigoriste, Yawavi  est une jeune dame de 36ans. Elle achète ses marchandises (produits de beauté)  chez les grossistes qui l’amènent de l’Europe et revend à ses nombreuses clientes dans le quartier HEDZRANAWOE et de façon ambulante. Elle a 02 enfants et a commencé en 2007.
texts.en:
Yawai is a young lady of 36 married to a refrigeration specialist. She purchases her wares (cosmetics) from wholesalers who import from Europe, and resells door-to-door to her numerous clients in the Hedzranamoe district.
She has two children and started in the business in 2007.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Rai

texts.en: Having life, it means that time for solving with struggles and problems. To living in good standard as others, so lots couples co-operate and try to effort to find which job that suitable to gain more money family as other family in village. In the many choice of works, Mr. Rai and his wife always negotiation with each other for finding solution to growing all children in comfortable and study at higher degree as rich family. Currently, they are farmer. They have nine children in responsibility. To glorify the family in honor and prosperity, Mr. Rai and his wife would like to borrow in amount about $500 in the purpose to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for wedding expenses.

loans.name: Rahamatou

texts.fr:
Rahamatou est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire Rahamatou travaille comme revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générales depuis 2005. Elle vend à toutes personnes au marché de N’KAFU. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Rahamatou a requis son second  cycle de crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation
texts.en:
Rahamatou is a young woman of 29. She is single and has been working as a grocery retailer since 2005.
She sells to everyone in the N'kafu market. She purchases her products in Lomé.
Rahamatou has requested a second loan cycle from WAGES to purchase grocery products.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 23 years old and is married with one child who is 4 months and she takes care of 2 relatives. She earns a living by selling cloths such as: African women's cloths. This is her eighth year in this business. Her business is well-organized and she operates her business from 8 am until 7 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her. 

Chantal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more women African cloths for resale. By adding more African women's cloths and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business and she will be able to build her own house for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more African women's cloths for resale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 46 years old and married with 5 children. Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 29-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son and three daughters. Safaa lives in Dora village in Hebron, which is located in Palestine. Her husband works in the area behind the borders.

Safaa has her own project raising poultry and selling its products. She wants to expand and buy more poultry but she doesn't have enough money, so she needs to take a loan of JOD 700 from FATEN.

When Safaa gets her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to buy more poultry and sell more of its products. This will generate more income, which will help her family to have better living conditions. Safaa is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to raise

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
Sulpicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 from NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

Sulpicia has been in this business for five years. Sulpicia earns additional income from abaca weaving.

Sulpicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: The kind of jobs in Cambodia some family as the same but some of them are not the same.presently, Mrs.Moeun and her husband are chickens feeder. Take time from doing this business, her husband does a motto taxi driver. Both of them could be gain about $3 per day. They have given birth of three children in response. To glorify the family in comfortable and properrity, Mrs.Moeun and wishes to borrow in amount about $500 in order to earn money for purchasing land.

loans.use: to earn money for purchasing land.

loans.name: Mirgazy

texts.ru:
Миргазы родился в селе Джекен (Чуйская область, Кыргызская Республика). Женат и воспитывает трех дочерей, старшей  из которых 17 лет.
Миргазы родился в простой семье фермера. Он был самым старшим из братьев, и поэтому большую часть времени посвящал домашним хлопотам, помогал отцу по уходу за скотом. По окончании 9 классов, Миргазы поступил в Пищевой техникум в городе Карабалта (Чуйская область, Кыргызская Республика), по специальности технолог зерновых производств.
Окончив техникум, в 1996 году его призвали в армию, где отслужил полтора года. Отслужив, Миргазы приехал в родное село и  устроился на работу в колхоз слесарем. Проработал он  в колхозе не долго - из-за низкой зарплаты он уволился и устроился на работу в отдел охраны в городе Карабалта. В  2003 году Миргазы женился и год спустя у них родилась дочь. Первое время они с женой снимали квартиру. В 2005 году, накопив немного денег, Миргазы покупает дом в г. Карабалта, в котором в этом же году у него появляется на свет еще одна девочка.  А в 2010 году семья  пополняется третьей дочерью.   
В связи с тем, что зарплаты Миргазы не хватало для оплаты всех расходов семьи, он решил заняться бизнесом – разведением и перепродажей скота. Используя свой стартовый капитал  в сумме в 3,000 сом (KGS), он успешно развил свой бизнес и на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячный  доход в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS). В 2009 году, Миргазы получил кредит в компании  «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» на покупку коровы и бычков. После своевременного погашения кредита у него осталась дойная корова.  В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Миргазы обратился за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков. 
 В планах Миргазы  - последующее увеличение поголовья скота, а его мечта - выучить дочек в университете и  купить новый дом.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Mirgazy was born in the village of Jeken (in the Chuy region of Kyrgyzstan). He is married and has three daughters, the eldest of which is 17 years old. Mirgazy born into a simple farmer's family. He was the eldest of the brothers, and so most of his time was devoted to household chores, helping his father care for the cattle. At the end of the ninth grade, Mirgazy entered the College of Food in Karabalta (in the Chuy region of Kyrgyzstan), studying  grain production. 

After graduating from college in 1996, he was drafted into the army, where he served for a year and a half. After serving, Mirgazy came to his village and went to work as a farm mechanic. His work on the farm did not last long.  Because of low wages, he resigned and took a job for the city Karabalta. In 2003 he married Mirgazy and a year later had a daughter. 

At first, he and his wife rented an apartment. In 2005, having saved some money they bought a house in Karabalta, where in that year they had another daughter.  In 2010,  they had a third daughter. Due to the fact that his salary was not enough to pay for all the family's expenses, Mirgazy he decided to go into business: breeding and selling cattle. Using a start-up capital in the amount of 3,000 soms (KGS), he successfully developed his business and now has a monthly income of 6.000 som (KGS). In 2009, Mirgazy received a loan in the company Bai Tushum & Partners to buy cows and bulls. After the timely repayment of his first loan he has kept a milk cow. In order to further develop his business, Mirgazy has applied for a loan in the amount of 70,000 Som (KGS) to buy cattle. 

Mirgazy plans to increase his livestock.  His dream is to put his daughters through the university and buy a new home.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 49-year-old man. He is married and has 18 sons and 4 daughters. Hisham is a Palestinian National Authority employee and earns a decent salary. Hisham wants to repair and improve his house from the inside. With a big family like his and the decent salary he makes, it is hard for him to cover the expenses of painting and other improvements, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000.

When Hisham receives FATEN's loan, he will be able to pay in cash to repair and improve his house easily as long as FATEN's loan is repaid on a monthly basis. Getting this loan will lead to positive changes for his family's living conditions. Hisham is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for house repairs and walls painting

loans.name: Munkhjargal

texts.en:
Munkhjargal works as a pastry chef at local food manufacturing company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is 42 years old and lives with her mother and elder sister, both of whom are retired. Munkhjargal graduated from the Polytechnic University in Russia where she specialized in tailoring. She also obtained a bachelors degree as a food technologist from the Institute of Commerce and Business in 2011. 

Munkhjargal’s family lives in a small house which needs repair and reconstruction. She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary building materials to fix and renovate the interior structure of the building and install a new iron stove. 

Munkhjargal is a punctual and hardworking woman who is a trusted client of our institute. By obtaining this loan, she will improve the condition of her house and create a place that her family can enjoy.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate her home and install an iron stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goat grains

loans.name: Soung

texts.en: Life seems the scene of cinema which sweet and sour. For support the family in prosperity and happiness family as others, Mrs. Soung and her husband try harder and effort to find a suitable job for sponsor to their children for living in higher and study at higher level. Presently, Mrs.Soung is a petrol seller at her house. As of her husband is a taxi car driver. Both of them could be earned perhaps $7 per day. According to improvement on her husband business, Mrs.Soung would like to borrow some fund to sponsor about $1,000 in the purpose to extra money to purchse a new taxi car.

loans.use: to extra money to purchse a new taxi car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new dynamo-meter

loans.name: Gulnura's Group

texts.en:
Gulnura, 32, is the leader of this group. She is married and has seven young children. The couple is blessed to have a stable financial position and is happy to bring up their children, four of whom are adopted. She and her husband consider this to be the main accomplishment of life. For the past three years, Gulnura has been helping her husband with technical and repair services for their automobile shop. Gulnura’s job responsibilities include repairing car parts and toning windows. The family’s monthly income is 10,000 KGS.

Gulnura is requesting a loan to open a car-repair center. She hopes the financial assistance of Kiva lenders will help her family accomplish their goal.


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to open a car-repair center

loans.name: Asmahou

texts.fr:
Asmahou est née le 23 Novembre 1985 à Sikasso, elle est mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle  vit avec son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Asmahou est tailleur de formation, à défaut de pratiquer cette profession elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des  fruits (mangues, oranges,  bananes, etc.) depuis quelques années. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de  Sikasso et de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt individuel dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter des chargements de charrettes en régimes de bananes pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Asmahou is born on November 23, 1985 in Sikasso. She is married and the mother of one son. She lives with her husband in a large traditional extended family in Bougoula-Ville, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Mrs Asmahou is a tailor by training. Unable to engage in this profession, she got introduced to the fruit trade (mangoes, oranges, bananas, etc.) a few years ago. She conducts business in the great market in Sikasso and as a street vendor.
In order to better satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso about one year ago. She is requesting this first individual loan with the objective to increase her working capital to purchase cart loads of banana bunches to better satisfy her increasing number of customers.
With this loan, she is planning on a monthly benefit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used mainly to increase her working capital, contribute to the family's expenses, and pay her loan's interests.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To establish a grocery store

loans.name: Kalipa's Group

texts.en:
Kalipa, 59, is the treasurer of this group. She is married and has six grown children. She considers bringing up six children the main accomplishment of her life. Kalipa’s husband is a member of a Farming Committee. Kalipa is now retired, but the couple still owns a big household with vast acres of land and livestock. Currently, Kalipa and her husband are busy with gathering hay for winter. Since 70% of Kyrgyzstan’s population resides in rural areas, it is obvious that farming is important for employment and provides a good portion of the country’s gross domestic product (GDP).

Kalipa is requesting a loan to buy sheep to fatten and resell. Since their children are facing financial hardships now, Kalipa and her husband hope to promote their business and gain more profit than usual.


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela is a 35-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and three daughters. Nabeela lives in Gaza city, Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Nabeela wants to make some repairs for the public transportation taxi her husband drives after his working hours, which helps to get additional income for the family. She doesn't have enough cash to pay for it. Therefore she took out a loan of amount $2,000. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, will enable Nabeela to pay easily for repairing the taxi that will make it work more efficient and generate more income for the family. Nabeela is a religious conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To make taxi repairs and maintenance

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née à Sikasso, Fatoumata est une veuve et mère de deux enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille), elle vit chez son oncle avec un de ses enfants à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Madame Fatoumata mène cette activité d’achat et vente de condiments alimentaires il y a environ cinq années au grand marché de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décida ainsi de collaborer avec institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ un année. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel  qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de condiments en achetant, 4 cartons Maggi, 3 cartons concentrée de tomate,  quelques sacs oignons, 5 cartons de moutardes et quelques sacs de sel de cuisine. 
Fatoumata s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et effectue sa vente en détail au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes.
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata was born in Sikasso. She is a widow with two children (a boy and a girl), and she lives at her uncle’s with one of her children in Bougoula-Ville, in downtown Sikasso.

Mrs. Fatoumata started buying and selling food condiments about five years ago at the Grand market of Sikasso.

In order to better satisfy a customer base which is steadily expanding, she decided a year ago to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is her first individual loan, which will help her to replenish her merchandise by buying four cartons of Maggi stock cubes, three cartons of condensed tomato, a few bags of onions, five boxes of mustard, and a few bags of cooking salt. She buys her stock from Sikasso wholesalers and sells at retail for cash, occasionally on credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which she will use to help with the household expenses and pay the interest on her loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments for resale

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 44-year-old young woman. She is married and has five sons and one daughter. Amal lives in Rafah city, Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. Amal wants to renew the taxi engine her husband drives, but she doesn't have enough cash to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,200. Amal will be able to pay easily for changing the taxi engine, which will make the taxi work more efficiently and generate more income for the family. Amal is a religious conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To renew his taxi's engine

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.en:
Nazgul, 39, is a resident of Tup, a small, nice village in the west of Kyrgyzstan. She is married to a cab driver and has six children. For the past ten years, Nazgul has been busy with a dairy business. Every morning she receives 15 liters of milk and distributes it to her regular customers. She also cultivates land and resells cattle. Nazgul’s business was started with an initial capital of 15,000 KGS and she earns a monthly income of 5,000 KGS. She has used her savings to purchase farming equipment and an automobile, and to repair her house.

Nazgul is requesting a loan to purchase three cattle to fatten and resell. 


         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of six and nine. She also takes care of four other children. Albertine earns a living by selling goods such as tomatoes, cooking oil, and other items. This is her fourth successful year in business. Albertine’s business is well-organized and she currently employs one person to help her. She operates her business from six in the morning through three in the afternoon every day except Saturday. 

Albertine is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy additional goods to sell. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. Albertine plans to use the profit generated with her loan to save for her family, pay school fees for her children, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as tomatoes and cooking oil, to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and three daughters. Halima lives in Rafah city, Gaza Strip in Palestine. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee and her husband is a taxi driver. Halima's husband wants to repair, paint and license his taxi. Her family income is not enough to pay for all the taxi's expenses, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN.

Getting FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, will offer to Halima the opportunity to pay in cash for doing all the taxi repairs and will enable her husband to work extra hours and generate a better income to support the family. This will result in better living conditions. Halima is a religious conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To repair, paint and license the taxi.

loans.name: Kaken

texts.en:
Kaken, 61, is a resident of Tup. She is married to a farmer and together they have six grown children. In the year of 2000, the family sold all the livestock it owned and bought a small shop to rebuild into a grocery store. They stocked the store and step-by-step, the business flourished. The background history of the business is already 11 years old and still it brings a significant income of 20,000 soms a month. The purpose of the loan is to buy more products like sugar, rice and pasta to sell in their grocery store. The family hopes to broaden the assortment of goods and make more profits. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more products such as sugar, rice and pasta

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina is a 30-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and two daughters. Zina lives in Rafah city, Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. The family owns a store selling motorcycles spare parts. Zina took out a loan to pay for new motorcycles spare parts in bulk. But with the decent salary her husband earns, she will not be able to pay, so she is in need of a loan of  $1,500 from FATEN.

When Zina gets her FATEN loan, she can pay easily for the new parts in the store, in addition to attracting more customers that will lead to increased income and improve Zina's family life. Zina is a religious conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Twesigangane Kitonya Group

texts.en: Aloysius is 45 years old and married with five children aged 14 to 4 months. He is a member of the Twesigangane Kitoonya Group. He owns a permanent house where he stays with seven people in Hioma, Uganda. For two years, Aloysius has been dealing in a produce business and from it has been able to expand his business and acquire a means of transport. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations but hopes to have a bigger store. Aloysius needs a loan to buy beans and to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans tosell.

loans.name: Martiros

texts.en:
Martiros is from the village of Gorelovka, Ninotsminda District. He is 33 years old and lives in the village with his wife Anaida and three children: two daughters (8 and 5 years old) and a 2-year-old son. Martiros works as a herdsman on the village farm. Anaida works as a milkmaid on the same farm. Along with their job, the family also runs a small dairy farm. They have two milk cows and sell milk to the village farm. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Martiros requests a loan to expand the family's agro-business. In particular, he will buy six piglets and food for them. After the piglets are grown, in four or five months, they will be sold at a higher price. The additional profits earned by the family will help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase six piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
According to a recent “Global Women’s Issues”, 90 % of small and middle-sized businesses in Central Asia are done by women. Therefore, providing women with access to finance is vitally important for development of Central Asian business. 

Damira, 54, is a member of a group. She became a widow and was left with seven children to feed and raise. Now Damira lives with her youngest 8-year-old daughter, who is her only financial dependant. The rest of the children live on their own. Damira relies on her social pension to make a living. However, this is not her only source of income. For 10 years, she’s been a great entrepreneur in the sewing industry. Since she became a retiree, she devotes more time to sewing, improving her techniques and furthering fashion on a local level. She remembers the times when she started the business with 300-400 soms and now the profits reach several times more. The purpose of the loan is to purchase poultry to start a new business selling eggs. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to start selling eggs

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Komlan est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 01 enfant. 
Komlan travaille comme revendeur de produits alimentaires 2008. Il vend à toutes personnes à AVEPOZO Il achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. Il travaille seul.
Komlan a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 04 cartons de lait peak, 10 cartons de tomate 02 sacs de  détergent génie.
texts.en: Komlan is a 30-year-old man. He is married to a hairdresser and has one child. He has been working as a retailer of grocery items since 2008 and sells to anyone in AVEPOZO. He purchases his goods at the Grand Market of Lomé. He works by himself. Komlan has requested his first loan cycle at WAGES in order to buy 4 boxes of Peak milk, 10 boxes of tomatoes, and 2 bags of Genie detergent.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Awaggwa Eku Kirinya Development Group

texts.en:
She always stays good humored and fresh as a daisy, especially in regards to making common cause with her workers at her stone quarry business in the metropolis of Kampala. These stocks in trade have endeared her not only to her laborers but also her clients. As such, she has been notching up successes in her transactions the last six years since she took root. Every business has its downsides and quarry businesses are invariably fraught with them, including 38-year-old Harriet's but her unwavering tenacity has been her recourse. The experience mill she has gone through in this business has taught her a lot. She says laying great store on patience has been key. Her business was thrown into gear after a pep talk by close friends and family. Before that, she was mostly preoccupied by tailoring. She has been carving out a niche gradually and she reckons her future prospects will only get better with time. Her clientele base principally consists of middle class civil servants beginning to build and construction firm people.

Harriet who is a married mother of three says her gross weekly sales revenue is to the tune of Ugandan shillings 40,000. This may be paltry, but she says by the end of this year, she expects to be making more. By all accounts, this is the group's maiden loan from Pearl Micro-finance. The integrity of the other group members is something Harriet speaks highly of and she does not expect any difficulty in repaying their loan. Given Harriet's tenacity, diligence, optimism and good working relationships, her odds of business success look good. This Kiva loan she anticipates will throw her business in an even stronger gear. She says this Kiva loan will lend her countenance in the purchase of another piece of land to expand her quarrying.

loans.use: to purchase another piece of land to expand her quarrying

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 5 and 13 years old. She takes care of one additional child.  Her business is well organized. She sells meat and she has one employee in her business. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Jacqueline operates her business from 7 am to 7 pm every day except on the weekend. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy a large quantity of meat for resale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of meat to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters. Mariam lives in Rafah city, Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a low salary. Mariam and her husband manage a poultry farm, which is one of the few farms in the area where she lives. Mariam wants to purchase poultry fodder, cages and medicines that will improve the productivity of the project, but due to the decent income her husband makes, she is in need of a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. FATEN's loan, which is disbursed in a short period of time, will enable Mariam to pay for the project needs. That will enhance and develop the potential of the project, especially since Mariam is looking forward to become a poultry-breeding expert. Mariam is a religious conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To  purchase poultry fodder, cages and medicine

loans.name: Burulbu's Group

texts.en:
Burulbu, 46, is the treasurer of this group. She is married to an electrical maintenance worker. Together they brought up a son who is now employed in Russia and helps them financially. Burulbu cultivates wheat on her small piece of land that was purchased 17 years ago. She’s been involved in farming since her marriage, with an initial capital of 8,000 soms. Her monthly income is 10,000 soms. The purpose of the loan is to purchase four head of livestock. Plans for the near future include organizing a wedding ceremony for her son. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase four head of livestock

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros is from the village of Heshtia, Ninotsminda District, in the southern part of the country. He is 23 years old and lives with his family: his parents, 21-year-old brother, 8-year-old sister and grandmother. Petros and his father work on the village farm as cheese specialists. His brother works in the same farm as a shepherd and his mother as a milkmaid. Petros’ sister goes to school.

Along with their job at the village farm, the family earns income from a family-run agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it locally. At the same time, they own 1.5 hectares of the land.  0.5 hectare of the land is used to grow potatoes. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to the vegetable retailers. The rest of the land is used for mowing. One-half of the hay is sold locally and the other part is used on the family farm for feeding the cow. 

Petros requests a loan to purchase two additional milk cows. The family will have more milk and more cheese for sale. It will significantly increase the income of the family, which will enable them to purchase various household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Messanh Comlan

texts.fr: Messanh est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 01 enfant. Messanh travaille comme revendeur de sodabi et liqueur depuis 2009. Il vend aux clients  à AVEPOZO. Il achète les produits à LOME et TABLIGBO. Messanh a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 08 bidons de sodabi et 30 bouteilles de liqueur.
texts.en:
Messanh is 32 years old, married to a hairstylist, and has one child. He has worked as a retailer of sodabi (West African palm wine) and liquor since 2009. He buys his products in Lomé and Tabligbo, and sells to customers in Avepozo.

Messanh has requested this first loan from WAGES so that he can buy 8 barrels of sodabi and 30 bottles of liquor.

loans.use: to buy 8 barrels of sodabi (West African palm wine) and liquor.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is 30 years old and married with two children between 3 and 6 years old.  She sells goods such as cooking oil and beans. She has five years of experience in this business and she works from 6 am until 5 pm every day except on Saturday. 

Georgette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand the inventory of her goods (cooking oil and beans) for resale. With the profits, Georgette will reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and beans to sell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 34 years old and married with seven children between 13 years old and 8 months old. He lives in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. For two years, he has been dealing in the transport business. He started by laying bricks and from his savings, he later bought an Isuzu tipper to use for transport. He faces the challenge of vehicle breakdowns and his dream is to own two vehicles to mitigate risks. Lawrence needs a loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira, 40, is the leader of this group. In Toktogul, a small northern town in Kyrgyzstan, Gulmira worked for almost 20 years as a medical worker saving human lives. But now she is an experienced doctor and a mother of six children. The 40-year-old widow speaks in a cheerful voice of how delighted she was to try out a sphere other than medicine. Six years ago, when she found herself to be the only breadwinner in the family, Gulmira started a new business: breeding cattle. She went to a local cattle yard and bought a young calf for 6,000 soms. After a while, the cattle grew and she resold it at a higher price. Soon the business turned out to be quite profitable, so that Gulmira received 4,000 soms of profit while still working in a hospital. The purpose of Gulmira’s loan is to purchase more cattle to resell.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is from the village of Khizabavra, South Georgia. He is 23 years old and lives with his father, adult brother and two sisters. All family members are involved in the family farming business. In particular, they have three milk cows and produce approximately 60 kg of cheese per month. They sell it in Akhaltsikhe (nearby town). In addition, Gela grows potatoes on family-owned land and sells approximately two tons of potatoes in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. 

Gela requested a loan from Credo to purchase a mini-bus. He will use it to transport his potatoes and cheese. At the moment, he doesn’t have a car and has to rent it to transport his products, which is quite expensive. When he has a mini-bus, he will significantly save the costs of transportation. On the other hand, he will also rent it to villagers as well, getting additional income. 

Gela plans to reinvest the increase in income and expand the dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus to transport his agricultural products

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: Etaf is a 52-year-old woman. She is married and has one son and four daughters. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee and her husband is a taxi driver. Etaf's husband drives a taxi, which is a good project in an area of high population like the one where she lives. Etaf wants to pay for licensing and insurance for the taxi. Her family income doesn't cover the necessary expenses, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. Getting FATEN's loan and paying for taxi expenses will enable her husband to work extra hours and to generate better income for the family. That will cause them to have better living conditions. Etaf is a religious conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insurance for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Females of Central Asian countries are mostly employed in such business spheres as textiles, light industry, hotel business and food production. Our next entrepreneur says women are more socially responsible, therefore donors should pay attention to women’s issues.

Ainura, 38, is the leader of this group. She is married and has four young kids. Ainura has been successfully breeding cattle for the past seven years. She confesses she wouldn’t be able to do that without the assistance of her husband, who is also a shepherd. 

Ainura’s activity involves purchasing young calves, fattening them and reselling them. The funds for the business start-up were taken from her salary seven years ago. Ainura doesn’t regret taking such risks because now the business generates 10,000 soms monthly. “Having four young kids, who constantly need attention and care is not easy," says Ainura, “so if I had a washing machine, that would be very helpful.” The acquired loan correspondingly will be spent on a purchase of a washing machine. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en: Anna Mary is 46 years old, married with one child aged 22 years old, living in her own permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. For 16 years, Anna Mary has been operating a restaurant and from this business she has been able to manage to support her family. She faces a challenge of fluctuations of food prices  and sometimes the fresh food goes bad. Nevertheless,  her dream is to own a hotel. Anna Mary intends to use the loan to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To buy a fridge.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 29 years old and is married with two children. She sells clothes such as: adult clothing and children`s clothes. Her business is well-organized. 

The hours of her business are from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturday. She has two years' experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her.

Dinah has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes (adult clothing and children`s clothes) for sale. With her profits, Jeanne will reinvest in her business,  save for her future and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase various clothes (children`s clothes and adult clothing) for sale.

loans.name: Gulanda's Group

texts.en:
Businesswomen of rural communities in Kyrgyzstan face a double challenge. The first challenge is being in a vulnerable part of the country; the second – being a woman. 

Gulanda, 46, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and has two daughters, the older of whom is 20. The year of 1996 was a turning point in Gulanda’s life. She risked all her savings by investing them in a purchase of 5 head of cattle, which left her  with almost no funds to live on. Having two kids to feed, Gulanda had no time to hesitate and she quickly started to work on promoting the business. It was repaid and currently she owns up to 40 head of livestock, which is the biggest herd in the neighborhood. Her monthly profit is about 5,000 soms. She doesn’t plan to stop at this and looks forward to expanding the herd. The purpose of the loan is to purchase 3-4 goats. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repairing, licensing and insuring his taxi.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuiser. Elle a 02 enfants. Abla travaille comme revendeuse d’oignons et d’ails depuis 2004. Elle vend à toutes personnes de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits au Grand marché de Lomé. 
Abla a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ails et des oignons.
texts.en: Abla is a 31-year old woman. She is married to a carpenter. She has two children. Abla has been selling onions and garlic since 2004. She sells to all kinds of people, working as a street vendor. She stocks up at the Big market of Lomé. Alba has requested her first-cycle loan from WAGES in order to buy garlic and onions.

loans.use: to buy garlic and onions

loans.name: Mariyakul

texts.ru:
Мариякуль 41 год,  замужем, воспитывает четверых детей.  Мариякуль начала свой бизнес в перепродаже обуви, игрушек и канцелярских товаров в 2003 году, использовав стартовый капитал в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Товар для продажи Мариякуль привозит 1-2 раза в месяц с оптовых рынков г.Бишкек и торгует в основном по четвергам и пятницам на выездных ярмарках в ближайших селах. Такая деятельность позволила Мариякуль оплатить учебу в ВУЗе для своей старшей дочери Асель. 
Мариякуль обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для расширения ассортимента предоставляемого товара. Прибыль она планирует потратить на ремонт дома и хозяйственных построек.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Mariyakul is 41 years old and married with four children. Mariyakul started her business selling shoes, toys and stationery products in 2003, using start-up capital amounting to 20,000 Som (KGS).  Once or twice a month, Mariyakul brings in goods to sell from wholesale markets in Bishkek and trades mainly on Thursdays and Fridays in traveling markets in nearby towns. This work has allowed Mariyakul pay for tuition at the university for her eldest daughter, Asel. 

Mariyakul has asked the company Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to expand the variety of her inventory. She plans of spending the money she makes on home repairs and outbuildings. 

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home furniture, a fridge and a washing machine.

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz, 28, is the leader of this group. She is married to a construction worker and together they are bringing up a nine-month-old daughter. Since 2009 Gulnaz has been breeding livestock in order to make a living. This type of  business is commonly found in her town of residence, Tashkomur. This place’s climate is very favorable for livestock breeding and farming. Even now, with an infant, Gulnaz tries to devote enough time to the business. Her monthly income is 8,000 soms. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of livestock. In future she would love to construct a big house for the family.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de 38ans .Elle est mariée à un chauffeur .Elle est mère de trois enfants.
Ablavi est revendeuse depuis 2001,Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse d’insecticide  et de charbon de bois et s’approvisionne dans son commerce au Grand marché de Lomé puis à Anié.
Ablavi a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois et des insecticides.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 38 years old, married to a chauffeur and the mother of three children. Since 2001, she has been working as a retailer of insecticide and charcoal. She obtains her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and in Anié. 

Ablavi has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal and insecticide.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish, Maggi cubes, peppers, tomatoes, onions, and salt in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Fight Against Shame Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Fight against Shame” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, northern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member to improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. A widow, Isatu has six children – one in primary school, two in secondary school, one in college and the others are no longer attending schools. 

Isatu sells clothes for both men and women. She has been in this business for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu is going to buy both men's and women’s clothes in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy both men's and women’s clothes in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Khaukharkul

texts.ru:
Хаухуркул 52 года, замужем, имеет троих детей. Хаухуркул  и ее супруг – врачи: они работают в больнице села Чаек и пользуются авторитетом и уважением среди сельчан. Так как зарплата врачей не высока,  Хаухуркул решила параллельно с основной профессией, заняться бизнесом в откорме и реализации скота.  Начав со стартовым капиталом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS), она добилась успеха – на сегодняшнмй день ферма Хаухуркул насчитывает 4 коровы, 2 кобылы, 45 голов овец и 20 голов коз. 
Для дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Хаухуркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)для покупки овец и бычков.   Доходы от деятельности в этом году она планирует потратить на ремонт дома. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Khaukharkul is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Khaukharkull and her husband are doctors. They work in the hospital in the village of Gull, and they enjoy prestige and respect among the villagers. Since doctors' salary is not high, Khaukharkull also works fattening livestock. Since starting with seed capital of 15,000 Som (KGS), she has succeeded.  Now, Khaukharkul's farm has four cows, two mares, forty-five sheep and twenty goats. 

To further develop her business, Khaukharkul contacted Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and calves. She plans to spend the revenues from this year on home repairs. 

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 47 years old, married and has three children aged 21, 20, and 14 who are in school.  He has been rearing pigs for two years.  He was previously selling cosmetics to earn a living.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his business.  This has helped him to retain his business for two years.  He hopes to have more pigs in his farm in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy feed for pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, margi, pepper, salt, onions, fish, etc. at wholesale to sell at the market

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 30 years old and married with two children. For two years he has been operating a retail shop to earn a living. He has managed to employ two people in his business. He runs his business in a very competitive environment but he is still able to retain his customers. Nicholas hopes to expand his shop into wholesale in the future. He has requested 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and salt for his store.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like raw foo-foo, fish, etc. in bulk in order to make cooked food for sale

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a farmer from the village Vale, South Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife Venera and  two sons – 23 and 21 years old — and his 83-year-old mother (retired). Gocha’s sons are students. 

Gocha grows potatoes and cabbages on a family owned plot of land. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to vegetable retailers. At the same time, the family runs a sheep-breeding operation. They have approximately 350 sheep and sell on average 10 lambs per month. Total average monthly income of the family is 1100 Laris, including the pension of Gocha’s mother. 

With the requested credit Gocha plans to supply his sheep with food for the winter. In particular, he will use it for pressing the hay and bringing it home. The supplied hay will be enough for the sheep and lambs for the winter season. 

Starting in September, the most significant part of the family’s income will be used for financing Gocha’s son’s education at the high school.

loans.use: to pay for pressing hay and transportation it home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy three or four cartons of fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber is from the village of Ijareti, Adigeni District. He is 38 years old, married and lives with his wife Marekh, three sons (10 years old, 7 years old and 3 months old) and his 72-year-old mother. Kakhaber and Marekh are running a family agricultural business. They have four milk cows, produce approximately 80 kg of cheese and sell it locally to dairy product retailers. In addition, they own 0.75 hectares land where they grow potatoes, maize and haricot. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to the retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Kakhaber requests a loan for expansion and renovation of the cattle shed building, as he plans to increase the amount of the cows on the farm. The existing building is small and is hardly enough for four cows.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand and renovate the cattle shed

loans.name: Callen

texts.en: Callen is 28 years old and a mother of four. For five years, she has been tailoring to earn a living.  She has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. This is because of her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Callen hopes to set up an embroidery business for more income generation. She has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy an embroidery machine and fabric.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and fabric

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is from the village of Toki, South Georgia.She is 37 years old and lives in the village with her two sons (18 and 13 years old). Both of them go to school. 

Leila is leading the agricultural business for the family. In particular, they have four milk cows and sell approximately 80 kg of cheese in Akhaltsikhe (a nearby town). In addition, she is busy with potato growing. She sells the harvested potatoes in Akhaltsikhe as well. The total monthly income of the family is approximately 350 Laris. 

Leila requests a loan to purchase calves. After six months, she will sell the grown calves for a higher price and get additional income. Starting in September, a significant part of the family finances will go to financing the education of Leila’s elder son, as he is entering high-school this year.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a mobile phone money transfer business

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна – вдова. У нее два взрослых сына – Александр и Игорь. Анна торгует кондитерскими изделиями, конфетами, печеньем в ассортименте на центральном рынке своего родного города Мелитополя. У Анны хорошее, большое торговое место и приемлемые цены на товар. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 5 лет. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 28 000 гривен, а прибыль – 4 000 гривен. 

Анна планирует использовать кредит в 8 000 гривен, чтобы закупить партию товара по договору с поставщиками. В ее дальнейших планах – развивать бизнес и улучшать свой быт. За счет получения дополнительной прибыли, заемщица планирует приобрести новую бытовую технику. Анна нашла приемлемое направление в бизнесе и собирается дальше работать в этой сфере.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Anna is a widow. She has two adult sons, Alexander and Igor. Anna sells pastries, candies, and an assortment cookies in the central market of her native city of Melitopol. Anna  has a large retail space and affordable prices. She has been in this business for five years. At the moment, her working capital is 28,000 hryvnia, and her profit is 4,000 hryvnia. 

Anna plans to use the credit of 8,000 hryvnia to buy goods under a contract with her suppliers. In the future, she plans to develop her business and improve her life. With her profits, she plans to acquire new household appliances. Anna has been successful in business and plans to continue working in this field.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from the village of Nakurdevi, in the southern part of the country. He is 36 years old, married and lives with his wife Anzor, two sons (13 and 11 years old) and brother-in-law. The children go to school. The family lives bellow the poverty line and they receive financial assistance from the state. Nana's brother-in-law is a person with disabilities and he receives social assistance from the government. The average monthly income of the family including the state assistance is 600 Laris. 

Nana and Anzor are leading the agro business for the family. They have three milk cows and sell approximately 60 kg of cheese per month. In addition, they grow potatoes and haricot on a family-owned 1.25-hectare plot of land. Harvested vegetables, as well as cheese, are sold in the village and in Akhaltsikhe (nearby town) open market. 

Nana requested a loan from Credo to purchase a milk cow. He will have more milk and will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Nana and Anzor plan reinvest the increase in profit in family farming activities, in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another piece of land to expand his banana farm.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем, у нее есть 8-летняя дочь. Светлана живет в Бердянске. Она торгует женской одеждой, детской одеждой и обувью на одном из местных рынков. Бердянск - курортный город, где всегда много потенциальных покупателей, будь то местные жители или приезжие отдыхающие. Подходящие цены для покупателей, качество и большой выбор товара, умение общаться с людьми помогли Светлане построить стабильный и надежный бизнес, которым она занимается вот уже 10 лет. Оборотный капитал Светланы составляет 30 000 гривен. 

Светлане необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент товара и пополнить оборотные средства. Этот вид товара очень нравится Светлане. У нее есть поставщики, с которыми она работает уже долгое время и поддерживает деловые отношения. Светлана предприимчива, она старается всегда трудолюбиво относится к своему бизнесу и вежливо вести себя с покупателями, умеет их выслушать.   

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has an eight-year-old daughter. Svetlana lives in Berdyansk. She sells women's clothes, baby clothes and shoes in one of the local markets. Berdyansk is a resort town where there are always a lot of potential buyers, both local and visiting tourists. Reasonable prices, high quality, variety, and the ability to communicate with people has helped Svetlana build a stable and reliable business, where she has worked for ten years.  Svetlana's working capital is 30,000 hryvnia. 

Svetlana needs a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to buy a new range of products and to replenish her working capital. Svetlana really likes this aspect of doing business.  She has suppliers with whom she works for a long time, and she forms business relationships. Svetlana is enterprising. She always tries to work diligently in her business, and to behave politely with her customers and listen to them.

loans.use: to buy a new range of products

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем. У нее одна дочка – Дарина. Оксана – рыночный предприниматель из Белой Церкви. Она продает сладости и выпечку на местном центральном рынке. У нее всегда огромный ассортимент конфет, печенья, шоколада и все всегда свежее. Торговая точка находится в оживленном месте. Оксана выкупила этот торговый киоск совсем недавно, а до этого были большие затраты на аренду. В торговле Оксана уже 8 лет. Ее чистая прибыль составляет около 5 000 гривен. 

Оксане нужен кредит в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы еще больше разнообразить ассортимент товара и увеличить свой доход. Это поможет вложить полученные от бизнеса средства в благоустройство квартиры, а, значит, поможет и существенно повысить свои жилищные условия и образ жизни. Оксане нравится заниматься этим видом торговли, ведь она раньше работала именно в этой сфере и уже была знакома с делом. Оксана уравновешенная, спокойная, вежливая и трудолюбивая. Ее бизнес стабилен и перспективен. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oksana is married. She has one daughter, Darina. Oksana is a market trader from  Belaya Tserkov. She sells sweets and pastries at the local central market. She always has a huge range of sweets, cookies, and chocolates, and everything is always fresh. This shop is located in a busy place. Oksana bought this shop recently, and before that she paid a high price to rent. Oksana has been in trade for eight years.  Her net profit is about 5,000 hryvnia. 

Oksana needs a loan for 7,000 hryvnia to further diversify her products and increase her income. Then, she can take the money she makes in the business and use it to improve her apartment, and, therefore, will help significantly improve her living conditions and lifestyle. Oksana likes to do this kind of trading, because she used to this work and is familiar with it. Oksana is laid-back, calm, polite, and hardworking. Her business is stable and promising.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en: Roselyne is 45 years old and widowed with five children.  To earn a living, she does tailoring.  She has employed one person to assist her in her tasks.  She has retained her business for 17 years because of her good customer care skills. In addition, she does outside catering for more income generation. Roselyne hopes to get tenders for making school uniforms and staff uniforms.  She needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine, fabric and thread.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, fabric and thread

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is from the village of Shaumiani, East Georgia. He is 41 years old and lives with his wife Tegmine and mother. The source of the income for the family is fruit growing. Ashot is leading this business. He works hard during the year in the garden. Ashot uses his old car for transportation of the harvested fruits. He takes them to nearby villages and towns and sells them from the car. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 690 Laris, including Ashot’s mother's pension.
