Ashot requested a loan to fix his car, which is out of order at the moment. He will repair it in a week and continue selling the fruits.

loans.use: to fix the car to transport harvested fruits

loans.name: Norbert

texts.ru:
Норберт не женат. Он живет в Виноградово, Западная Украина. Работает на ОАО «Автомотив», должность – мастер. Норберт работает там около 2 лет. На данный момент его доход составляет 2 100 гривен. 

Норберту необходим кредит в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы оплатить обучение в местном учебном заведении и сделать ремонт в комнате, где он проживает. Он очень хочет получить образование и, как результат, продвижение по службе, а, значит, и более высокую зарплату. Норберт надеется, что его трудолюбие и целеустремленность помогут ему обрести стабильность и благосостояние в жизни и верит, что кредит от КИВА только поможет ему в достижении поставленных им целей.   

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Norbert is single. He lives in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. He works as a technician at an automotive factory.  Norbert has worked there for about two years. At the moment, his income is 2,100 hryvnia. 

Norbert needs a loan of 8,000 hryvnia to pay for training at a local school and remodel the room where he lives. He wants to get an education and as a result, a promotion with a higher salary. Norbert is hopeful that his hard work and dedication will help him find stability and prosperity in life, and he believes that the loan from Kiva will help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his education and remodel his room

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна замужем. У нее есть 11-летняя дочь Даша. Татьяна живет и работает в Орджоникидзе. Она торгует косметикой и парфюмерией, как мужской, так и женской, а также предоставляет разные товары по уходу за собой. У Татьяны просторный отдел в удобном, проходном месте большого торгового центра. Благодаря тому, что у нее достаточно места на прилавке, есть возможность выставить больше товара и тем самым привлечь больше потенциальных покупателей. 

Татьяна занимается торговлей уже 20 лет. На данный момент ее валовый доход составляет 11 000 гривен, а чистая прибыль – 4 000 гривен. Татьяна – молодая и предприимчивая женщина, у нее хорошо поставлен бизнес. Татьяна регулярно делает закупки нового товара для пополнения ассортимента. В этот раз Татьяна хотела бы закупить как косметические средства, так и парфюмерию на сумму в 15 000 гривен. Татьяна убеждена, что ее бизнес будет процветать и в будущем, потому что женщины не могут не ухаживать за собой и обязательно покупают себе хотя бы помаду раз в месяц. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Tatyana is married. She has an eleven-year-old daughter, Dasha. Tatyana lives and works in Ordzhonikidze. She sells cosmetics and perfumes, as well as  different products for personal care, for both men and women. Tatyana has a spacious shop in a convenient place in the main thoroughfare of a big shopping center. Due to the fact that she has enough space on the counter, she can display more goods and thus attract more potential buyers. 

Tatyana has been working in trade for twenty years. At the moment, her gross income is 11,000 hryvnias, and her net profit is 4,000 hryvnias. Tatyana is a young and enterprising woman. She is well placed business. Tatyana makes regular purchases of new goods to supplement her inventory. This time, Tatyana wants 15,000 hryvnia's worth of cosmetics and perfumes. Tatyana is convinced that her business will prosper in the future because women have to look after themselves and are sure to buy themselves lipstick at least once a month.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans, rice, cassavas, potatoes, yams, etc in bulk

loans.name: Mekhrali

texts.en: Mekhrali is a 62-year-old farmer from the village of Khidiskuri, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Natela, two adult sons and a daughter-in-law. He grows potatoes on a family-owned 0.25 hectare of land and earns approximately 2,000 Laris per year. His sons are musicians. They play and sing in a local restaurant and earn 400 Laris per month. Natela has some health problems and she needs surgery. Mekhrali requested a loan to cover the medical expenses related to the surgery. Mekhrali hopes that the surgery will solve the problems of Natela and she will be in good health soon.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's surgery

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is 40 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been selling clothes for 20 years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  

She plans to buy more clothes to sell in her clothes shop. She wants to concentrate more on children's clothing.

In the future, she hopes to own a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is 41 years old and married to Mary. They have six school-going children. He has practiced farming for five years. 
 
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Johnny hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 37 years old. He is single, ambitious, and an entrepreneur willing to succeed. For the last seven years, he has been running a salon to make ends meet. He wants in the next five years to have opened up another beauty point to increase his income. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a blow dryer, hair chemicals and hair braids. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making funds to use in his business more accessible.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer, hair chemicals and hair braids

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 52 years old and married to John and they have three school-going children. She has practiced farming for 20 years.
 
She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to become a successful farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 26 years old and married to Mariam. He has practiced farming for six years.   

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading supplier of milk in his area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old and married to Nyambura. They have three school-going children. He has practiced farming for six years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is from the village of Gomi, East Georgia. He is 25 years old, married and lives with his wife Nato and one-year-old daughter. Givi is busy with farming. He grows haricot on a family-owned 0.5-hectare plot of  land and sells his harvest at the Khashuri (nearby town) open market. In addition, he has a horse and provides transportation services to the villagers for a service fee. Along with the above-mentioned, Givi has one calf. In a couple of months, the calf will grow and turn into a milk cow.

Givi requested a loan to purchase two more calves. He will raise them and turn them into milk cows. After all three calves are milking, he will start cheese production. The income of the family will increase and Givi will be able to ensure good living conditions for his little daughter.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Gvantsa

texts.en:
Gvantsa is from the village of Sasireti, East Georgia. She lives with her father Noe, 63 years old. Gvantsa and her father work hard on the family farm. They have four hectares of land and grow cabbage and tomatoes. 1.5 hectare of this land is used for a fruit garden with 70 plum trees, 40 nut trees and 60 apple trees. They sell harvested fruit and vegetables to local retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Gvantsa requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat the plants for parasites. In addition, part of the requested loan will be used to pay the workers, which will help the family in seasonal work. 

After fertilization and treatment of the plants, Gvantsa and his father will get a high quality harvest and sell it for a good price. It will increase the income of the family. Gvantsa plans to renovate the house with the received income in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat the plants for parasites

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, pork, cheese, tomatoes and paper packaging.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase better furniture and cutlery for his restaurant.

loans.name: Azucena Marisol

texts.es:
Azucena, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, vive con su esposo y su hijo de tres años de edad, además de su hermano de 11 años; Ella tiene el negocio desde hace 6 meses, lo instalo en su casa de habitación y ofrece todos los días pupusas, refrescos y gaseosas.
 Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para el negocio de las pupusas como chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, condimentos, además comprara mesas y sillas de madera, para atender a la clientela, con esta inversión mejorara el servicio a sus clientes.
Su objetivo es ayudar a su hijo en todo lo que sea necesario, mejorar su vivienda y mantenerse en el negocio a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Azucena works selling pupusas (traditional stuffed tortillas).  She lives with her husband and her three-year-old son, along with her 11-year-old brother.  She has had the business for 6 months; she manages it from her home where she offers pupusas, soft drinks and sodas on a daily basis.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her pupusas business, such as pork, cheese, corn, and spices.  She will also buy wooden tables and chairs to serve her customers; with this investment she will improve her customer service.

Her goal is to help her child in everything necessary, to improve her home and to stay in business for the long term.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, corn, and spices for making pupusas (traditional stuffed enchiladas).

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 6 años de edad y el otro de siete meses, ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas, surgió por herencia de su madre, inicia el proceso desde las 4:00am a 11:00md.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz y gas propano, esta compra es muy importante porque el maíz lo comprara por mayor, al igual que el gas, esto le permitirá tener suficiente material para la producción.
Su propósito con el préstamo es fortalecer el negocio  tratando de ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes, para generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza has a partner and two children, 6 years old and seven months old.  She has been selling tortillas for 5 years.  She learned the business from her mother and she works from 4 am to 11 am.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and propane gas.  This purchase is very important because she will buy the corn and the gas wholesale and this will allow her to have enough of the supplies for her production.

Her aim for the loan is to strengthen her business, trying to offer her customers the best service so she can have more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas to make tortillas

loans.name: Sulkhan

texts.en:
Sulkhan is from the village of Tsikhesulori, Vani district.  He is 28 years old and lives with his parents. 

With the requested credit, Sulkhan plans to purchase a new mini-bus. He will provide transportation services to Vani and Samtredia district villagers. He will connect these two towns. He has been working as a driver in the same region for 10 years, but he had an old mini-bus, which wasn’t comfortable.  With the new mini-bus, he will become more competitive and attract new customers. He earns on average 550 Laris per month. 

Sulkhan’s family is involved in agriculture. They have two milk cows and sell approximately 30 kg of cheese per month at the local market. In addition, they grow maize on their one-hectare plot of land. Part of the harvested corn is used to feed the cows and 400 kg of maize is sold locally. 

Sulkhan hopes that with the new mini-bus, his income will increase. He will invest it in the development of the family's agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen was born in 1988. She is married and blessed with two children. She is a determined business lady who has been running a grocery shop since 2006 to make ends meet. She wants in the next five years to be operating in a permanent stall so that her business can grow and to expand to other regions. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making loans accessible to her.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, dos hijos D. 36 y 30 años, también sus nietos, ella tiene un taller D. sastrería, desD. hace 20 años, comenzó a trabajar con su madre cuando era muy joven y heredo el negocio, trabaja D. lunes a sábado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. telas, botones, ciper, para fortalecer el taller, ya que en ocasiones se ha quedado sin material para la elaboración D. las costuras, el préstamo le ayudara mucho para incrementar el inventario y mejorar el servicio a la clientela.
Sus aspiraciones es comprarse otra máquina D. coser, para poder aumentar la producción D. costuras, también administrar bien el efectivo del préstamo.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children ages 36 and 30 and her grandchildren. She has had a tailor's shop for 20 years.  She started working with her mother when she was very young and then inherited the business.  She works Monday through Saturday.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, buttons, and zippers to strengthen her business since occasionally, she doesn't have materials to do her sewing.  The loan will help her tremendously to increase her inventory and improve her customer service.  

Her goals are to buy another sewing machine to increase her production and also, to do a good job managing the money from the loan.

loans.use: purchase fabric, buttons, and zippers to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with three school-going children. She is a hardworking business lady who has been selling cereals for the last 11 years to make life more comfortable for her family. She wants in the next five years to have grown and expanded her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize and beans. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her business management skills.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Paata

texts.en: Paata is from the village of Dzlevijvari, Kareli District. He is 43 years old and lives with his wife Mzia. Paata and Mzia are farmers. They have 2.5 hectares of land, where they grow tomatoes (1.5 hectare), cabbage (0.5 hectare) and garlic (0.2 hectare).  Paata and Mzia spend the whole day in their plot. They work hard to get a good harvest in the season. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. Paata requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and drugs for plant treatment for parasites. Part of the loan will be used to pay the workforce who will help the family members. After fertilization and treatment, the family will get a good quality harvest and sell it for a good price. In the future, Paata and Mzia plan to make some savings from their income in order to renovate the house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat plants for parasites

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy layer and boiler chicks

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is from the village of Arashenda. He is 25 years old and lives with his family: his wife Pikria, two-year-old son and parents. Solomon works in a local store selling construction materials. He gets a monthly salary. Pikria is a housewife. Solomon’s father works as an electrician on a TV tower. 

Along with their main jobs, all adult family members are involved in the family farming business. In particular, they have one hectare of agricultural land, where cabbage, tomatoes and cherry trees are grown. All harvested vegetables and fruit are sold locally to the retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,300 Laris. 

Solomon requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat plants for parasites. Part of the credit will be used to pay to the workers who will help the family with the seasonal work. After properly accomplishing the seasonal work, the family will get a high quality harvest. Their income will increase. Solomon and Pikria plan to use the increased income for house renovation, since it is already old and needs some repair. .

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and drugs to treat plants for parasites

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains, milk and sugar, for making empanadas.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. animales, actividad que lo viene realizando desD. hace 10 años. En ella, lo considera como su fuente principal D. ganancias, pues cada venta D. animales es D. manera periódica. Ante esto, se ha visto la necesidad D. capacitarse cada cierto tiempo, así garantiza un mejor crecimiento sostenible en la producción D. sus animales. Una vez alcanzado el peso exacto D. su ganado, son llevados para su venta en la feria ganadera D. su localidad. Ahora lo que más prioriza es mejorar la infraestructura D. su granja así como aumentar la cantidad D. animales que posee. Es su quinto crédito D. trabajo que tiene con MFP, considera a la institución como una gran aliada que le permite concretar sus proyectos D. desarrollo y demuestra su gratitud con la puntualidad D. sus pagos. En esta oportunidad invertirá su crédito en la compra D. materiales para la mejorar su establo.
texts.en:
Francisca lives with her husband in their own home.  The business she works in is animal sales, an activity that she has been doing for 10 years.  She sees it as her main source of earnings, as the sale of animals takes place on a recurring basis.  Given this, she has seen a need to undergo training every so often, so as to ensure greater sustainable growth in the production of her animals. Once her cattle reach the exact weight, they are brought for sale at the cattle market in her area.  Now her bigger priority is to improve the infrastructure of her farm and so to increase the number of animals she owns. 

This is her fifth business loan through MFP.  She considers the institution to be a great ally that allows her to focus on her development projects, and she  shows her gratituD. with the timeliness of her repayments. This time her loan will be invested in buying materials for improving her barn.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the infrastructure of her barn.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is from the village of Napareuli. He is 49 years old, unmarried and lives with his parents. Both of Gia’s parents are retired. 

Gia owns a truck (a Kamaz 5410) and works mainly in the transportation of construction materials. He has hired a driver and pays him 30 percent of the total income. Also, he has 2 hectares of land, where he grows maize. Harvested maize is sold locally. The total average monthly income of the family, including his parents’ pensions, is 1,050 Laris. 

Gia’s truck is out of order at the moment, and he has to change some parts of it. He requested credit for purchasing an accumulator and a tire cover for the truck. After he changes of the above-mentioned parts, he will continue working. 

In the future, Gia plans to make some savings, sell the existing truck and purchase a more modern one.

loans.use: to purchase an accumulator and a tire cover for the truck.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y conocimos ahi a la socia Clorinda y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 33 años edad, tengo dos hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico principal que es la venta de ropa”. 

Clorinda tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en la calle Tres Cruces de Oro donde vende ropa de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Clorinda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa para niños, damas, caballeros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Patrón Santiago de Santiago" meets monthly in the city of Cusco.   Here we meet Clorinda who is a member of the bank.  She tells us:  "I was born in the city of Cusco.  I am 33 years old.  I have two children.   I live in the same city where I was born and where I developed my main economic activity which is clothing sales."  

Clorinda has a small stand on Tres Cruces de Oro street where she sells clothing in an itinerant manner.  She has been running this business for several years.  Things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At the moment Chlorinda needs a loan to buy merchandise such as men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.use: purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Jose Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes van a la escuela, Jose trabaja como chófer ya que cuenta con su propio auto, con el cual presta el servicio de transporte , la familia cuenta con buenas referencias personales. El Sr. José va a utilizar el crédito para hacer mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que este es su principal fuente de trabajo; su sueño de Jose es ver crecer su negocio y comprarse otro carro para así aumentar su negocio. El esta muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old living in his own house with his wife and two minor children who go to school.  José works as a Driver and he owns his car that he uses to provide transportation services in the Santiago-Ica region.  The family has good personal references.

José will use the loan to service his vehicle because it’s his main work tool.  José’s dream is to see his business grow and to buy himself another car to increase business.  He is very grateful for the loan he’s been granted.

loans.use: Para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, tiene casa propia, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 13, 7 y 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, este negocio surgió por necesidad  y lo realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 4 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como cremas, lociones, talcos, shampoo, entre otros que son demandados por los clientes, con este préstamo fortalecerá el negocio y obtendrá una mejor rentabilidad.
Las aspiraciones de Reina es tener un local fijo, donde ofrecer la mercadería, ofreciendo un servicio mejor y con productos al alcance de los clientes, esta idea surge por la iniciativa de comprarse a largo plazo un vehículo, el cual lo puede obtener por medio de mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Reina has a house of her own.  She lives with her husband and three children who are 13, 7 and 2 years old.  She sells cosmetics. The business arose because of need and she’s been working door-to-door for four years.

She is asking for a loan to buy products like creams, lotions, talc and shampoo, among others that are in highest demand by customers.  She will strengthen the business with this loan and will attain better profitability.

Reina’s hopes are that she will have a fixed locale to sell her merchandise and to offer better service and products that her customers can afford.  This idea arises from her desire to purchase a car in the long run that she would be able to do through better profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, vive en su tierra natal en la casa que heredó de sus padres, en ella habita junto a su 2 hijos. Toda su vida ha trabajado en las tareas del campo, tanto en la agricultura como en la ganadería. Dispone de sus terrenos para cultivar papa, habas y maíz entre otros productos. Asimismo tiene vacas, cerdos y ovejas que los cría en su establo y los vende cada cierto tiempo, pues los considera capital de trabajo por lo que garantiza buenas ganancias. Para ella es importante, de esa manera mantiene estable su economía mientras espera el tiempo de la cosecha para su respectiva comercialización. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, así como tener más extensiones de terreno y aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es la segunda oportunidad de la que goza de un crédito grupal con MFP, considera que haber conocido  de esta forma de préstamo ha sido de gran ayuda en la mejora de sus actividades. Y en esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y ovejas.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives in her birthplace in the house she inherited from her parents.  She lives there with her two children.  She’s worked in the fields all her life both in farming and raising livestock.  She has land that she uses to grow potatoes, Lima beans and corn, among other products.  She also has cows, pigs and sheep that she raises in her stable and sells every so often for she considers them to be working capital because they guarantee good profits.  They are important to her because they keep her stable economically while she’s waiting for the crops to be harvested and sold.

At present, though, her main priority is making some improvements to her house’s infrastructure like having more land and enlarging the number of animals she has.

This is the second loan opportunity she’s had for an MFP group loan.  She considers having learned about this type of loan to be a great help to her to improve her business.  On this occasion she’ll use the money to buy sacks of manure and to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to buy sheep.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene  66 años y vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. Tiene su tienda D. abarrotes desD. hace 22 años, instalada en su misma casa, la ubicación estratégica D. su  domicilio está en una D. las avenidas principales D. su localidad, permitiéndole que sea muy concurrida por su clientela. Entre los principales productos que venD. son: sacos D. arroz, azúcar, conservas, leche, aceites, entre otros productos perecibles y tiene mayor demanda. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería aunque en algunas ocasiones son los mismos proveedores quienes se dirigen a su tienda para ofrecer productos, como es el caso D. las bebidas gasificadas. En todos estos años ha visto que  este negocio ha resultado  estable en las ganancias y afirma que le agrada estar trabajando en su tienda porque le permite estar activa todo el día es por esa razón que seguirá trabajando por mas años. Por medio D. una invitación personal  decidió hace varios años  ser parte del banco comunal que actualmente integra con mucha satisfacción y orgullosa D. su perseverancia a lo largo D. estos 16 ciclos D. trabajo ya que ha demostrado la puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita, lo seguirá invirtiendo en mejorar su mercadería en cantidad y calidad.
texts.en:
María is 66 years old.  She lives with her husband in her own house.  She’s had a grocery store for the last 22 years installed in her very house.  Her house is strategically situated on one of the town’s main avenues which makes it very heavily attended by customers.  Among the main products she sells are: sacks of rice, sugar, canned goods, milk and oil, among other perishable items that are in high demand. She stocks up on merchandise weekly although sometimes the suppliers come to her store to deliver products, like soft-drinks, for example.  

In all these years she’s seen that this business has produced good profits and she affirms that she enjoys working in her store because it keeps her active all day and for this reason would like to continue working for many years to come.

Thanks to a personal invitation years ago she decided to join a communal bank which she currently participates in gladly and proud of her longevity in it through these past 16 work cycles where she’s always been very punctual with her payments.  She will use the money she’s requesting to continue to invest in merchandise both in quantity and quality.

loans.use: to buy more perishables to stock her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Cliente agee de 47 ans, veuve et mere de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 14 et 28 ans.
Avec un niveau d'etudes primaire , elle se lance dans la vente en detail de l' haricot et des sandales en plastiques. Elle s'approvisionne sur place et parfois va a kinshasa.

Sa strategie est de diversifier ses produits pour attirer sa clientele.

L'octroi du credit lui permettra de renforcer le stock de 5 sacs de 50kg d'haricot et des lots de sandales en plastiques des enfants et dames.
L'epargne d'une partie de ses benefices est la strategie qu'elle envisage mettre en oeuvre pour assurer la croissance de son activite et de realiser sa vision d'affaire a savoir devenir grossiste.

En depit de son statut de veuve , elle est tres entreprenante et fait face aux besoins  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client, aged 47, is a widow and the mother of five children whose ages vary from 14 to 28. With primary school education, she started out retailing beans and plastic sandals. She buys her supplies right where she makes her sales and sometimes she goes to Kinshasa. Her strategy is to diversify her products so as to attract her clientele. 

The loan she has been granted will permit her to bolster her stock with five sacks of 50 kilograms of beans and some plastic sandals for women and children. 

Saving part of her profit is the strategy she intends to follow to ensure the growth of her business and realize her dream to become a wholesaler. 

Despite being a widow, she is very enterprising and provides for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of 50 kilograms of beans, and sandals made of plastic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another barber shop and buy a shaving machine, chairs and mirrors.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia lives in Choluteca, Honduras, with her husband and two children. She operates a small convenience shop out of her home and wakes at 5 a.m. each morning to attend to customers. 

Evelia is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise for her store. In her spare time, Evelia raises chickens at home.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, milk, rice, beans, eggs, cornmeal, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is from the village of Pkhvenisi, East Georgia. Vasil is a single father. He has two daughters who are 13 and 11 years old. Vasil’s daughters receive social assistance for orphan children. The younger daughter also receives social assistance for persons with disabilities, since she has some health problems. At the moment, Vasil’s daughters are at the local monastery, as he isn't able to care for them alone. 

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, Vasil has 1.25 hectare of land. He grows cabbage and tomatoes. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to the vegetable retailers. The total average monthly income of the family including the pensions of Vasil’s daughters is 1,200 Laris. 

Vasil requests a loan to pay the workers who help him with seasonal work. The rest of the loan funds will be used to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat the plants for parasites. After proper fertilization and treatment, Vasil will get a good harvest and sell it. He will be able to improve the living conditions at home, make it comfortable for his children and bring his daughters back home.

loans.use: to pay the workers and to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat the plants for parasites

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandpaper and paint in assorted colors.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y ahí  conocimos al socio Demetrio y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 55 años edad, tengo tres hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico principal que es la venta de productos agropecuarios”. 

Demetrio tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en traer productos agrícolas de la ciudad de Azángaro y repartir en  los mercados de Huancaro y Cascaparo de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Demetrio requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo queso, carne de alpaca, etc.
texts.en:
The “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” communal bank meetings take place every 30 days in the city of Cusco.  We met Demetrio there and he told us:

“I was born in the city of Cusco.  I’m 55 years old and have three children.  I live in the same city where I was born and where I carry out my main economic activity which is the sale of farming and livestock products.”

Demetrio has a small business that consists in bringing farming products from the city of Azángaro to sell in Cusco’s Huancaro and Cascaparo markets.  He’s been in this business for 25 years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  On this occasion, Demetrio wants the loan to buy merchandise like cheese and alpaca meat, for example.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cheese and alpaca meat, for example.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize and coffee to sell

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
Raimunda, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con sus dos hijos, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, inicio con el negocio por el apoyo de sus hermanos, trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario establecido pero si cuenta con experiencia.
Actualmente necesita comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la granja y crecer en el negocio.
Su objetivo es ser una comerciante de éxito y ofrecer a su familia una vida más confortable en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Raimunda raises pigs.  She lives with her two children.  She raises pigs.  She started the business with help from her two brothers.  She works on her own and does not have a fixed work schedule but she does have experience.

She currently needs to buy pigs to fatten up to sell later on.  This purchase will help her increase her farm and grow in business.

Her goal is to be a successful merchant and to offer her family a more comfortable life in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María vive en su tierra natal, es viuda y tiene  2 hijos que habita junto a ella en su casa que es propia. Tras la muerte de su esposo, sintió con más fuerza la necesidad de esforzarse para mantener a sus 2 hijos y a través del cultivo, la ganadería y los bordados, logró sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente su ritmo de trabajo no se detiene, pues sigue levantándose como todos los días en las madrugadas para cortar el pasto para sus alimentar a sus vacas y ve con frecuencia sus terrenos para ver el crecimiento optimo de sus plantaciones y evitar la plaga de insectos ataque y perjudiquen en la producción. Asimismo vende ocasionalmente las crías de sus vacas, más si son machos. Paralelo a todas actividades del campo, también y de manera regular elabora bordados de manera artesanal que son muy utilizadas en épocas festivas de su zona la cual son un ingreso más que le permite complementar su economía. Por ahora María tiene planes de mejorar su producción y tener más animales en su establo. Decidió trabajar con MFP por medio de la invitación de sus vecinos que  trabajan con el banco comunal y con la información que recibió se convenció que era una de las mejores opciones para  crecer  en sus actividades de las cuales se siente satisfecha. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
María lives in the land of her birth.  She’s a widow and has two children living with her in her own house.  After her husband’s death she felt the need to strive to support her children through farming, raising livestock and doing embroidery even more strongly.  She managed to move them ahead.  

Currently, the pace of her work does not slow down because she has to continue rising at dawn every day to cut grass to feed her cows and she frequently goes to check on her fields to insure that her crops are growing optimally and to avoid their being attacked by insect infestations that will damage production.  Occasionally, she sells the offspring of her cows, especially if they are males.  Alongside all the field work, she also does artisanal embroidery on a regular basis that is very much in demand during the festive occasions in her zone.  They represent an additional source of income for her.  For the moment, María plans to improve production and increase herd size.

She decided to work through MFP thanks to an invitation from her neighbors who work with the communal bank and the information she received convinced her that this was one of the best options to grow in her activities that she is satisfied with.  She will use the requested money to buy sacks of potato seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa lives in Choluteca, Honduras where she makes a living selling cosmetics, basic foodstuffs, and freshly made tortillas out of her home. She has been engaged in this activity for many years and has a reliable customer base. Elsa is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase basic foodstuffs, cosmetics, and ingredients for making tortillas. She is a returning client and is grateful for the support she has received from Prisma.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice, cooking oil, meats, soft drinks, firewood, lime, lotions, perfumes, and moisturizers.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is from the village of Ikalto, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. He is 26 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Teona, his 20-year-old brother and his parents. Shota works as a distributor in a local distribution company and has a salary of 400 Laris per month. 

Shota’s family runs a dairy farm. Shota is involved in the family business. They produce yogurt and cheese and sell it in Telavi. The average income of the family from the dairy farm is 900 Laris. 

Shota requested a loan to purchase feed for the cows. They will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Hay is cheap now and the price increases by 30-40 % in the fall months. By purchasing the hay in July, Shota significantly saves on the cost of feeding the cows. Since the cows will be fed properly in winter, they’ll give a planned amount of milk to the family.

loans.use: to purchase hay for his cows

loans.name: Herson Enoc

texts.es:
Herson, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él. Herson inicio la agricultura desde joven cuando ayudaba a su padre a realizar las labores agrícolas, no tiene un horario establecido.
Por el momento está sembrando maíz, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar abono para aplicarlos al cultivo, con este insumo estará preparado para que su plantación sea fuerte y le dé buena cosecha. 
Su objetivo es ser un agricultor con buenas cosechas, que le permitan comercializarlas a buen precio, también pueda cubrir la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Herson is a farmer.  He lives with his wife.  They have two children who are financially dependent on him.  Herson began farming when he was young and would help his father with the farm work.  He does not keep a set schedule.
Herson is currently growing corn.  He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer to apply to the crop.  With the fertilizer, he will be preparing his field to be strong and to give a good harvest.
Herson's goal it to be a farmer with good harvests that allow him to sell his crop at a good price and also to cover the cost of feeding his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, sand and ballast

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y ahí  conocimos la socia Carmen y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 43 años edad, tengo cuatro hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que es el alquiler de cuartos de su domicilio”. 

Carmen se dedica a conseguir personas que desean vender terrenos y después a venderlos a otras y de ahí gana comisiones. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el préstamo para revestir su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” holds its meetings every 30 days in the city of Cusco.  It is there that we meet their member Carmen, who tells us:

“I was born in the city of Cusco.  I am 43 years old, have four children, and I live in the same city in which I was born.  It is also there that I have developed my business, which is renting out rooms in my home."

Carmen also makes her living finding people who want to sell land and then selling the land to others.  From that, she earns a commission.  She has been running this business for several years, and, thanks to the effort she puts into her work, it has been going very well for her,.  At this time, Carmen needs the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Tabora Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school.  She has been running a beauty salon business for one year now. She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tabora", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Silvia Antonia

texts.en:
Silvia lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she runs a small convenience shop out of her home. Her business is strategically located in a place where there is little competition, and as a result Silvia's shop has a solid customer base. 

Silvia is requesting a loan of 15,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase merchandise for her store. She is a returning client and is grateful for the support she has received from Prisma.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, milk, eggs, meats, beans, rice, cornmeal, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies and personal hygiene products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and married with three children who go to school. To earn a living, she sells clothes. She has been in this business for six years.  She was previously selling fruits to earn a living. She hopes to own a permanent business premises in the future. Mary has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes, bed covers, trousers and blouses to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes, bed covers, trousers and blouses

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.fr:
Client de 54 ans, celibataire avec 3 enfants a sa charge,apres la guerre de 1997, il perd son travail et se lance dans la vente de la viande de chasse dans le marche, il s'approvisionne a la gare routiere du Nord et Sud du pays, il achete la viande de chasse en entier tel que les antilopes, les biches, les singes ...

Ses potentiels  clients sont les restaurateurs,car cette viande est tres appreciee et ses ventes sont de de 65000 a 150.000 frs par semaine.
A l'octroi de son pret il va faire une grande provision de viande de chasse boucanee et fraiche tel que 10 antilopes, 10 biches, 15 singes,5 sangliers, 5 porc epics et 10 gazelles.
Il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un boucherie de viande fraiche a tout saison, et avec ses benefices il va epargner et assurer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 54 years old, single, with 3 dependent children. After the war in 1997, he lost his job and began selling game meat at the market. He obtains his supplies at the bus stations in the north and south of the country. He buys the complete animal as meat, such as antelope, deer, monkey. His potential customers are restaurateurs, as this meat is very much sought after and his weekly sales vary between 65,000 and 150,000 francs. 

When he receives his loan, he will buy a large quantity of game meat, both smoked and fresh, such as 10 antelopes, 10 deer, 15 monkeys, 5 wild pigs, 5 porcupines and 10 gazelles. His ambition is to open an all-season butcher's shop, and with his profits, he will save for his children's future.

loans.use: to buy game meat

loans.name: Nelis Lizeth

texts.en: Nelis lives in Choluteca, Honduras where she sells used clothing, cosmetics, and basic foodstuffs out of her home. She is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase more of these items to increase her sales. Nelis hopes to continue expanding her business with subsequent loans.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing, cosmetics, and basic foodstuffs.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa, ellos se consideran una familia muy unida. Trabaja en la crianza y venta de animales, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 13 años, además en su casa ha implementado su establo de animales en donde los engorda hasta que consiga un peso exacto, y que luego son llevados en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Por otro lado, dispone de terrenos de cultivo en donde siembra principalmente alfalfa, pues le  sirve para alimentar a sus animales, y a su vez para venderlos. En estas tareas siempre tiene la ayuda de sus hijos, en los que se encargan de cortar el pasto y cuidar de los animales. Silvia disfruta de esta trabajo porque le permite ser independiente en el control de su tiempo y esto le da más ánimo para seguir trabajando con empeño en sus actividades. “Me agrada ser parte de un grupo humano donde todos se consideran  como familia” comenta Silvia, porque en estos años de haber trabajado de manera grupal con MFP el banco comunal que integra han superado varios obstáculos de las cuales ya son 12 ciclos de crédito donde  todos han demostrado su puntualidad. Como siempre tiene de buena costumbre seguir invirtiendo su dinero en la compra de más animales.
texts.en: Silvia is 39, and lives with her husband and their 2 children in her home.  They consider themselves to be a very united family.  Silvia works raising and selling animals.  She has been engaged in this activity for 13 years; she has set up a stable by her house for her animals where she fattens them until they reach an exact weight.  Later she takes them to the livestock market in her area.  In addition, she has farmland where she mostly cultivates alfalfa, which she feeds to her animals and also sells.  In her work, she always has the help of her children; they are in charge of cutting the alfalfa and caring for the animals.  Silvia enjoys this work because it allows her to be independent and in control of her time, and this motivates her to continue working hard in these activities.  "I appreciate being a part of a group of people where everyone treats each other like family," she comments, because over the years of working as a group with MFP, her communal bank has overcome a number of obstacles.  This bank has already been through 12 loan cycles, and everyone has demonstrated punctuality in their payments.  As always, she has the good habit of investing her money in her business by purchasing more animals.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up his business with the purchase of coconuts and watermelons.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es:
Fernando, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él administra una granja de pollos de engorde, el negocio consiste en la compra de pollos pequeños, los cuales engorda para comercializarlos, tiene 15 años de experiencia y se dedica a tiempo completo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos que estén pequeños, también comprara concentrado para alimentarlos y vacunas para la prevención de enfermedades, este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar la granja y a la vez aumentar la rentabilidad.
Su objetivo en el mediano plazo es comprarse su casita ya que actualmente alquila, también apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fernando lives with his wife and two children. He manages a farm where he raises chickens for fattening. His business involves buying young chickens and then fattening them for sale. Fernando has 15 years of experience and works at his business full-time.

At the moment, he is requesting a loan to buy young chickens. Fernando will also buy concentrated feed for his birds and vaccines for the prevention of diseases. This loan will help him expand his farm and increase his profitability.

His goal in the medium term is to buy a small house since he currently rents. Fernando also wants to support his children so that they can finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase young chickens, concentrated feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es natural D. Huancayo, disfruta D. la compañía D. sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 4 años tiene su tienda D. abarrotes, instalada en su misma casa y su experiencia D. años anteriores le ha servido para captar clientela. Es así que cada día atienD. su establecimiento con la ayuda D. sus hijos, mientras que ella también realiza otras actividades paralelas como es el tejido y bordados, siendo muy necesaria para los ingresos diarios. DesD. hace 20 años que enviudo ha logrado sola salir adelante, debido a su creatividad y habilidad para las ventas, hoy se siente orgullosa D. lo que ha logrado, tener una casa construida y sus hijos son personas D. bien. Ahora Yolanda sigue trabajando con esos mismo ánimos por lo que ha decidido abastecer su tienda con más mercadería. Es su novena vez que esta trabajando con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, un ejemplo para los demás integrantes del grupo solidarios a la que pertenece. Y en esta ocasión el dinero que solicita, estará destinado a la compra D. más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda is originally from Huancayo and enjoys living in her own home in the company of her five children. She opened a grocery store in her home four years ago and her previous years of experience have helped her attract customers. Yolanda manages her business each day with the help of her children. She also pursues other business activities at the same time, such as knitting and embroidery, because she feels that it is necessary for earning daily income. Since becoming a widow 20 years ago, Yolanda has been able to push forward by utilizing her creativity and sales abilities. Today she is proud of what she has accomplished, which includes building a house and raising her children to become good people. Yolanda continues to work with the same level of enthusiasm and now wants to restock her store with more merchandise.

This is the ninth time she has worked with MFP. Throughout this entire time, Yolanda has demonstrated that she is prompt with her payments and has become an example for the other members of her solidarity group to follow. On this occasion, the money she requested will be used to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rama Krichna

texts.fr:
Cliente de 30 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 2 et 12 ans. A l'obtention de son Brevet d'études Technique, n'ayant pas trouve du boulot elle ouvre un restaurant en début 2011, ou elle vend des plats de poissons d'eau douce, de poisson sale, de bouillon de viande et poissons grilles, du poulet. Elle vend en moyenne 60.000 a 80.000 fr par jour.

Des qu'elle va recevoir son prêt elle va faire des stocks et s'approvisionner en produits qu'elle n'arrive pas a acheter a cause des moyens, tel que cartons de queue de bœuf, cartons de morue, bidon de 25l d'huile, de la boisson, aménager son restaurant et ajouter quelques couverts. 

A l'avenir avec ses bénéfices, elle compte épargner et ouvrir un restaurant moderne afin de bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This customer is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged two to twelve. As she could not find a job after completing her Certificate in Technical Studies, she opened a restaurant in early 2011, where she sells dishes of freshwater fish, salted fish, meat broth, grilled fish and chicken. Her daily sales average 60,000 to 80,000 XAF.

As soon as she obtains her loan, she will build up her stock by procuring products she cannot buy for lack of funds such as boxes of oxtail and cod, 25-liter jugs of vegetable oil and beverages. She will also fix up her restaurant and add a few seats.

In the future, she wants to save her profits to open a modern restaurant in order to provide properly for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of oxtail, freshwater fish and salted fish.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elizabeth, vive con su esposo, se dedica a la venta de ropa y atiende al mismo tiempo una sala de belleza, estos negocios los tiene instalados  frente al mercado municipal, tiene un horario de 8:00am a 4:30 pm. 
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el inventario de mercadería, ya que con variedad en las prendas de vestir va a generar más ventas.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, tener a disposición de los clientes toda la mercadería posible, para mantener la clientela y su preferencia, así también en su vida familiar quiere ser madre en el corto plazo y finalizar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her husband. She sells clothing and manages a beauty salon at the same time. These businesses are located at the front of the municipal market. Her work schedule is from 8am to 4:30pm.

At the moment, Elizabeth needs a loan to buy new clothing. This investment will help improve her inventory of merchandise. By having a variety of clothes to offer, she will be able to generate more sales.

Her goals are to improve her business and to make all types of merchandise available to her customers so that she can maintain their loyalty and satisfy their preferences. In her family life, Elizabeth wants to focus on being a mother and in the short term finish her professional degree.

loans.use: to buy new blouses, skirts, shorts, and trousers to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap making materials such as palm oil, caustic soda, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of soaps for sale

loans.name: Jacqueline Bibiana

texts.es:
Jaqueline es una mujer nacida en Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, tiene cuarenta años y vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 14 y 16 años. Ella se separó de su cónyuqe y vive en casa de su madre. Lo más difícil para ella ha sido ser padre y madre ya que sola ha sabido criar y educar a sus hijos.

Hace 8 años inauguraron, junto a su madre, una tienda de abarrotes cerca de un popular colegio del cantón Santo Domingo. Este negocio ha servido para sustentar sus necesidades, pero los gastos de la educación y el costo de la vida se han elevado por lo que ella quiere hacer una inversión para comprar más variedad de mercadería y así poder venderla y tener mayores ingresos. Por esta razón ella acudió a la sucursal más cercana de Fundación Alternativa, para que la puedan ayudar con el crédito que podría cambiar su vida.

Toda la familia ayuda a atender el negocio incluso sus hijos cuando tienen tiempo libre, Jacqueline junto a su madre e hijos valoran mucho la unidad familiar por lo que tratan de compartir al máximo su tiempo. Ellos sueñan con tener su casa propia, pero el mayor sueño de Jacqueline es poder ver algún día a sus hijos con un título profesional.
texts.en:
Jacqueline was born in Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas. She is 43 years old and lives with her mother and her two children, ages 14 and 16. Jacqueline is separated from her husband and lives at her mother’s house. The greatest difficulty for her is having to play the role of both father and mother because she is the only one who has been able to raise her children and provide them with an education.

Along with her mother, Jacqueline opened a grocery store eight years ago near a busy school in the canton of Santo Domingo. This business has provided for her needs, but the educational expenses and cost of living have increased, so she needs to invest in a wider variety of merchandise to sell so that she can generate more income. For this reason, she went to the nearest branch of Fundación Alternativa to request the assistance of a loan that could change her life.

Everyone helps with operating the business, including the children whenever they have free time. Jacqueline, along with her mother and children, highly value being a family so they try to spend as much time together as possible. She and her children dream of having their own home, but Jacqueline’s greatest wish is to someday see her children earn professional degrees.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nuestra Solución Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuestra Solución” está conformado por 21 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación y venta de comida rápida, venta de perfumes, producción y venta de quesos, además de artesanía en madera, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción. 
Sonia integrante del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, siendo la primera socia de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo una chaqueta color amarillo y gorro color negro, se dedica a la fabricación de productos de artesanía, entre éstos aros, anillos, pulseras en macramé (tejido hecho con nudos de estructura parecida al encaje), además realiza bolsos y billeteras de cuero. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 6 años. Comenta que durante la temporada de invierno, las ventas han disminuido, debido a las huelgas estudiantiles, sin embargo comenta que a partir del mes de septiembre es una buena temporada, por lo que las ventas aumentan. Su horario es de 11:00 de la mañana hasta las 20:00 horas. 
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará materiales, específicamente lanas y cueros de diferentes colores y texturas. 
Sus metas son incrementar su negocio.
Ella vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 11 años de edad, sus sueños en general, son que su negocio prospere y le pueda brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Sonia está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, en especial de la calidez generada al interior del grupo del Banco comunal, comenta además que los emprendedores son muy trabajadores y comprometidos con sus negocios. 
La socia que aparece en el recuadro superior izquierdo, no pudo asistir a la sesión fotografica del grupo del Banco comunal, debido a un inconveniente personal que tuvo que resolver, es por esto que debió ausentarse durante la reunión. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Biobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Nuestra Solución” (Our Solution) and consists of 21 entrepreneurs who engage in business activities such as preparing and selling fast food, selling perfumes, making and selling cheese, making handicrafts out of wood, and other trades.  All of them are from the city of Concepción.

Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank.  In the photograph, she is the first person standing on the left-hand side wearing a yellow jacket and black cap.  She makes earrings, rings, and bracelets with macramé (fabric that is woven into a lace-like pattern).  Sonia also makes handbags and wallets out of leather.  She has been in this trade for six years. Sonia says that her sales diminish during the winter when students go on break.  However, she says the month of September is good for her because her sales go up at that time.  Her work schedule is from 11am to 8pm.  Her merchandise is generally sold to distributors.  With this loan, Sonia will buy materials, specifically wool and leather in different colors and textures.  Her goal is to increase her business.

Sonia lives with her husband and her 11-year-old son.  Her dreams in general are to prosper in her business and to provide her family a better quality of life.  Sonia is very pleased with and thankful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza, especially the kindness that is expressed by her Communal Bank group.  She says that the members are hardworking entrepreneurs who are committed to their businesses.  

The member who appears in the upper left hand corner could not attend the photo session of the communal bank due to a personal obligation that she had to resolve. It is for this reason that she was allowed to be absent during the meeting. 

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the largest in Chile.  It is located in the southern part of the country in the Biobío region.  Concepción played an important role in Chilean history.  It was the site of important battles and became a major settlement, especially during the Arauco War, since it lies on the border with the Mapuche territory.  Concepción now experiences significant economic and demographic development.  It is considered to be one of the urban areas that has developed into a major administrative, financial, and commercial center within Chile, just behind Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy wool and leather.

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas, vive solo con sus dos hijos, quienes dependen de ella, su negocio comenzó por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de proveer para sus hijos lo necesario, aprendió a hacer las pupusas donde una amiga y hoy en día atiende el negocio de 11:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las tortillas, como maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, también para dar mantenimiento a la cocina industrial, este préstamo le ayudara para cubrir sus necesidades pues pagara la reparación de la cocina y comprara los materiales necesarios para la pupuseria.
Su objetivo es comprarse su propia casa y trabajar con dinero propio, porque le gustaría tener un negocio independiente.
texts.en:
Ana sells “pupusas” and tortillas.  She lives alone with her two children who are dependent on her.  Ana started her business through her own initiative because she needed to provide for her children’s needs.  A friend taught her how to make “pupusas” and now she manages her business daily from 11am to 6pm.  

Ana is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies for making tortillas, such as corn, as well as pork and cheese.  She will also pay for the maintenance of her industrial stove.  This loan will be a great help in covering her needs such as paying to repair her stove and buying necessary supplies for her “pupusa” business.  

Her goals are to buy her own house and to work with her own money because she likes having an independent business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her industrial stove and to purchase corn, pork, and cheese.

loans.name: Yellow Group

texts.en:
Glay is in his mid-30s and married with four children who go to school.  He has been running a business that sells movie tapes, DVDs, CDs and VSS for 7 years now.  He works from 9am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his first loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to increase his business stock. His dream is to one day be able to have an international library. He will share this loan with his borrowing group "Yellow" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase his stock of movie tapes, DVDs, CDs and VSS for sale

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su familia, es soltera, ella trabaja en la tortillería para poder ayudar a sus padres, además de ahorrar para cubrir sus propias necesidades.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como: maíz y leña, para preparar la venta de las tortillas, este financiamiento le ayudara muchísimo para mantener el negocio y comprar el maíz por mayoreo obteniendo mejor precio.
Su aspiración es tener el negocio rentable, que le sustente las necesidades de su familia, en un futuro poder formar su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Reina sells tortillas. She is single and lives with her family. Reina manages a tortilla shop in order to help her parents. In addition, she is saving up money to cover her own needs.

Reina is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as corn and firewood, for preparing the tortillas that she will sell. This loan will be a great help in maintaining her business and buying corn in bulk so that she can obtain a better price.

Her aspiration is to have a profitable business that provides for the needs of her family. In the future, Reina would like to have a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel: tiene 72 años de edad es una persona que a luchado por salir adelante,y darles lo major a sus hijos, ella nos cuenta que se a dedicado a la venta de leña por pares y por mayor,lleva ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad,por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de leña ya que en los ultimos dias ha tenido barios pedidos de sus clientes y no alcanza surtirles la mayor parte,el sueño de ella es superarse en su negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Isabel is 72 years old. She has struggled to get ahead and give her children the best possible. She says that she has sold firewood both piecemeal and in bulk for several years. She asking for this loan to buy firewood as recently she has had several customer orders and not enough stock to fill the majority of the orders placed. Her dream is to excel in her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood in bulk.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida vive en su tierra natal al lado de su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Junto con su esposo decidieron hace 13 años aprovechar el patrimonio familiar que ambos tienen, es así que disponen de sus terrenos arcillosos para su fabrica de ladrillos. Los primeros años de trabajo fueron muy duros ya que  contrataron mano de obra, por lo cual significaría una ganancia minima. Con el paso de los años su negocio ha ido creciendo en capital y en la actualidad puede contratar mano de obra que hace más ligero el trabajo que le permite atender a sus hijos, esta fabrica familiar le ha permitido sostener a una familia numerosa y darles una calidad de vida. Por otro lado manifiesta que uno de los factores de crecimiento  de su negocio son los créditos anteriores. Ya son 16 ciclos de trayectoria de trabajo grupal que tiene con MFP,  de las cuales aprovechó adecuadamente para  el crecimiento progresivo que hoy disfruta. El dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de  mayor cantidad de insumos para fabricar sus ladrillos.
texts.en:
Zenaida lives in the place of her birth alongside her husband and their six children. She and her family own their home. Thirteen years ago, Zenaida and her husband decided to make use of the inheritances they received from both of their families by establishing a brickyard and using the clay that was available on their land. The first few years that they were in business were very difficult because they had to hire workers and gained minimal returns. As the years passed, their business grew as well as their capital. At the moment, Zenaida hires workers to help make the workload much lighter, which allows her to spend time with her children. This business helps support several family members and provides for their quality of life. Zenaida says that one of the factors that has helped her business grow is the availability of her previous loans.

She has already participated in 16 loan cycles with MFP as a member of her group. Zenaida has taken advantage of this support and has grown progressively to the point where she is at today. The money she is requesting will be invested in a large quantity of supplies for making bricks.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 17, 15 y 12 años D. edad, ella administra una tienda y también venD. tortillas, aprendió por una amiga y su negocio tiene 10 años D. existir, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 9:00pm, en la tienda.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para la tienda, porque necesita surtirla en huevo, pastas, pollo, aceite, arroz, sopas, bebidas y más artículos D. primera necesidad, su propósito es mantener D. todo lo que los clientes le demandan.
Para el futuro espera tener un negocio más granD., tener muchos clientes, y que su familia tenga una condición D. vida mejor.
texts.en:
Graciela lives with her husband and three children aged 17, 15 and 12.  She has a store and also sells tortillas.  She learned this business from a friend, and she has had this store for 10 years.  She works in the store from 6am until 9pm.  

Now she requests a loan to buy merchandise for her store, because she needs to stock it with eggs, pasta, chicken, cooking oil, rice, soups, drinks and other basic consumer goods.  Her goal is to have everything that her customers demand.

In the future she hopes to have a bigger business and a lot of customers, so that her family could have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy eggs, pasta, chicken, cooking oil, rice, soups and drinks to stock her business

loans.name: Konoussi

texts.fr:
Konoussi est âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée à un  professeur de golfe et est mère de trois enfants.
 
Elle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002.Elle revend des liqueurs  à Adakpamé et pour ce faire elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou (pays voisin : BENIN) 

Elle a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin de s’approvisionner en liqueur et augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Konoussi is 40 years old. She is married to a golf teacher and is a mother of three.

She has been working as a retailer since 2002. She resells liqueurs in Adakpamé; to this end, she gets her supplies in Cotonou (in neighbor country Benin.)

She has requested her first loan from WAGES to procure liqueurs and build up her stock.

loans.use: to purchase liqueurs.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena, se dedica a la venta de carne res y cerdo, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 20 años de edad, inicio el negocio por su hermana quien le enseño el negocio, vende desde hace 15 años en el mercado municipal, su horario de venta es de 6:00am a 4:30 pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 2 vacas o novillas, para el destazo, este préstamo le ayudara para poder adquirir más reces y continuar en el negocio.
Su objetivo es mantener siempre el negocio, que el financiamiento le fortalezca el negocio y poder generar ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena has a business selling beef and pork meat.  She lives with her husband and her 20 year-old son.  Her business was started by her sister, who taught her the business.  She has been selling for 15 years in the municipal market; she sells from 6am until 4:30pm.

Lorena is requesting a new loan to buy 2 cows or heifers to slaughter.  This loan will help her to acquire more cattle so she can continue with her business.

Her goal is to always keep her business going.  This loan will strengthen her business so that she can generate earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy  2 cows or heifers to slaughter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Claudia Emerita

texts.es:
Claudia, es una mujer de familia, vive con sus padres y hermanos, está soltera y en su familia son agricultores y también venden meriendas, su padre es agricultor y su madre vende las meriendas, ella colabora con ellos en las diferentes labores.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, para la siembra que por el momento tiene con su familia, este préstamo le ayudara muchísimo para comprarse el abono y fortalecer la siembra.
Su aspiración es tener cada año buenas cosechas, que con la ayuda de préstamo puedan brindar el cuido adecuado al cultivo, teniendo siempre la buena disposición de trabajar.
texts.en:
Claudia is a woman in a family. She lives with her parents, brothers and sisters. She is single and her family farms. They also sell snacks. Her father is a farmer and her mother sells snacks. She works with her family doing different jobs.
Actually, she is requesting this loan in order to buy agricultural products for planting crops. She is growing crops with her family. This loan would help a lot with the purchase of fertilizer and support for the plantings.
Her goal is to have a good harvest each year. With the help of this loan she can adequately support the plantings and therefore have the desire to work on the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the plantings.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.es: Rosemary: de 35 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas,tiene ya 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y le da gracias a Dios porque le ha Hido Vien En su negocio,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y verduras,ya que nececita mas mercaderia para surtir su puesto de ventas y tener mas bariedad,para satisfacer la nececidad de sus clentes.el sueño de ellas es tener un local mas grande y darles le nececario a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosemary is 35 years old, she has 2 children and she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been working in this area for 7 years already, and she "gives thanks to God" because her business has been going well for her. She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, as she needs more products to stock her stall and to offer a wider variety of products to satisfy her customers’ needs. Her dream is to own a bigger shop and to provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es: “San Carlos” es una alcancía comunal integrada por 7 personas responsables y emprendedoras las cuales trabajan bien con el programa. Violeta tiene 51 años de edad, su familia la conforman su esposo y sus dos hijos. Violeta se dedica al negocio de confecciones de calzados , empezó en el negocio hace 20 años, incursiono en este rubro debido a que trabajaba para terceras personas, de esta manera fue que aprendió el negocio, el deseo de progresar la llevo a que Violeta realice la confección de los zapatos por su cuenta en su hogar, para así poder tener mas ingresos económicos y sacar a sus hijos a delante pudiendo ellos llegar a ser unos profesionales, lo que ha logrado gracias al negocio ha sido construir su casa ya que ella indica que era unos de los sueños que tiene ,otro de los sueños que desea lograr es incursionar también en el negocio de la confección de ropa, el reciente préstamo lo desea utilizar para adquirir mas material y así poder confecciona mas calzado y poder hacer su sueño realidad. La alcancía comunal “San Carlos” agradece su ayuda.
texts.en: San Carlos” is a community bank with seven responsible and entrepreneurial members. They all work well with this program. Violet is 51 years old. Her family includes her husband and their two children. Violet makes shoes. She started this business 20 years ago. After training with another shoemaker, she ventured into this field of work. In this way she learned the business. A desire to progress allowed Violet to start making shoes on her own in her home. This way she can have more earnings and help her children progress. She wants her children to be professionals. Thanks to her business she was able to build their house. That was one of the dreams that she had. Her other dream is to start making clothes. With this loan she would like to buy more material in order to make more shoes. In this way she can realize her dream. The “San Carlos” Community Bank thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy material to make shoes.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 37 años, vive con sus hijos y su esposa. En la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades para su familia vio que la mejor salida es a través del comercio de productos de acuerdo a la temporada del año y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio de manera ambulante, permitiéndole tener ganancias semanales. Con la ayuda de su esposa desarrolla estas actividades, y se vale de un  medio de transporte que es un triciclo, para poder trasladar sus productos a diversas calles de su ciudad. Después de un día de trabajo, por lo general terminan muy cansados pero con todos los deseos de seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su familia y concretar lo que se han propuesto, el de incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, le recomendaron unos familiares para que pueda mejorar su capital de trabajo. El dinero que solicita, será para comprar más productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 37 years old living with his wife and children.  Seeking new opportunities for his family he found a better way out through commerce of seasonal merchandise and since then has been a street vendor of such items producing weekly profits for him.  His wife helps him carry out these activities and he uses a means of transportation, a three-wheeled cart, to move his products from street to street in his city.
