After a day of work they finish tired but with a strong desire to continue working for the benefit of their family and reach the goals they’ve set for themselves: to increase working capital.

This is his time he’s asked for an MFP loan.  He was recommended by some relatives so that he can improve his working capital.  The money he’s requesting will be to buy more merchandise to stock his business.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Les Colombes 1, 2 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Jacquelyne est la coordonatrice de son groupe Colombes. Elle n’est pas mariée elle a  d’enfant. Jacquelyne habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti 

Jacquelyne a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce, elle  etait a l’ecole

ELLE voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du tennis. JACQUELYNE espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Les autres membres Colombes ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.

Jacquelyne dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Elle dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness.
texts.en:
Jacquelyne is the organizer of her group, Colombes. She is not married and does not have children. Jacquelyne lives in the town of Ouanaminthe in Haiti.

Jacquelyne has been managing her business for the past six years. Before launching this business, she was at school.

She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of tennis shoes. Jacquelyne hopes that this loan will help her grow her business.

The other members of group Colombes need loans for such ventures as selling coal, rice, and second-hand clothes.

Jacquelyne says that her main challenge is the lack of regular customers. She says that her main objective is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Adjowa est âgée de 46 ans.Elle est mariée à un déclarant en douane. Elle est mère de 04(quatre enfants).	

Elle travaille comme revendeuse.Elle revend des produits d’alimentation générale  au marché d’Akodessewa et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.

Elle a requis son deuxième crédit à WAGES afin de  s’approvisionner en produits d’alimentation générale comme la tomate, le lait, les pâtes alimentaires.
texts.en:
Adjowa is 46 years old. She is married to a customs specialist. She is a mother of four.

She works as a retailer. She sells groceries at the market in Akodessewa and gets her supplies from the Grand Market in Lome.

She has requested her second loan from WAGES to stock up on groceries such as tomatoes, milk and pasta.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, es motorista de un bus, también es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo de 6 años de edad, tiene 5 años de ser motorista y al cultivo agrícola se dedica desde hace 10 años, de estas ocupaciones ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo, esta compra le ayudara para tener los insumos agrícolas que fortalezcan y produzcan buenos frutos en la siembra.
Para Manuel su propósito es sacar a su hijo adelante, velar por las necesidades de el, por esta razón se esfuerza diariamente para conseguir los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
Manuel drives a bus. He is also a farmer. He lives with his wife and they have one child that is 6 months old. He has been working as a driver for the past five years. He has been growing crops for the past ten years. In this way he can support his family.
Actually, he is requesting this loan in order to buy fertilizer for his crops. This loan will help him buy the agricultural products her needs to support and produce good fruit at harvest time. 
Manuel wishes to help his son be successful. He struggles to provide for his necessities. This is why he makes a good effort everyday to obtain the necessary income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Pv Pub Group

texts.en:
Shani is in her mid-30s and married with four children who go to school. She has been running a business selling fried chicken and chips for 6 years now. She works from 5pm to midnight (evening only) and is able to make a small monthly profit.
 
This will be her first loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more chicken and a sack of potatoes for her business. Her dream is to one day be able to have a good hotel for selling different types of foods.

She will share this loan with her loan group "PV Pub" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and a sack of potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 15-15-15 fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo  servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Pítipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona tiene como actividad agricultura y ganadería.

Guillermo desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos, gallinas y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que sus animales llegan a su crecimiento óptimo podrá ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su casa.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y para el mantenimiento de sus tierras, con la finalidad de que pueda tener más variedad de animales y mejor producto, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Guillermo es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca cada vez más y brindarle más comodidades a su familia en casa.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and his child in their own house. The house only has electricity. It is located in the Pitipo District in the department of Lambayeque. This is an area known for farming and ranching.
For many years Guillermo has been raising and selling animals (pigs, chickens and ducks). His pens are located behind his house. He feeds the animals with balanced food and natural grains. When his animals have matured he sells them at different markets in his area. This is how he makes good earnings in order to pay for his household expenses. He also has land where he grows corn.
He is requesting this loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 new soles in order to buy animals and to maintain his land. His goal is to have a greater variety of animals and a better product. With the earnings that he will have he will be able to cover the cost of his loan and improve his quality of life. Guillermo is a hardworking and earnest person. The only thing he wants is that his business grows each year. In this way he can bring more comfort to his family and his home.

loans.use: to buy animals and for the maintenance of his farm land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's college fees and school materials

loans.name: Dagni

texts.es:
Dagni de 30 años de edad, vive con sus hijas en casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en  el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece a la provincia de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Dagni se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Dagni es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dagni is 30 years old and lives with her daughters in her parent's home which only has electricity. It is located in the district of Tambogrande which is part of the Piura province. This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.  

Over the last few years Dagni has sold groceries including milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs and beverages. She runs her business from home because it is a comfortable and safe option. With the profits she makes from this business she tries to cover her costs and improve her family's standard of living. 

To expand her business, Dagni is applying for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more groceries. She would like her business to grow and to have more products to offer her customers to cover the loan and her home expenses. Dagni is responsible, dedicated and hardworking, and aims to provide her children with greater comfort in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk to replenish her store's supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 40 anos vive en Santa Clara de Quichinche en Otavalo, es soltera vive junto a su hijo que tiene 12 anos, es perseverante y luchadora.

Siempre se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales sola, le va muy bien y solicita el prestamo  para la compra de pollos es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI, gracias a este prestamo creceria su moral y se ayudaria a crecer economicamente a su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old, single, and lives in Santa Clara de Quichinche in Otavalo with her 12 year old son. She is perseverant and has a fighting spirit. 

Maria has always worked caring for animals and does very well from it. She is now applying for a loan to buy chickens and this is the first time that she has worked with FODEMI. This loan will improve her morale and help her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a large chicken pen for her chickens

loans.name: Jose Aurelio

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona urbana del distrito de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser muy comercial y turística.

José brinda el servicio de veterinario, tratando de disminuir las dolencias de los animales que atiende diariamente, contando con una experiencia de 5 años en el rubro, su negocio lo a colocado en el domicilio donde vive, cuenta con su propia clientela.  Para seguir realizando un buen servicio como siempre ha solicitado un préstamo a  Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de jaulas que le ayudarán en el transporte de los animales cuando los tenga que llevar a sus dueños y con los ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia.

Con mucho trabajo y empeño desea José que su negocio crezca y pueda ser reconocido por el buen servicio que brinda a los clientes como a sus mascotas.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own house, where they have basic utilities. Their house is located in the urban zone of the district of Chiclayo, an area known for being very commercial and touristy.

José provides veterinary services. He tries to treat the conditions suffered by the animals that he sees daily, and he has five years of experience in this work. His business is located in the house where he lives and he has his own clients. In order to continue offering the same good service he always has, José has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase cages that will help him to transport animals when he has to bring them to their owners. With the income, he will be able to cover his loan and to improve his family's quality of life.

José hopes that through a lot of work and effort, he will be recognized for the good service that he offers to both his clients and their pets.

loans.use: to buy cages for transporting the animals he treats at his veterinary clinic

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Celia Emelina

texts.es:
Celia, vive con sus tres hijos D. 10, 15 y 16 años D. edad, ella administra una tienda y venD. tamales, la señora trabaja todos los días D. 6:00am a 7:00pm, atendiendo el negocio, tiene 6 años D. estar dedicada junto a su esposo.
Ella necesita invertir en productos D. primera necesidad para el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar jabón, detergentes, arroz, frijoles, huevos, aceite, estos materiales son muy necesarios para atender la demanda y brindar un buen servicio.
Su aspiración es que a través del negocio pueda ayudar a sus hijos para que se formen académicamente y logren superarse.
texts.en:
Celia lives with her three children, ages 10, 15 and 16.  She has a store and sells tamales every day, with a work schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She has been in the business for six years with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic products for the store such as soap, detergents, rice, beans, eggs and oil.  These items are in much demand and allow her to proviD. a good service.

Her goal is to work hard enough to be able to help her sons get an education and become successful.

loans.use: To buy products such as soap, detergents, rice, beans, eggs and oil.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo el servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 3 años aproximadamente Paula se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesdad como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc) y de combustible, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías y cubrir otros gastos personales, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Paula es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su esposa.
texts.en:
Paula, 46, lives with her husband in her own house which only has electricity.  It is located in the district of Mórrope which belongs to the department of Lambayeque.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and artisan craft activity.

For approximately three years Paula has been selling basic need items such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, tuna, eggs, etc., as well as fuel.  She runs her business out of her house for comfort and safety reasons.  Her earnings are used to cover household expenses and improve lifestyle.

In order to expand her business she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise and pay for personal expenses.  Her only goal is to increase business and offer more products to her customers, and pay back the loan and meet household obligations.  Paula is a responsible, dedicated, hard-working person who does all she can to make her husband more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store and cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Rosa Del Milagro

texts.es:
Rosa de 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Rosa se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboración y venta de pan, actividad que realiza todos los días en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela fija, es conocida en la zona donde vive por el buen producto que ofrece, con los ingresos que perciba podrá solventar sus gastos personales.

Para que su negocio siga creciendo ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles la compra de insumos para la preparación de pan al igual que utensilios, con la finalidad de que la venta de pan no disminuya y al generar ganancias podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado y permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.  Rosa con trabajo y dedicación desea salir adelante para poder más realizar estudios superiores y seguir ayudando a sus padres en los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 22, is single and lives with her parents.  The home only has electricity and is located in Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock farming and artisan craft activity.  

For three years Rosa has been baking and selling bread for a living.  She works every day in her home and has a fixed customer base.  She is very well known in the area because of her good products.  She uses her income to cover personal expenses.  

In order for her business to continue growing she has requested a loan in the amount of 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  She will buy supplies for bread-making as well as utensils in order to keep bread sales up.  With the profits she makes she will be able to pay back the loan and improve her lifestyle.  With hard work and dedication Rosa wants to get ahead in order to get a higher education and help her parents cover household expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies and utensils to make bread.

loans.name: Kansé

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kansé a plus de 32 ans, marié et père de deux enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Kansé, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié aux activités de commerce de l’habillement notamment aux prêt-à- porter dont il dispose d’une boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y'a environ quatre ans.  Il est à son quatrième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 20 chemises différentes, 17 pantalons de qualités différentes, 20 paires de chaussures différentes (Souliers, Ferardine, etc.), 4 complets de veste, 8 T-Shirts et 3 complets de sous-vêtement. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de voyageurs et surtout de routiers.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kansé is over 32 years of age, married and a father of two. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
After unsuccessfully trying his hand at different activities, Mr. Kansé learned the trade of clothing retail, primarily in ready-to-wear, which he sells in his shop at the Sikasso bus station. He is very much in demand with his clients thanks to the quality of his products.
To satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso about four years ago. He is on his fourth individual loan, after correctly repaying the previous three.
This new loan will make it possible for him to buy 20 different shirts, 17 pairs of trousers of varying quality, 20 different pairs of shoes (from brands such as Souliers, Ferardine, etc.), 4 suits, 8 T-shirts and 3 underwear sets. He gets his products from wholesalers in Bamako before retailing to a clientele generally composed of travelers and of many drivers.
With this loan, he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 300,000 FCFA, which will mainly be used to contribute to the family's expenses and to pay his loan's interests, with the remainder to be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Moko

texts.fr:
Moko  est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est divorcée. Elle est maman d’un enfant.
 
Elle travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2008.Elle est distributrice et s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé.

Elle a requis son premier crédit  à WAGES afin de s’approvisionner en pagnes pour répondre aux goûts des acheteurs.
texts.en: Moko is 43 years old. She is divorced and the mother of one child. She has been working at selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 2008. She is a distributor and gets her supplies from the Grand Market of Lomé. Moko has requested an initial loan from WAGES in order to stock up on pagne cloth to respond to buyers' tastes.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Lila Guisela

texts.es:
Lila de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hija en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Oyotun que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica al comercio al por mayor y menor, pero también  al turismo.

Lila desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (chanchos, patos y cuyes), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y alfalfa para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y mejoramiento de su casa, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Lila es una mujer que con esfuerzo y trabajo saca a su familia adelante junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Lila, 37, lives with her husband and daughter in their own home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the district of Oyotun which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  This area is active in wholesale and retail trade and tourism.

For several years Lila has been raising and selling farm animals such as pigs, ducks and guinea pigs.  Her farmyard is behind the house and is large and   purpose-built.  She gives the animals balanced feed and alfalfa so they develop optimally and can be sold at the different markets in the area.  This provides a good income for household expenses.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and make home improvements.  With the earnings from animal sales she will pay back the loan and improve her lifestyle.  Lila is a woman who works hard with her husband so her family can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more animals and make home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies, snacks, bread, beverages and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and natural products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maimounata

texts.fr:
Madame Maimounata est une femme mariée de 30 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, cette femme s’est initiée à une activité génératrice de revenus qui est la teinture, à Sikasso avec une teinturière de la place il y a environ quatre ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (Mariage, baptême, fêtes, etc.). 
Ses ressources propres ne pouvant pas lui permettre de satisfaire ses besoins, elle sollicite ce prêt auprès de Soro Yiriwaso, pour acheter 10 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 boites de teintures de couleurs différentes et 12 sachets de soude caustique afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.    
 Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les commerçants en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teinture) pour les mettre dans les différentes couleurs. Bien teintés les bazins sont ensuite revendus soit au comptant et à crédit, elle a pour client(e)s potentiel(le)s, les revendeuses des bazins teintés, les couturiers et les femmes de son quartier.
Madame Maimounata  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ huit années Après 4 prêts solidaires dans une association des femmes de son quartier et elle est maintenant à son 8ème prêt individuel et tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, payer les intérêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Ms. Maimounata is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso city (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Four years ago, after having run several businesses unsuccessfully, this woman became familiar with a revenue-generating business, which is the dying of cloth, in Sikasso with a local expert. She enjoys a strong reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, holidays, etc.) 

Because her own resources cannot allow her to meet her needs, she is requesting this loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to buy 10 lengths of white damask cloth, 10 containers of dyes of different colors, and 12 pouches of caustic soda in order to satisfy her ever-growing customer base. She gets her supplies locally from merchants supplying the raw ingredients (white damask, caustic coda, and dyes) and places them into the different dyes. The dyed damask is then sold, either for cash or on credit. Her potential customers are retailers of dyed damask, tailors, and women in her neighborhood. 

Ms. Maimounata has had an association with Soro Yiriwaso for about eight years. After four solidarity loans in a women's association in her district, she is now on her eighth individual loan. The previous loans have all been repaid correctly. 

She plans on making an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be put toward covering family expenses by helping out her husband, paying the loan interest, and bolstering her cloth dying business.

loans.use: to buy white damask, caustic soda, and containers of dye

loans.name: Rosita Yene

texts.es:
Rosita es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, vive con su hija en casa unos familiares, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Rosita desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  
Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenga pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija.  Rosita es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente para brindarle los estudios deseados.
texts.en: Rosita is 32 and lives with her daughter in a house that lacks basic services, in the rural district of Olmos, Lambayeque.  This region is known for its agriculture, cattle raising and handcrafts.  Four years ago, Rosita began raising corral livestock outside her home, using balanced feed and natural pasture to fatten animals for market.  This business allows her to cover household expenses.  She now seeks a credit from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles to buy additional animals and feed to grow her business.  Rosita is hard-working and very responsible and wants to provide better conditions and opportunities for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komlan est âgé de 28ans.Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
	
Il travaille comme revendeur de portables depuis 2010.Il revend des portables au feu rouge de moov sur les pavées vers le grand marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé chez des grossistes.

Il a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin de s’approvisionner en portables.
texts.en:
Komlan, 28, is single and has no children. He has been working selling cell phones since 2010. He sells his cell phones at the Moov traffic light on the pavement going toward the big market and buys his wares in  Lomé from wholesalers. 

He has requested his first loan from WAGES so that he can stock up on cell phones.

loans.use: to buy cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare his farm land to plant corn. He will purchase urea, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: David Fernando

texts.es:
David, se dedica a atender una panadería, tiene 10 años de estar en el negocio, está casado y es padre de un niño de 2 años, el negocio de David es por herencia de sus padres, quienes tenían el negocio desde un inicio.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de harina, huevos y leña, estos materiales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan, la inversión le ayudara para incrementar la producción y generar mayores ventas.
El objetivo de David es hacer crecer la panadería, fortalecerla y llegar a nuevas zonas donde se reconozca a nuevos clientes que le demanden más mercadería.
texts.en:
David is the manager of a bakery. He has been in business for 10 years. He is married and he is the father of a 2-year old boy. David inherited his business from his parents. They had the business since its beginning.

He requests a loan to purchase flour, eggs, and firewood. These products are necessary to make break. This investment will help him to increase production and to generate more sales.

David's objective is to expand his bakery, to strengthen it and to span out into new regions to reach new clients and to sell more products.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, and firewood to bake bread.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pupusas y administra una tienda, lleva 6 años en el negocio, su fuerte son las pupusas, tortillas y bebidas, inicio este negocio hace muchos años y fue su madre quien le enseño a realizarlo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz al por mayor, también productos como chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, gaseosas y jugos, con esta compra tendrá material suficiente para la elaboración de las tortillas, pupusas y también bebidas para atender mejor a los clientes.
Su objetivo es que el negocio este fuerte, tener todo lo necesario para atender la demanda de los clientes, al igual que desea que le genere mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marina lives with her husband and their son. She sells tortillas and pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made of thick corn dough stuffed with savory ingredients), and she also administers a store business. She has been in business for 6 years and the high sellers are pupusas, tortillas, and drinks. She started out this business many years ago and it was her mother who taught how.

She requests a loan to purchase corn in wholesale and to purchase products such as pork meat, fresh cheese, cooking oil, soft drinks, and juices. With this purchase she will have enough products to make tortillas, pupusas, and she will also have enough drinks to better serve her clients. Her objective is to strengthen her business and to have all that is necessary to meet her clients' demand. She also wants to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat, fresh cheese, cooking oil, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Maria Estefania

texts.es:
Maria tiene 20 anos actualmente vive en Otavalo con sus padres es soltera y no tiene hijos, es totalmente feliz y muy sonadora.

Trabaja en una tienda hace un ano empezo a trabajar con sus padres y lo sigue haciendo, el prestamo que requiere es para abastecer a su tienda con viveres, es la segunda vez que trabaja con FODEMI lo esta haciendo por un tiempo de 10 meses, el prestamo le ayuda a incrementar sus ingresos y entre sus principales suenos esta el de tener otros negocios y poder acabar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old now and still lives with her parents in Otavalo. She is single, has no children, and is totally happy, and very much the dreamer. 

Maria has worked in her store for a year now. She began working with her parents and still does so. The loan she needs is to resupply her store with groceries. This is the 2nd time she has collaborated with FODEMI. The time period involved is 10 months. The loan will help her increase her income.

Among her principal dreams is to have other stores and to be able to complete her studies.

loans.use: supply her general store with groceries.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis, tiene la edad 37 de  años, está soltero y vive con sus padres con la conyugue y una hijastra. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con un terreno sembrado de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexis is 37 years old, single, and lives with his wife and a stepdaughter in his parents' house. He intends to invest the loan in his coffee plot. 

Alexis has land planted with coffee trees and he wants to invest in supplies such as manure and fungicides to obtain a better harvest. Alexis wants to develop a coffee plot with good production and to sell a quality coffee. He wishes to generate the largest possible harvest in order to earn more income and improve his wellbeing and that of his family, and to expand his coffee project.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. Alexis has had no previous loans with state banks. FUDOCOSUR has offered this loan on the best terms with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy manure and fungicides to improve the quality and productivity of his coffee trees.

loans.name: Always Ready Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the group leader of these five entrepreneurs. Isatu is 40 years old and was born in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Isatu sells cooked rice with fish, meat and vegetables. She has been working in this business for 15 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil, tomatoes, fish, etc. in bulk to produce a large quantity of cooked rice for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, palm oil, tomatoes, fish, etc. in bulk to produce a large quantity of cooked rice for sale

loans.name: Munduli Group

texts.en:
Sinajumu is in her early 50s and married with four children, two of whom go to school, and two grand children, one of whom goes to school.  She has been running a business selling fruits and vegetables, plus dry food like wheat flour, sugar and baking flour (this business is called genge duka). She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first Motisha loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She wants a loan to increase her business. Her dream is to one day be able to add two other rooms to her house. She has built two rooms so far and she wants to be able to have four rooms altogether.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Munduli B" which has a total of 10 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits, vegetables and dry foods

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. pupusas y ropa,  vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 16, 18 y 23 años D. edad, ella administra en su vivienda una tienda, por las tardes venD. pupusas y además sale a ofrecer ropa en los pueblos cercanos.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ropa, también productos para el negocio como aceite,  frijoles, chicharron y quesillo, estos materiales le ayudaran para mantener surtido el negocio y atender la demanda D. los clientes.
El objetivo D. María, es que su negocio tenga la capacidad para atender las necesidades D. los clientes y pueD. tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria sells Salvadoran-style stuffed tortillas and also, clothing. She lives with her husband and 3 children, aged 16, 18, and 23, and operates a general store in her house. In the afternoon, she sells stuffed tortillas and, in addition, goes out to sell clothing in nearby towns.

Now, Maria is requesting a loan to buy clothing and also, products for her business, such as cooking oil, beans, pork cracklings, and tortillas with cream cheese. These supplies will assist her in maintaining her business and supplying customer demand.

Maria's objectives are for her business to have the capacity to proviD. what customers want and to increase her earnings.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, beans, pork cracklings, and tortillas stuffed with cream cheese to make 'pupusas', and to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria Carlas

texts.es:
Ana, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su familia, su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 18, 15, 10 y 7 años de edad, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse al negocio, ha logrado mantener a sus hijos de los ingresos que le genera el negocio.
Actualmente necesita invertir en mercadería para ello solicita un préstamo que cubra la demanda que los clientes le generan, en compra de blusas para jóvenes y adultos, ropa interior, faldas y pantalones.
Este préstamo le ayudara para surtir el negocio con mercadería nueva, su aspiración es que del negocio logre sacar adelante a sus hijos y que puedan formarse académicamente para que tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Ana sells clothes.  She lives with her family, her husband and her four children; ages 18, 15, 10, and 7.  She has been working in this business for several years.  She has managed to support her children with the income generated by her business.

She currently needs to invest in merchandise.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will cover the demand generated by her customers.  She will buy blouses for young women and adults, underwear, skirts, and pants.  This loan will help her stock her business with new merchandise.

Her goal is that through the business she gets her children ahead.  She wants them to be able to have an education so that they have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy blouses for young women and adults, underwear, skirts, and pants.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, es agricultor, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura sembrando yuca y maíz para consumo familiar y para comercializar, él aprendió desde joven junto a su padre.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo son los fertilizantes, ya que en la agricultura son muy importantes para fortalecer la plantación y que produzca mejor cosecha.
Su aspiración es que el cultivo sea abundante en la producción, ampliar el terreno de cultivo para tener mejores posibilidades de generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Cruz is a farmer.  He lives with his family, his wife and children.  

He has been farming for 15 years.  He grows yucca and corn for the family’s consumption and to sell. When he was young, Cruz learned from his father.

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizers.  In farming it is very important to fortify the fields to produce a better harvest.

His hope is that he produces abundant crops and that he expand his fields in order to have improved possibilities for generating income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales:  corn, chicken, oil, and condiments.
